text: 0Flaska bishops Örebro. Gul kulör. Doft av hö, aprikos och äpple. Småtorr och örtig smak. Övermogna äpplen och jäst.

[330ml bottle]
Pours a slightly cloudy almost-amber colored body. Creamy, bubbly beige head that lasts. 

Aroma is really dull. Im not getting much. But theres a real thick head on it afterall. 
I get some subtle grassy and malty notes. 

Taste is rounded and malty at first but then that belgian yeast, spice and a sharp citrus comes through. 

Its still a pretty balanced Tripel. Not what Im used to.

Copenhagen 16/6 2017. 75 cl bottle from Meny. Usual Abbey design with a shield with a cross on it and such effects. Pours lightly hazy light amber wit big white head. Settles as 1 cm thick layer of thick foam. Moderate lacing. Aroma is sweet malts and humid basement with some marzipan and sharp sour notes. A prominent alcoholic streak. Medium carbonation and medium thick palate. Flavor is medium sweet followed by quite strong bitterness. Aftertaste is bitter and rather boozy where you notice the considerable ABV. Dry finish. Muscular no-nonsense Belgian which can sweep your legs away and get you seriously drunk.

Bottle @ Home. Pours golden with a huge offwhite head. Aroma of malt, yeast, caramel, candy sugar, sweet fruit. Flavor is sweet, malt, caramel, candy sugar, sweet fruit, alcohol. Medium body, average to lively carbonation, sweet and light bitter finish. 6-3-7-3-14. 150617

Golden red, clear. Aroma is caramel, not so strong on the typical belgian yeastines. Not high on carbonation. Sweet and quite bitter at the end, at least for a tripel. A tripel with a slight touch of a quadrupel, so to speak.

Pours clear orange/golden with a big, foamy, lasting, white head. The aroma contains caramel, malt, honey, fruits, grass and spices. It tastes medium sweet and light bitter with a dry, spicy finish, but the sweetness wins in the end. Medium body, oily texture, fizzy carbonation, alcoholic finish. A good brew.

Bière ambrée avec une belle mousse bien blanche avec un nez assez fruité, un goût qui rappelle un peu la pêche ou labricot, elle est assez pétillante, le goût reste bien en bouche, elle est assez ronde, une bonne bière qui donne quand même bien son alcool (10°), donc à déguster avec parcimonie. Bonne bière
Hazy bronze with sediment floatin around. Light honey and corn flakes aroma. Long lasting tripel taste. Not so big on character, but long full finish is the highlight.
very acceptable tripel with a slight alcoholic taste and the standard belgian yeasty goodness. You know what to expect here more or less.

W aromacie szampan, estry, żółte owoce, białe owoce, białe wino, całkiem przyjemnie. W wyglądzie bursztynowe, klarowne, z bardzo obfitą, białą pianą. W smaku słodkie, szampańskie, do tego białe wino, żółte owoce, białe owoce, lekko alkoholowe. Pijalność bardzo wysoka, lekkie i smukłe. Bardzo dobry tripel

75 cl bottle poured in to a Trappist glass. Hazy amber colour with golden hues and a big, fluffy off-white head. Rich fruity aroma with yeasts, caramel malts, candid sugar, a sweet fruitiness and lingering lightly toasted note. Taste is sweet. Full body with an oily texture and an average carbonation. Finishes slightly dry with caramel malts and fruity-spicy notes. A wiff of alcohol. Very enjoyable textbook Tripel.

Draft at BEL. Surprisingly dark mostly clear copper with a lasting white head. Aroma is caramel, malty and bready, spicy Belgian yeast. Flavor is malty, caramel and bread, somewhat sweet, pretty nice. Medium plus bodied and smooth feel. Nice, but was inferior side by side with the La Trappe tripel.
Aroma and flavor is Belgian yeast, spritzy, fruit, malts and a spicy/alcoholic finish. Classic Tripel.
Aroma of caramel malt and a light spice note. Fullbodied mouthfeel.taste of dried fruits,malt ,dry and a slight bitter.

Amber color, large white head. Sweet aromas with sugar, peaches, apricot, yeast and slight alcohol. Taste of caramel, peaches, candy sugar, alcohol, raisins and citrus. Sweet and balanced taste. I like it.

A lot of apricot and peach in the aroma, classic Belgian fruitiness, a bit of alcohol. Taste is a bit like cointreau mixed with characteristic dryness, a bit of bread. Although It has 10% alcohol, it is not upfront. Decent classic beer.
Nice pillowy head marmalade orange taste candied orange peel alcohol poached pear.well done for the style.
Bottle. Nice orangish colour, fruity and spicy, smooth and relaxing white foam,high alcoholic strength but nevertheless easy draught. Shortly, definitely above average, fine beer !
33 cl bottle purchased @ La caisse de bière. Une grosse déception car cette bière manque déquilibre.

Uit het Buikflesje een donker amberkleurige body met zacht wit schuimpje dat over gaat een veter geurend naar brood mout en fenolen ook in de drink daarnaast een zacht bittertje de co2 duwt details smaken na die vol en ook vluchtig maken

Butelka. Piana obfita, biała, drobno i średniopęcherzykowa, opada powoli do cienkiej warstwy na powierzchni całego piwa, koronkowanie słabe. Barwa ciemnozłota, opalizujące. Aromat średniointensywny, brzoskwinia, alkohol. Goryczka średnia. W smaku likier brzoskwiniowy, delikatnie kwaśne. Pełnia średnia, nasycenie średnie.

Piwo bursztynowe w barwie, klarowne. Wysycenie średnie do wysokiego, piana obfita, drobno i średniopęcherzykowa, średnio trwała, zostawiająca ładną koronkę na szkle. W aromacie nuty chlebowe, gdzieś w tle wyczuwalne owoce i mała nuta karmelu. W smaku na te doznania nakłada się dość konkretny akcent alkoholowy. Mimo wszystko jednak nie jest to alkohol odrzucający, gdyż piwo jest w miarę pełne i lekko słodkawe, co kontruje trochę alkohol.
UPDATED: MAR 5, 2017 Arômes de pain, robe cuivrée, mousse blanche abondante, persistente et compacte. En bouche, beaucoup de corps, amertume modérée, for goût de pain.
classique. triple au gout léger et fruité, mais lalcool y est. facile à boire. amertume raisonnable.

Pours hazy orange. The head is foamy and lingers for much of the duration. The aroma is dank, ladened with caramel, spice, hints of alcohol. Taste is malty sweet, butterscotch, bready, some alcohol. Okay, but I had higher expectations.

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2017 Grainy honey floral
Clearish orange body with 2 finger white head sticking.
Medium body medium high carbonation.
No hint of the 10℅ .
Good..
Update to sweet for my liking
Bottle. Golden in color with the aroma of dried fruit esters, Belgian spice, and farmhouse ale notes. It was poured with a big frothy white head. Very smooth and well balanced.

Bottle. Pours murky orange/light brown. Plentry of creamy white foam. Smells like yeast, hops, alcohol. Tastes like yeats, fruit, pepper and spices, caramel. The alcohol is hidden well. The mouthfeel is crazy smooth and juicy. You would except the punch from esters. But the beer is far from abrasive.There is some pale ale accents. Great spicy hoppiness. Low to medium carbonation. I really, really like it.

Bottle. Deep gold in colour. Fruity (apples, pears, citrus), spicy (slightly peppery), hoppy (perfumy, floral hops) tripel. Malty base (caramel & toffee). Sweet fruity taste; no bitterness. Smooth and, surprisingly, rather soft and light. Drying malty finish. Very easy to drink considering high ABV. Good. (2008)
UPDATED: FEB 10, 2017 Heavy alcohol. Oranges, bread, yeast, coriander seeds. Some spiciness. Balanced, even if the alcohol is somewhat burning. Big beer though, very good.

Bottle, fosdem. Unpoured. Scent is slightly skunky pale malt. Taste is dense Tripel yeast with loads of flavors of pepper seasoning. Some bitter qualities but also a fair bit of sort of vanilla sweetness. Finish is ethanol. Great.
What a great beer. Color of hazelnut clear (filtered) and a small white head. A round tast. Caramel a little bit of fruits and a long, nice bitter aftertast. Great
Fruity aroma, nice white foam. First taste is caramel, then bitterness. Rather carbonated. Overall good tripel.

Color ámbar, medianamente turbio, con capa de espuma blanca de más de tres dedos de grosor (textura cremosa y muy buena retención). Carbonatación a tope, casi efervescente en boca. No mucho cuerpo. Aroma frutal (plátano), floral, especiado y con un poco de alcohol. Sabor que sigue al aroma, algo más dulce que en otras Tripel, sin mucho amargor final y con regusto mínimamente alcohólico tipo ginebra. Tripel sabrosa y muy bien hecha.

Notes of yeast, banana, some citrus but also caramel (?), amber with a good ocher head, medium body, medium carbonation, taste is good but very atypical with caramel again and dried fruits with a very dry final...not bad but is a very strange tripel.

Butelka 330ml. Kolor pomarańczowy, piana średnia, osiada na szkle. Aromat karmelu, owoców i drożdży, w smaku słód i alkohol, suszone śliwki. Goryczka w normie, wysycenie duże, dobry trippel ale nie rewelacyjny.
A fine example of an extra strong triple. Very smooth and hides the alcohol content well. Lovely.

I know this beer is basically 100% rated but I still think its a little bit underrated. My friends said its not that great after Id already said it was good which perhaps makes me want to defend it more than is reasonable but I genuinely believe this beer is up there. In true Belgian style this is a strong one. Bready, golden notes. Not such a big head.

retty nice Tripel. Nice dark yellow color, consistent white head, good aroma: overall, a lot of sugar and white malts. Taste is pretty sweet. Medium body, thin texture, lively carbonation, long finish. Overall, an average Belgian ale, nothing much to be added.
Bottle. Orange color with medium head. Aroma has some caramel, yeast, cereal and ripe fruits. Taste is malty with long sweet aftertaste. Flavors of caramel, raisins, malt, toffee and dried fruits.
Feels simple, sometimes even bit harsh, but decent. Quite nice fruity kick, some overripe note, light grassy. Moderate sweet with moderate bitterness. Not so exciting as other top Tripels

Goudblond bier met romige witte wand klevende schuimkraag. Geur: peren! Mout, brood, gist. Smaak: zoet, peren, wat karamel, alcoholisch. Volmondig en romig. Medium koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: zoet. Stevig en zwaar bier. Eerder gerstewijn dan tripel, maar wel lekker in zijn soort!
Buona, ma mi aspettavo di più; al primo sorso è una bella botta, ma non sono riuscito ad abituarmi alla "forza" di questa birra
Bottle from real ale Newark. Hazy Amber colour with w off white head. Light barnyard funky, yeasty citrus and malty aroma. Taste sweet and yeasty. Rich body.
Botella 33 cl de el c Inglés Oviedo tomada en Oviedo en 2007. Fcpref 11..2008 Lote 2331 2135. Una triple correcta belga. Sin muchas sorpresas. Cuerpo medio a intenso 10 vol.
Flaska i Changchun. Mörkt orange med vitt skum. Fruktig doft med inslag av russin. Fin lite ettrig smak med russin, fat och torkad aprikos.

Belle blonde de 33 cl à bulles moyennes. Nez : cornichon (oui !?), malt, céréales ... Bouche : : aigrelette, agressive, alcoolisée ... moyenne amertume. Vraiment pas à mon goût ; je me demande même si ma bouteille nétait pas altérée !
Barwa bursztynowa, piana oblepia szkło. Pijąc je jakoś nie dostałem weny na głębsze przemyślenia. Piwo poprawne ale w niczym nie się nie wyróżnia.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2016 Pours reddish brown golden, clear, with a huge head; aroma is yeast forward, banana and clove, quite fruity with some alcohol; taste is medium sweet, fruity, some banana, citric notes, apple, fades into spicy clove, nutmeg, only a hint of bitterness, warm alcoholic spicy finish; mouthfeel is quite refreshing for 10%, feels like a Hefeweizen, carbonation is average
厚而立體的酵

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2016 Au nez elle dégage des arômes de Malte, de caramel, de raisins et de fruits secs.En bouche, on y trouve des saveurs de caramel, d?épices, de fruits et de bois.Taux d?alcool trop présent en bouche  pour moi. Je ne renouvelerai pas lexpérience.

Okay, like its Dubbel variant, this is serious business. Strong, generous and complex beer peaking at 10% alcohol level, whats not to love about this ? If youre into strong Abbey beers, you should know what to expect, beside that, the Maredsous Tripel is different enough from others to be distinguishable. Aroma is quite dense and deep, with a pronounced but light and floral aftertaste. I like this one as much as the Dubbel to be honest. Perfect combination served together. Once again, significantly cheaper than some other Abbey beers so theres no reason to pass on this one. APPROVED BY TAVERNYS BLACK METAL CREW !

Amateur de douceur, passez votre chemin! Les moines de labbaye de Maredsous via la brasserie Duvel ont su exploiter au mieux les 10 % Abv de cette triple avec, comme résultat, une bière toute en puissance. En verre la Maredsous triple est dun bel ambré clair, légèrement voilé. Une superbe mousse blanc cassée la surplombe. Le nez laisse déjà pressentir la force de la bière. Sur des notes dorange amère, de candi et de céréales. Lattaque, à linstar du nez, se porte principalement sur les céréales, le candi et les agrumes, dans un bel équilibre et une souplesse certaine. Lamertume qui sensuit est en premier portée sur lorange avec une pointe de girofle avant que le pruneau prenne les devants pour un final qui laisse exploser lalcool. Lensemble est très puissant, moyennement corpulent et sur un final long. La puissance de lalcool prédomine alors largement, les autres arômes passant en arrière bouche. Cependant, la montée crescendo de lalcool évite de déstabiliser la bière qui reste homogène sur lensemble de la dégustation. En conclusion, il nest pas aisé de laisser sexprimer lalcool sur de si fortes intensités sans que cette dernière annihile tout arôme. Cest là, tout le travail de la brasserie Duvel, qui a su lallier à des saveurs justes et à le maîtriser pour quil soit présent sans être exclusif. Il en reste une bière de caractère qui pourra en surprendre plus dun. Les moines savent être parfois de vrais petits démons

La Maredsous brune est déjà bonne, là on monte encore de niveau. Celle-ci a un goût classique de triple mais est ronde et bien équilibrée. Il y a un goût caramélisé qui reste léger, et aussi un arôme... Fleuri (?) qui rend très bien. Avec la force de lalcool (qui reste tapi sous les arômes) le résultat est très chaleureux. Je ne parlerai pas de robe, mousse, carbonation ou autre truc, car je la bois à la bouteille. Approuvé et recommandé par la Taverny black metal crew !
A hazy red gold colour with a large white head that quickly dissipated. Aroma of orange marmalade, vanilla and caramel. Taste is sweet, some caramel, orange peel and alcohol.
UPDATED: APR 30, 2017 Belle Robe cuivrée avec une mousse blanche persistance . Une nez avec des arômes maltés et épicés. Un goût caramélisé , épicée. Reste longtemps en bouche. Excellente bière

Bottle.
Dark yellow, nice steady head. Sugary & spicy aroma. Taste: complex, sweet, spicy, honey, caramel. ABV well hidden, good balance. Very nice belgian.
Hazy and reddish amber colour with a thin, creamy head. Aroma and taste have a lot of vanilla, orange, and white cake.
33 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet. Pours hazy dark golden with a big off-white head. Aromas of yeast, wheat, banana, caramel and spices. Taste is sweet with hints of alcohol. Good tripel.

Acheter à Tabac&co palais des bières dans famiflora à dottignies. Bouteille de 33 cl.

Couleur cuivré foncé , caramélisé. 
Au nez cest malté , odeur de raison secs ? Noix de cajou ? Bonne carbonnisation 
En bouche malté caramel un peu sucré ? , amertume fine agréable. 
Classique mais efficace mieux que dautre triple du meme genre .

Goûtée dans un verre Maredsous.
Température de début 7 à 8°.
Belle robe cuivrée avec une mousse blanche assez abondante et persistante; carbonatation soutenue.
Nez sur les fruits secs, la banane, le malt et une pointe de levure.
Le goût a une saveur dominante amère(houblons) très agréable équilibrée par une douceur bienvenue.
La finale est longue et plaisante sur un alcool chaleureux. 
Une excellente triple "Classique"!
16,5/20

Jolie robe orangée avec une bonne carbonatation et une mousse ivoire persistante.Le nez nous offre des arômes maltés mêlés à lalcool et les épices.La bouche nous amène sur une bonne douceur fruitée associée à une agréable amertume et levure.
Très bonne bière de caractère avec cette petite note "piquante"!

Bottle, 0.33l. Pours hazy orange/brown body with medium sized, creamy off-white head. Excellent lacing and retention. Smell is sweet; wheat, malts, yeast, banana, caramel. Interesting and pleasant.

Medium body, softly carbonated. Smooth and thick texture, excellent mouthfeel. Malty sweet taste with a touch of alcohol bitterness. Aroma is rich and complex. Malts, yeast, wheat, caramel, licorice, brown sugar, alcohol, herbal, flowery.... Excellent balance.

Overall, delicious brew. Excellent tripel.

Botella del @Hipercor, Oviedo17/09/2016. BBD:10/2016
Color amarillo, sabor maltoso, levadura,cuerpo medio.

Koperkleurige tripel, vrij helder, licht crèmekleurige schuimkraag. 
Aroma: Zoetig, karamel mouten, fruitig, siroop, appel, Kruidig, koriander, noten en Belgische gist/banaan.
Smaak: Rijp fruit met likeur.....hint van groene appel....best wel wat alcohol, Belgische gist, banaan , iets metaal, karamel, koriander, gebrande zoete mouten.
Er zit een hopbitter in maar die wordt aan de kant gedrukt door de alcohol en de zoetigheid.
Behoorlijk verwarmend maar ik vind het niet onprettig.
Body is medium, veel koolzuur en de afdronk is zoet, plakkerig, fruitig en toch wel alcoholisch maar zeker niet verkeerd.
ik geniet er rustig van.

Hazy orange color, lots of carbonation. Aromas of mustard, alcohol, some spicy yeast notes, hint of deep maltiness, and some hops just at the level of perception. Quite sweet in the start, clear alcohol flavor, some hops in the middle, finishes sweet in a table sugar kind of a way. Was good, but not amazing.

It poured a very burnt orange almost brown body, plenty of carbonation left nice lace. Aroma of sweet fruits and alcohol being the most noticeable. Mouthfeel was nice and smooth despite the high alcohol content. Flavor was a bit of a let down, at first i got hints of fruit but the alcohol covered it rapidly with a bready aftertaste. Overall a pretty good brew. Originally rated on 10/9/2008.

- trüb-braune Farbe mit leichter Schaumbildung
- säuerliche Aromen nach Kirsche, Karamell, Koriander und Honig
- für diesen Biertyp ist mir die Carbonisierung eine Spur zu hoch
- der Antrunk ist erst einmal überraschend trocken und bitter
- erst danach kommt die karamellige Süße hinzu, aber leider auch etwas
 zu durchdringend der Alkohol
- der Abgang ist mir dann eine Spur zu unausgewogen bzw. zu trocken
Fazit: Ein etwas zu unausgewogenes bzw. alkohollastiges Tripel

[8593-20160723] 11.2floz bottle. Wooden toasted fruit grains aroma. Hazy, golden amber body with a medium-lasting foamy off-white head. Fruity boozy ripened dark fruit yeast flavour. Medium body. Good. (7/3/7/4/14) 3.5

I bought this bottle at Paris, in a supermarket. In my point of view, it is not the best tripel beer, I think that from the tap is better. The taste is classical better than the blonde one, but there is a sensation of mass production, plain and boring, malty side, sugar and Belgian yeast, hop but it is hidden by the sweet side, regular carbonation.
Bottle from Amsterdam shop. Dark brown pour with some off white head. Nut, chocolate and booze aroma. Flavour shares with some heady earth tones and belgian chocolate ending in a light boozy glow.

Pours hazy, amber, rich head. Aroma of dried fruits and overriped apples, plums, spices, wine. Medium dry, medium body, high carbonation, spicy and fruity taste, ripe apples and plums, bitter aftertaste of spices and alcohol. Yes!
Bonne bière, mousse légère, arômes multiples et parfois surprenant, niveau gustatif généreux. Globalement une bière sympathique.

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2016 33 cl. Golden color, nice head but doesn?t last long. Medium carbonation. Spicy tones from the yeast, little sour smell, winelike. Floral, hints of banana and apple. Taste is caramel, warm because of the alcohol but not too hard, nice and smooth. Good example of the style

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2017 1) Bue 11 mois avant DLC. Bière rousse à très très forte carbonation. Epais col de mousse en cratère à très bonne tenue. Très belle bière. Arôme de malt grillé/miel, dalcool et légers houblons En bouche, très ronde, très douce puis final légèrement amère : top ! Final sur lalcool en 1ere bouche, puis le malt grillé et une fine amertume. Il maura fallu la goûter 3 fois avant de vraiment lapprécier. Je la buvais sans doute trop fraîche avant, et à la bouteille. Avec ses 10°C, elle tape un peu quand même ! Jen ai une en cave quasi à sa DLC. Je la laisse vieillir un peu pour voir... A retester donc !

2) Bue 5 mois APRES DLC. Col de mousse beaucoup plus faible, à tenue moyenne. Arôme alcool, abricot, fruits secs. Très capiteuse. Très bonne bière mais moins intéressante viellie que "fraîche". On dirait que le houblonnage ressort plus, et semble légèrement altéré.

Dark golden with a white head - Malt aroma with hints of caramel - Good malt body with some notes of caramel and some sweet spicy yeasty tones - The malt and some hints of spicy yeast goes into the finish - This was good
Bouteille 33 cl - couleur blonde oranger, mousse faible, odeur houbloné, goût sur le malt, les céréales avec une amertume et un alcool présent en fin de bouche

Kirkas kuparinruskea olut kohtalaisella höttöisellä vaahdolla. Tuoksussa belgihiivaa, kukkaisuutta, sitrusta ja mausteisuutta. Maultaan varsin makea, belgihiivainen, pippurisen mausteinen ja alkoholinen. Melko täyteläinen ja hiilihappoinen suutuntuma. Hedelmää ei löydy ja hieman viinalagerin tyyppisiä piirteitä, valitettavasti.

Bottle. Dark orange color, huge white creamy head. Aroma of malt, caramel, coriander, cloves, light banana notes, floral hints, candies. Taste is sweet, decent hoppy, nice spicy, warming alcohol. Nice tripel

Nagy, bézsszínű, tartós hab, gyönyörű sötét borostyán szín. Illata maláta és komlós fűszeresség keveredése. Íze keserű, fűszeres sajnos alkoholos. Már-már konyakos érzetű és a szénsav is sok egy picit. Utóíze kesernyés, ami a korty lenyelése után jön elő, és a torok hátsó részén érezni. Testes sör

Bottle - Slightly hazy golden colour with medium and steady white head. Intense fruity and estery nose with a lot of apple, bubble gum, some spice, tangerine, pear and yeast. Taste is well balanced, mostly sweet with lots of fruits, some apple and strawberry, almond and bubble gum. Medium to full body, medium carbonation, silky texture, quite dry finish, alcohol is noticeable but not offensive. Great tripel, a must try.

Nice deep amber colour, clear, very mildly sparkling. Big white creamy / frothy head, lacing patches. Sweet and fruity aroma with green apples, bit white wine, ripe fruits, banana. Nuanced, lively. Smooth, sweet, medium body, medium long finish, bit mocca in finish. Plums, figs and berries also like pointed out before me. Very easy to drink, good balance, pure and enjoyable flavors, great.

Pours amber, off white head. Immediately, pear and floral-grass aromas come out, exciting. Toasted malt, yeast and general hay flavours, grain (not malt) too: the grain is subtle, within style, not as in those Viennese unfiltered beers where it is the main point. Alcohol is very well hidden!! Medium body, nice finish.

0.33 bottle.   A hazy, copper color with a reddish tinge and a huge, off-white head. Aroma of Belgian yeasts, spices, fermentation, a tad of unfortunate metal, and some fruits. Taste is sweet, quite alcoholic, definitely spicy, berries make their mark too although the brew cannot be characterized as fruity. A medium body, an oily texture, and a lively carbonation. Finish is long and lightly sweet, the unfortunate alcohol remains unchanged however. Overall the beer is not bad, but it does not hide its alcohol content almost at all - big downside.

If we had to score body from 1 to 10,this beer would be 10. Omg what an awesome body, so full yet balance. You can feel ashes, honey,isoamyl acetate and malty notes. Great beer! I liked it better than my boyfriend

This pours a clear deep amber-orange with a pillowy head of light beige foam. Its got a wonderful aroma of plum, figs, stone fruit, berry yoghurt, bread pudding - very rich intoxicating aroma.
Medium to full bodied with a raspy carbonation, dry finish and a sharp booziness back by a pleasing alcohol warmth more suited to cold weather but Ive gotta make space in the fridge so what can you do.
The taste is sweet, stone fruit (plums, figs, peach), bready, some caramel syrupy sweetness, some berries.
A good example of a tripel but the next time I have this itll be on a cool Fall evening.
Bottle in Florida. Soft pillow head. Difficult to place aroma, maybe lemon malt. Hazy amber color. Sweet citrus with bit of clove. Unique texture. Unique beer. My girlfriend likes it more than me.
Nez agréable. Bouche ronde. Amère, avec un peu de sucre. Bien fait, onctueux et plutôt long en bouche.

Aroma: alcohol, hints of caramel, roasted malts, yeast, spices.
Appearance: nice amber color with a thick white creamy head. Medium retention with good Brussels lace. Clear liquid without chill haze.
Taste: medium bitter, medium sweet, no sour.
Palate: medium body, above average carbonation, long low-to-medium long bitter and alcoholic finish.
Overall: great appearance, but no so great taste and flavor. Alcohol is too much present, masking other flavors and aromas. This gets better when the beer warms up a littler. I think that Maredsous Blonde is the most interesting of Maredsous beers.

Bottle at Vera. Hazy dark golden with white head. Banana coriander, cloves and licorice/laurel. Quite spicy, yeasty. Light sweet, mild bitter. Medium body, strong aromas, quite strong carbonation, bit chalky and strong yeasty.

Aromat: Dojrzałe owoce, nuty winne, po ogrzaniu wychodzi alkohol.
Wygląd: Ciemny bursztyn, mętne, piana grubo i średniopęcherzykowa.
Smak: Znów dojrzałe owoce (banany, rodzynki) do tego korzenność, nuty pieprzne oraz nawet przyjemna, nie przeszkadzająca alkoholowość z dość wyraźną słodyczą. Ogółem niezły tripel, poprawny, ale niczym szczególnym nie ujmuje.

Sehr leckeres Bier. Dunkles Amber, mit leichtem Schaum. Sehr weich, vollmundig. Im Geschmack malzig, aber durch fruchtiges Aroma und leicht herben Nachgeschmack kein süßes Bier. Die 10 Vol. Schmeckt man nicht raus.

Excellente triple. La couleur dorée, presque cuivrée est magnifique, une belle mousse bien blanche. Très agréable en bouche avec une belle onctuosité. Relativement rustique, peu sucrée avec une légère amertume. Au goût on sent le caramel. Belle longueur en bouche grâce à lamertume. On sent un peu trop lalcool à mon goût mais cest une magnifique bière.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Malt, caramel, alcohol, yeast, some fruit.
Body: Full body, low to medium carbonation.
Flavour: Caramel, fruit, alcohol, malt.

Bottle from Jumbo. Hazy golden body with a pillowy off-white head. Lively fizz. Faint lacing. Aroma of bread, white sugar and salted orange. Flavour of sugary orange and coriander. Medium body with a fizzy mouthfeel. Hides the ABV well but its not very complex.

The beer is quite dark for a triple beer. The color is more amber orange than golden yellow. There is a little cloudiness in the beer. On top the beer a thick layer of crispy white foam is formed, which collapses rather quickly only to leave a drape of foam. The lions of the beer arent that special. The smell of the beer is nice. Its a real Belgian triple beer aroma. The first thing Ive noticed is the sweet and delicate smell of banana. This aroma reaches the nose already when pouring. The bananas are acini abide by an almondy alcohol aroma. Those two seem to be good friends. The smell has a nice fruity sweetness. However, there is also a good balancing bitterness of some hops. Quite nice. The taste is about the same as the smell. I taste a rich flavor of banana, almond and alcohol. The hoppy bitterness is a lot stronger in the taste than in the smell. It is nice, but the balance between sweet and bitter seems a bit of. The beer could use a bit more sweetness in the flavor. Than, it would be near perfect.

Drunk at schievenlabo at la hulpe. Strong classical amber triple beer.

 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: bright deep gold with good fluffy head
Aroma: light spicy
Mouthfeel: medium with high carbonation 
Taste: slightly sweet, spices, plums, raisins, light boozyness.
Just found this rating from few years ago. Bottle at Beer Conference in Zagreb. Copper with off-white head. Nuts, pear and alcohol in aroma. Sweet, full body, medium carbonation, dry.

Servido en un tulipán. APARIENCIA: de color ámbar con algunos destellos naranjas a contraluz, ligeramente turbia y algo de actividad de carbonatación; corona de espuma color blanco, de burbujas compactas y algunas abiertas de buena retención.

AROMA: notas dulces que predominan; azúcares sin procesar, miel; notas de frutos amarillos, cítricos, ligeramente una nota ácida hace presencia, se aprecia el alcohol.

SABOR: al paladar sigue a la nariz; de entrada notas dulces, azúcares sin procesar, miel, notas de pan; frutos amarillos cítricos, y el alcohol se siente intenso, más no agresivo; al retrogusto queda un amargor leve, seco, no astringente.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio ligero, carbonatación media.

RESUMEN: cerveza tripel buena a secas, nada extraordinario.
Cerveja não muito encorpada porém e forte o que atrapalha a drinkabilidade. Álcool bem perceptível. Vale a experiência.

Had this one out of the bottle as an aperitif so hard to really analyse it properly but here I go: a good tripel on the sweeter side. Lots of dried apricot and fresh plums on the palate. At 10% you cant really have more than one.
UPDATED: APR 14, 2016 Coloração de mel com espuma intensa e cremosa. Aroma com notas de frutas e álcool notável.  sabor marcante, além da expectativa. Agradou bastante.
Recht dunkles bier schaum in Ordnung, Geruch nach Trockenobst leicht harzig süß, auch im Geschmack leichte frucjt sehr dunkles Karamell
Très belle mousse avec bulles fines. Arôme de pêche principalement. On retrouve la pêche au goût avec le malt bien présent. Alcool très présent. Une référence.
33cl Flasche. Dunkles gelbes Bier, flacher Schaum. Es duftet fruchtig und nach Hefe. Geschmack nach Trockenobst. Recht wuchtig und schwer.

Pours a clear deep honey / golden amber with a big thick cream, very slightly peach head that lingers. Slightly sweet aroma with light bread, slight jasmine citrus scent - certainly a sweetness to the aroma. Taste is bigger than I expected. Immediate bread, followed by a good amount of sweet - like ripe mellon dipped into vanilla yogurt. Cant understate the sugar here - its not unlike a deep chardonnay. Mouthfeel is thin given the sweetness, which is a nice contrast. Very light aftertaste. Very good, very sugar forward.
Bottle. Pours a copper color with white head. Sweet, malty, molasses, slight butterscotch aromas. Malty sweet, belgian candi sugar, slight caramel flavors. Good, but not great.
Aroma of yeast with fruit, mostly pear, and some cara. Taste is much of the same but the alcohol is present. Nice.

En af de øl jeg har set der har holdt sit skun længst! Det ser virkelig flot ud.

Den har en del sødme og smager slet ikke spritet selvom den har 10%. En øl-type man godt kunne tænke sig var nogle flere af i danmark.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2017 0.33l bottle from alsace (probably st-louis). also from marktkauf/edeka.
pours a hazy amber with a big frothy white head and a nice lacing. aroma of pickles, pears, caramel. flavour of fruits, medicine, burnt sugar, spices, lemongrass. sourish and bittersweet, with some alcohol warmth as expected considering 10% abv. fizzy carbonation.
UPDATED: AUG 7, 2016 A bit weak aroma, hints of sour. Hazy amber with a nice long creamy head. Sweet, notes of alcoholic bitterness. Medium body, not long finish.

33 cl bottle at Maredsous Abbeys Grégoire Fournier lodge. Pours golden amber with very thick ivory head. Aroma is spearmint, pomelo. A hint of artichoke, as interesting as seldom found in beer. Dry, strong, round. Very long lasting bitterish finish. Very nice.

Ein solides Triple, aber nicht aussergewöhlich. Farblich fast Amber Ale, in der Nase geht nicht viel, dafür ist der Trunk schön kräftig und facettenreich und nur der etwas zu alkoholische Nachtrunk ist ein wenig overdosed. Flasche von 2014 aus Belgien. Mir schmeckts mit Sud besser......

Très belle triple dAbbaye
Forte, typique alcoolisée
Assez classique = une valeur sure

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2016 33 cl, bottled. BB 06 2017. Pours slightly cloudy orange with a fine white head. Aroma: Malt, grains. Herbal hops. Taste: Medium sweet, milky character. More sweet, intensive sweet. Banana, dried fruits. Cotton candy. Some bitterness. Overall very sweet. Spices. Hints of vinegar. Peppery notes. Yeasty, alcohol. Palate: Medium body, oily, adequately dry. Caramel, dried fruits, some balancing peppery tones in finish. Decent sipper, flavourwise not a big fan. Still not bad.

33cl bottle, served in trappist chalice. Poured an amber with a big three finger white creamy head. Aromas of caramel, roasted bread, vanilla, orange. Taste of caramel, vanilla, spices, orange peels, nuts, whole weat bread, some banana and bubblegum. Medium body with a nice bittersweet finish. Sweetness disguises the alcohol which presents itself in the long finish. Overall a surprisingly very good abbey tripel. Will have this nice brew again!
Bottle in a dark and loud environment. Strong and a little boozy, but with a matching carbonization. Well drinkable for such an ABV. Surprisingly not sweet. Great stuff!
backlog, deep golden pour with a white head. nose of spiced peppery yeast, carbonated, banana, sweet fruits, and your typical boring tripel, very dry aftertaste. sweet. not good
Nice beer with a full flavor. High alcohol%. Tastes really good! Best one of the Maredsous beers!

Ambrée, une bonne triple ronde et puissante (10° évidemment), malts doux notes légères caramel, alcool un peu trop dominant sur la longueur, dommage. Bouteille 33cl achetée en grande surface, Noisy-le-Grand, France, bue le 05/02/2016.

Pours a cloudy amber colour with big white head. Aroma is full of sweet hints, mainly raisins and pears, very citric as well. Taste is sweet with banana bread, yeast, a little bitterness on the end. Dry as hell and highly carbonation, strong body and some alcohol mouthfeel at the very end.
Pours hazy copper orange with big bubbly white head. Aroma of citrus and dried dark fruits, and sweet carbonated palate of raisins, banana, bubblegum and caramel, and a bit of alcohol hint.
Bottle at home, BBF 12/2016. Cloudy light amber colour, stable and big creamy offwhite head. Sweet malty caramel and sugars, Belgian yeasty spices, quite bitter and boozy. Firm body, low carbonation.
Amber color, cloudy. Highly carbonated. Thick head. Fruity and spice. Deep caramel malts. Mostly on the fruity side, pears , grape skin and apricots. Coriander and cloves. Very dry.

33cl shared at Biere mit Stil 1: Worldwide [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Freiburg JAN2016. - Copper orange. Smells carapils- and caramalt sweet, industrial honey infiltrating into a Doppelbock, notes of pear syrup with a whiff of warming jenever. Opens up a bit to all kinds of sweet&sour fruit compote, but the industrial sugars remain at the bottom. Hard and chalky mouthfeel, giving it a slender body. Some grassy bitter Poperinge(?) hops to the rescue - 15 years out of its native terroir, this is not a beer I miss in my drinking life. #1001bttbyd
Pours a reddish gold with thick pillow off-white head. Aroma - spicy yeast notes, banana, rising bread dough. Taste is crisp and spicy.

This is how the beer should look like. Nice foamy head, clear golden color, hardly any sparkling... But then my problem with all the triples comes. It´s too much carbonated to my liking. I even struggle to taste the beer properly, just carbonation and burping.

De Duvel Moortgat esta Trippel estilo Abadía "Maredsous". Cerveza de cuerpo mediano a mediano ligero, color cobrizo, con cierta turbiedad, corona de espuma consistente y duradera, muy brillante y blanca. En nariz no es tan compleja, se define con un fuerte dulzor de azúcar, olores a frutos secos obscuros, pasas principalmente, notas a pera y a jerez. En paladar principalmente es seca, seguida de dulzor fuerte, con algo de tibieza por alcohol. Los sabores principales son una entrada de azúcar, tonos a pan parecidos a las tradicionales lager checas, frutos secos, jerez y lúpulo floral que poco aporta en sabor pero hace notar el alcohol y aporta sequedad en el retrogusto. Contiene 10% de alcohol.
Strongest beer from this Abbey. Nice strong flavor but maybe the alcohol isnt enough balanced by the taste. Watch out though, you could like it very much by night.

January 20, 2016. On tap at Presslubben.
Amber with a small dense white head. Aroma is toffee, almond, alcohol, pear, grass, orange, some spices and grain. Taste is sweet, light bitter and boozy. Finish is sweet toffee, fruity esters, hints of almond, bitter grassy notes and warming alcohol. Medium bodied, slight oily texture, average carbonation. 
Decent, slightly heavy on the harsh grassy and boozy notes.

Bottle from Alko, Helsinki. Pours hazy amber with a little white head. The aroma features citrus fruitiness, floral hoppiness and plenty of Belgian style yeasty spiciness - lots of variety. Taste is dry, crisp and lightly sour; pale maltiness forms a solid base for yeast and hops to build on. Herbs, citrus fruits, floral notes and a touch of exotic fruits appear. The palate is full in body and smooth in texture, low in carbonation. Excellent crisply spicy and rich tripel.

Clear amber color, big white head. Aroma of spices, yeast, caramel, vanilla and alcohol. Taste is not very sweet with medium bitterness, there is also noticeable alcohol warmth. A bit disappointing, but it might have been too fresh.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2016 Bronze colour with very small top. Aroma is honest - it hits you with cinnamon and caramel, also some malt and sweets. Smells as Belgian should do it. Taste is a bit bitter and sour mixed with spices, herbs, cardamom, grass, some yeast. Abv is well hidden therefore easy and dangerous to drink. Very good tripel.
Very light malty fruity smell, taste is almost all malt but not really sweet..some very Slight bitterness in there...smooth with a light alcohol burn...tastes like a very good example of a tripel...
Has a color of Amber/Dark Dull Orange. Has good carbonation/lacing/head. Tastes of dried fruit. Has a bubbly mouthfeel.
A nice Belgian tripel, though in my opinion it lacks some outspoken tones in its taste

Aroma:
Malts, caramel, toffee, fruit, orange belgian yeast, spices.

Appearance:
Hazy orange/copper beer with a medium white head.

Taste/Palate:
Medium sweet, slightly bitter and slightly dry with caramel, fruit, belgian yeast and spices.

330ml bottle from Beerhawk. 
Bubbly white head settles quickly, good lacing. Clear golden amber body. Nose is marmalade, brandy, yeast. Flavour is boozy marmalade, syrup, honey, slightly medicinal. Carbonation is a little high, lots of fizz on the tongue, mouthfeel is light. Very drinkable for the abv but the strength is lurking. Dangerous.

Nice orange colour with a nice white foamy head. Very balanced even though it has 10% abv. A mix between dry and a slight banana and dough touch to it. Together with the Westmalle, one of the best triples I have tried so far.
Farge klar nøttebrunt med flott hvitt skum som varer. Aroma frukt karamell. Smak malt gjær frukt karamell. Søt og mild.

Aspect: Couleur cuivrée orangée limpide. Tete abondante et resistante
Aroma: Odeur prenante est raffraichissante, notes dagrumes et florales. Semble plutot sucrée et se confirme en retro-olfaction

Gout: Longueur en bouche très notable. Gout maltée très sucrée et carameliséen premier lieu, et sapaise par la suite. Gout dalcool modéré, amertume durable

Lukt: Frukter og karamell.
Utseende: Gyllen.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt skum.
Smak: Frukter og karamell.
Hvor: Kjø[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Noahs Arq, Amsterdam.

Licht amberkleurig bier met mooie witte schuimkraag.
Aroma is kruidig met hints van rozijnen en caramel. 
De smaak altijd karamel, rozijnen, gemengd met alcohol noot laatste 
Mondgevoel is vol en goed koolzuurhoudend.
Afdronk is bitterig en kruidig.

Ambrata limpida con riflessi caramello, schiuma ocra di media finezza, regolare, di ottima persistenza.
Aroma di uva passa e caramello, erbaceo.
Al palato sempre caramello, uva passa, nota alcolica finale mista ad amaro erbaceo.
Corpo pieno, ben carbonata.
Aroma intenso, frutado e muiti agradável. Aparência avermelhada mas não muito densa. Sabor forte, um pouco adocidada e sem transparecer seus 10% de teor alcoólico.
0.33l bottle. Clear orange color with big, nice white head. Aroma of malt, yeast, hops, honey and caramel. Taste is very sweet and little bitter with some alcohol present.

750 ml bottle, taste at yeastside meeting, LA. Not sure if it was the numerous other beers I had first, but I really didnt enjoy this. It had very unpleasant sourness and was a miserable example of a tripel. Maybe it was a bad bottle?
Amberkleurig bier. Fris zurig aroma. Proeft echt zoals hij ruikt. Smaken van mandarijn, beetje appel, licht zoetig. Warme afdronk. Lekker bier maar wel iets te veel koolzuur...

Cerveza de color naranja oscuro con una buena espuma cremosa. Aroma afrutado, a malta, levadura y especias. El sabor es potente, afrutado, naranja y levadura. Una cerveza poderosa para tomar por la noche tranquilamente. el acabado final termina con una sequedad leñosa y un ligero amargor. excelente cerveza..
Echt zeer zwaar bier, zeer traag te drinken. Een typische trippel. Een goede kleur en schuimkraag.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2015 Delft 28-10-2015

Geen bijzondere triple! Dag ervoor Straffe Hendrik wild op en daarmee vergeleken toch minder. Naar mijn smaak weinig aroma en een te straffe smaak. Heeft wel veel body mede door redelijk hoog koolzuur gehalte maar mist een onderscheidende smaak. Neigt wat naar appel maar verder middelmaat.

Pours a chestnut brown with a huge, pillowy, white head. Nose is farmhouse yeast: somewhat bready, with hints of champagne. Taste is balanced, but the finish is more to the bitter side. Medium body. Lively carbonation. Nice brew.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Alko Hyvinge. Orange with lasting eggwhite head. Nutty and spices. Alcohol. Some sweetness.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Pours a clear ruby red with a foamy tan head. Aroma of cherries. Taste is malty sweet with a slightly tart bitterness reminiscent of cranberries. Smooth mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Large, frothy, off white, mostly lasting head, good lacing. Flat, medium amber body. Moderate malty aroma, with notes of hay and cereal. Light hoppy aroma, with notes of flowers. Moderate yeasty aroma, with notes of dough. Notes of banana, prune, apple, pear and brown sugar. Heavy sweet, light bitter and moderate acidic initial flavor. Long, moderate sweet, moderate bitter and moderate acidic finish. Medium to full body. Oily texture. Soft carbonation. Moderate alcoholic, light astringent finish.

Pours a clear, amber color with a thick white head. Aromas of caramel, honey, sugar, some spices, some citrus. taste is really sweet, honey, caramel, spices, maybe some citrus notes. Medium body with medium carbonation.

Ambar anaranjado con ligera opacidad, buena espuma y adherencia. Malta maltoso caramelo moderado alto, lúpulo especiado moderado alto, licoroso, ésteres a damasco, albaricoque, orejón y melaza. En boca licoroso moderado alto, maltoso caramelo moderado alto, lúpulo especiado moderado alto, frutos secos. Final seco y licoroso. Con cuerpo, buena carbonatación y el amargor correcto en balance

Amber in color, generous beige head and nice lace. Malt dominates the nose, citrusy and somewhat sweet. Begins malt sweet, the middle is light, ends with an astringent bite, dry, lightly hopped, a quite drinkable bee

Delicious, especially for a Tripel which is normally a bit too strong for my tastes. Nice fresh flavors with yeast and some wheat backbone. Some floral (or is it fruit?) notes as well but not overwhelming at all. Good balance.
Bottle to a chalice at local roots. Golden with white foamy head . Sweet candy and floral aroma. Roasted malt and Belgian yeast... Very nice triple ...
Nose is light apple, cotton candy and citrus nose. Flavor is big candy citrus alcohol.

Bottle or draft - 33cl bottle, bought in a supermarket in South West France.
Pour and colour  Amber, slightly hazy with a deep head, reducing over time. Aroma and taste  Malty sweet. Aftertaste - Lingering bitterness of malt. Overall notes  Excellent, would purchase again.

Amber with an average frothy head. Flavour is toffee, raisins, spicy, butter-old cellar like. Medium sweet with a dry and bitter and woody astringent alcoholic lingering finish. Medium bodied, average carbonation, oily. Complex but rough.

F: white frothy not long lasting.
C: orange to amber, hazy, opaque.
A: malty, honey, floral, banana, pear, yeast, hint of orange peels and some decent earthiness.
T: malty, white sugar, orange peels, banana, hint of caramel, alcohol, medium to full body, lively carbonation, some grassy and yeasty tones, delicious abbey tripel.
Heavy feel of spice and alcohol. Warmign characteristics predominant. Light tight lace with fizzy mouth feel.

Quasi copier/coller de la version blonde

" Dans la série je goûte à nouveau les classiques belges qui faisaient mon ordinaire il y a quelques années: Nez de banane, doux, sucré, arômes un peu traînant, bière assez mollassonne. ça se boit, mais cest assez vain ... "

Avec entre autre: Plus dalcool donnant plus dallant et des arômes plus net ... Cest mieux, mais 10 % cest beaucoup trop dalcool pour un résultat pas si évolué ... Doù une sévérité plus grande !

Au final, a goûter à nouveau, toutes ces bières, ce qui,me gêne le plus, cest le côté traînant du goût ... ça manque clairement de netteté. Cest vague et sans prise de risque !

Bottle from G&B, Hammel. Pours amber/orange with an off-white head. Aroma and taste is malt, yeast, caramel, banana, syrup, Sweet fruits. Creamy mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. Sweet finish with a little bitterness.
Amber (a bit hazy). Large head with high retention (you can still hear ir creaping after a while). Malty aroma, notes of honey, cereal, a bit of alcohol. Good mouthfeel.
Orange amber color, with average white head. Low carbonation. Aroma is plums, raisins and spicy. Aftertaste is very long and sweet.

Bottle from vinmonopolet, Valkendorf. Aroma is hints of tutti-frutti, banana, peach, marzipan. Deep golden, hazy, nice frothy white head. Medium sweetness, lightly bitter, tastes of alcohol, dried apricot, peach, som herbal notes, ripe fruit, tiny hints of white pepper. Medium body, nice mouthfeel, lively but smooth carbonation. Very nice triple, big and rich, maybe too much alcohol?

Orange / amber color, liquid a bit cloudy and high head.
Hoppy aroma (herbs and fruity) with caramel notes.
Taste is bitter and sweet (strong but well balanced).
On the palate: Full body and fizzy carbonation. Long finish.
Great triple!
With body, taste and aroma according to a good Belgian triple, I would recommend it

Bière cuivrée, haute mousse blanche quitint parfaitement, limpide. Nez, levure, alccol, fruits confits, des esthers importants. Bouche alcool et fruits confits. Lamertume sst assez marquée pour ce type de bière. Leffervescence est très importante, et lalcool omniprésent, légèrement sucrée.

Piana nieduża, drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, szybko opada do koronki. Barwa dość ciemna jak na Tripla, bursztynowo miedziana, mętna. Aromat intensywny, dominują estry i fenole - przede wszystkim brzoskwinie, morele, jabłko malinówka, czerwona porzeczka, czereśnia i cała masa przyjemnych owoców uzupełniona o czerwony pieprz i rodzynki. W smaku na pierwszym planie owoce kandyzowane, dość słodkie i kwaskowe, lekki likier brzoskwiniowy, wino gronowe półsłodkie, odrobina karmelu. Bardzo fajny balans, idealnie udało się wkomponować w słodowo-drożdżową mieszankę niemały przecież alkohol, który tu w ogóle nie przeszkadza. Nagazowanie średnie, szampańskie, goryczka nieduża, ziołowa, wyczuwalna w posmaku. Odczucie w ustach półpełne. 
Zadziwiająco smaczny i nietypowy tripel, zdecydowanie ciemniejszy od innych, dość deserowy, słodki, ale nie wyklejający. Pomimo aż 10% alkoholu pije się go wyśmienicie.

Orange amber color, with average white head. Low carbonation, full bodied with creamy texture. Aroma is plums, raisins and spicy. Taste is sweet, caramel, raisins and other dried fruits. Aftertaste is very long and sweet.
2015-05-21 Whether it is the triple or the colour, I dont like this as much as the other Maredsous.
"Converting" from old excel scoresheet. So there is no comments on this beer.
. Pours hazy amber with big cream coloured head. Aroma of honey, flowers, light bread, bananas, caramel.

Amber colour, two fingers head that vanishes soon, leaving ring and lace. Aroma of fruits, banana and some citrus, nuts (almonds, I think), spices and chocolate. Medium to full body, good carbonation. Taste of spices, chocolate, fruits and nuts. Good one.

Cant see it because its in a ceramic chalice! lacy head. Nice sweet malty. Taste is actually pretty bitter. Has a citrusy flavor. Its a little rough. Complex flavors. The bitterness at the end is different than the one at the beginning. Slightly thick body.

Robe ambrée et opaque.
Peu de mousse.
Saveurs de levures dominantes. Notes de fruits jaunes, pain dépices.
Arrière goût très fruité.
Carbonatation fine. Longue en bouche.
Une bonne bière.

Hazy, pale orange with thin firm white head. 
Fruity, syrup, alcohol, honey, wet fabric, rocks, almonds, rubber, brown sugar and spices in the nose. 
Almonds, alcohol, fruits and spices in the mouth. Dry finish.

Bottle from
New Albany beer store. Nose is malty and thick. Not amazing and id go elsewhere. A bit of cherry hint there.
Bottle at home. Yeasty and malty. Strong. Perfect beer for my imaginary Glasto tent party :D

Alaranjada,turva,espuma cremosa com média formação e duração;aroma adocicado acompanhado de notas cítricas remetendo á doce de laranja,um bom perfume floral também aparece;sabor maltado , frutado,com notas condimentadas e picantes,acompanhado de um teor alcoólico bem elevado e aparente,corpo alto,carbonatação mediana,retrogosto adocicado. Tripel potente,aromática,mas com álcool passando um pouco do equilíbrio,o que prejudicou o conjunto.

0,33 l bottle from drankgigant.nl, best before 10/2016. Clear, golden amber with a medium large, foamy, almost stable, tan to white head. Sweetish, fruity-spicy aroma of citrus, banana, honey, vanilla, toffee and nuts. Sweetish, fruity-spicy taste of banana, cane sugar, toffee, nuts and vanilla. Medium long, slightly bitter and gently alcoholic finish. Medium body, slightly creamy mouthfeel, average carbonation. Quite reserved concerning aroma and taste but nevertheless tasty. Not the best out there, though. Expected way more.

Another retro brew I have not had in many years... Big cotton candy, toffee, and boozy notes along with pear and crabapple. There is a faint almost peaty iodine earthiness I frankly dont remember before. Sharp and biting with a somewhat dryer finish. This could stand a year or more of aging but alas I will not be the one. It is no Tripel Karmeliet nor Allagash but not much is.
Bottle 0.33l at home, Nivala. BBE 10 2016. Colour is clear golden with large white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, citrus, spices, Belgian yeast and malts.
@ Hotel Van Belle, Brussels 13/5-15. Yeasty and fruity with banana, also spices/phenolic. Body is medium, the finish is dry and spicy.
UPDATED: JUN 29, 2015 Goût assez fruité, un semblant de sucre candy roux, une bonne pétillance, et un niveau d?alcool qui ne laisse indifférent. Une triple efficace sans être exceptionnelle non plus.

Fruity aroma - peach, banana, some booze. Amber colour, bit hazy with nice white head. Taste is sweet, again, fruity, peach predominates with low bitterness at the finish, some alcohol warming. Overall very good.
Robe ambrée. Nez assez discret, malt, épices, sucre roux. Bouche assez ronde et fruitée, opulente mais qui manque de complexité à mon goût. Une triple assez simple.

Slightly murky golden pour with modest foam head. A: typical yeasty fruity Tripel, mostly marzipan, faint vanilla note. Bit boozy. T: standard fruity, yeasty Tripel with mostly marzipan, almonds, some cherries. Bit oily, boozy here as well. Fruity aftertaste.

Bottle poured in to the appropriate glassware at Staminee De Garre. Poured directly after the house Tripel. Thats a hard act to follow. Its hazy Golden Amber with a White head. Yeasty banana aroma with spice and fruit. Tastes of cake dough. Lemony hops with a big hit of alcohol. uite nice but Id have preferred another De Garre.
Uma Tripel sensacional. Cheia de história e tradição. Muito muito boa!!!! Excelente.
hvala mom prijatelju Furi na ovom piva ..odlicna mala boca ..zanimljiv puni okus pravog piva ..fenomenalno pivo za ispijanje...jako ..osjeti se alkohol ..savrsena boja ..

330 ml bottle pours a hazy burnt orange with a bug bubbly white head that soon dissipates pretty much completely. Nose is bread, yeast, some earthy spice and faint banana. Taste has good strong caramely malt going on with a sour cherry note. Really nice mouthcoating oiliness and initially high carbonation. High abv shows its head in a mellow warm boozy fruitcake finish. Delicious.

Off white hue, light copper near clear body.
Scents of floral hops, strong fruitiness, brown caramel.
Tastes floral leafy hops, vanilla, marzipan, brown malts, fruits.
Good body, clean, semisoft carbonation.
Juicy fruity caramel finish. Wild yeast perfectly tamed.
[33cl belgian bottle shared by lmojoh, 10%, bb9/2016]

Hazyish golden, decent ringed head. Gristly sweetness, yeasty drag and quite decent sparkly banana. Firm enough carbonation and a soft greasy mouthfeel. Finishes strongly, lemon and varnish with a wonky bready spice linger.
Bottle at craigs. Pours clear golden, nose is toffee, floral, caramel, taste is dry, sweet, fruity.

T:
-big floral and caramel notes upfront
-spicy coriander
-Banana
-faint lemon
-slightly alcoholic and fairly hoppy finish
O:
Very good.
Flavour profile reminded me a lot of the Westmalle Tripel
Solid. However, there are better. The problem here is that theres some alcohol heat/burn that I dont get in others of this variety.

Compra: Hipercor San Juan (pack de cata Maredsous)
Ingesta: Viendo Eurovision, en su copa
Opinion: La peor de las maredsous con diferencia, no se si estaria en mal estado. Sin apenas sabor ni olor y se sube bastante
Apresenta boa formação de espuma, densa. Coloração âmbar, translúcida. Aroma frutado, especiarias, caramelo. Sabor adocicado, notas de caramelo, equilibrado com o álcool. Pouco amargor. Equilibrada.

@ Hotel Van Belle, Brussels 150513. Bottle (375 ml) from local minimarket. Yeasty and fruity, malty and estery with light spicy notes, banana, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and yeasty.

Cloudy honey brown color, big off-white head. Aroma of banana, yeast, sugar and alcohol. Medium to heavy sourness with same amount of sweetness. Alcohol is present. Some fruity notes, plums perhaps. Medium body, a bit creamy, soft carbonation. Not bad. (Vrutak 0,33l bottle)

Whats not to like? A big, bready and yeasty brew, sweet, goes down easy and hides the ABV almost totally. For those who crave hops, this is not the ticket, but for those of us who love a well-balanced, traditional and time-honored style of brewing, this is a good example of the tripel style.
Cerveja de aroma complexo, levemente frutado. Cor bronze com espuma alaranjada persistente. Sabor intenso, adocicado, com notas de mel. Alcool presente ao final embora suave para 10%.

I liked this one a lot better than the 6. Complex aroma and flavors. Getting some sweet raison, honey, bread notes, etc. Alcohol bite hidden quite well for 10%. Great resemblance of this style. I will add this to my "Try Again" list!

Color Amber dark and slightly opaque. Cream is beige, well formed and effervescent, Mid, dense and persistent high.
The Aroma shown pleasantly sweet and fruity with notes of yeast and citrus shades of tangerine. Fresh honey is very characteristic and, spices, sweet pears and ripe apples, yeast.
Your taste is very peculiar sweet and slightly acidic with a fruity beautiful gently salty. Brings a strong taste of spices like cinnamon, ginger, and white pepper with a citrus and slightly acidic subtlety Tangerine decorating the mouth with refreshing flavors. Behold, then then there is the heat of alcohol carries malts, yeast, baking powder, suitable fig touches grapes that remain long stretches of mouth.
When the foam gives a little we can see a beautiful and pleasant effervescence in the cup and that is transmitted to the mouth, an average degree of carbonation.
Alcohol very well inserted in the set is one that despite its high degree is well camouflaged by the light sweetness of the drink.
Medium body, oily feel, medium carbonation, semisweet long finish fruity and well.
A beautiful Tripel very good drinkability.
One of the best beers I have ever tasted the aroma is wonderful filled with strong alcoholic taste

Bottle at home. Pours hazy amber with big cream coloured head. Aroma of honey, flowers, light bread, bananas, caramel. Taste sweet with fruity notes, citrus, yeast, some alcohol. Bitter aftertaste. Medium to high carbonation.

Golden Amber beer with fizzy small head. Aroma of yeast, spices and tangerines. Taste is spices, tangerines, pepper, malts and yeast. Great carbonation levels. A little oil on the palate. Very good.

text: Pours clear amber in a 0,33l bottle. Aroma citrus, malts, caramel. Taste medium sweetness, medium bitterness, light alcohol. Didnt like so much

Bottle @ De Tolly Joogipood. Pours dark with medium fluffy-sticky yellowish head. Aroma is sweet, caramel, malty, honey, pear, slight vanilla chocolate. Taste is over medium sweet, caramel, wheaty, sweet banana.Good belgian. Maybe to sweet for me but ok.
on tap,poured into a tulip glass..golden pour with a fluffy white head..aroma of yeast,bread,bananas,spices..dry,spicy,banana,yeast taste with some hop bitterness..very good.

Sweet and Bitter with a smooth finish, this Ale wears its age well. Highly recommended for Belgium Beer fans!

Flaska från Saveur-bier. En medelsöt kraftig triple med doft av färsk honung, söta äpplen och päron. Smak som doften, men även apelsinzest, jäst, lite alkoholvärme och en lätt beska. Kanske inte karktärsfull men kraftfull och välbalanserad. riktigt god.
From the bottle. Very intense taste of yeast and alcohol with a high amount of bitterness. Full mouthfeel and a long warm recent of bitterness. Not my style but definitely a good Tripel.
smells of brown sugar, caramel, pale gold in colour with a thin white head, tastes like it smells, with a slight bite of alcohol in the finish, quite smooth ive had worse
29.1.2015. Clear orangeish. Sweetish aroma with caramel, fruits, yeast, banana. Taste has fruity sweetness with belgian yeast, wheat, banana.

Possui um aroma alcoólico maravilhoso, uma espumação consistente que se mantém por toda degustação, sabor forte como deveria ser no qual o álcool se confunde com vários Sabores... Custo beneficio alto
