Pours clear amber with large off white head. Aroma of citrus and yeast. Pleasantly effervescent in mouth and surprisingly watery in palate considering the very high ABV. Dangerous type as the alcohol is kept well in check and the sweetness - bordering on fruit cake - well balanced with the bitterness Decide to add the depot of yeast to the clear brew about halfway and I do find that it adds taste Another very good brew by Duvel Moortgat, but I rate the Duvel and La Chouffe higher as they are simply more interesting beers.
Tap. Floral aroma, tastes of caramel, candy, yeast and some alcohol in there. Considering the strength, its quite warming.
330ml bottle. Bright hazy amber body with a large white head. Light bread, honey, yeast, floral notes, sweet fruits and some alcohol.
Pours a golden colour. Slight candy in the taste with some yeast, a bit disappointing really considering the strength

W zapachu czuc cytrusy,tez cos jakby kardamon,slodowosc,kolor ciemno slomkowy,metne,piana biala,sredniopecherzykowa,szybko opadajaca,nasycenie srednie,w smaku czuc goryczke,jak w zapachu rowniez cytrusy,slabo slod,alkohol nie wyczuwalny przy tak duzej mocy

Bottle. Pours clear amber with large frothy off white head. Aroma is more acidic than expected, with floral and fruitty (citrus (hops) and apple) notes. Very carbonated, taste is a mix of sweet, acidic and light bitter finish. Crisp and refeshing. Very nice.

Piana ładna biała po nalaniu, ale dziurawi się i opada. Zostawia trochę śladów na szkle. 
Kolor ciemnego złota, klarowne.
W aromacie głownie brzoskwinie, wyraźne nuty belgijskie. Trochę słodowości. 
Po ogrzaniu zaczynają wychodzić lekki nuty ciasta. Pojawiają się lekko winne nuty, ale wytrawne, nawet ściągające, gorzkawe.
Po ogrzaniu wychodzą nuty rozpuszczalnika. 
W smaku goryczka, znów brzoskwinie. Lekko gorzkawe, jakby smak nie do końca dojrzałych owoców. 
Wyczuwalny alkohol, może trochę likierowy. Nie narzuca się ale jest wyraźny. 
Lekko przyprawowe. Goryczka złożona, trochę chmielowa, ale też alkoholowa.

Streng hefig, etwas früchte. Fast klares orange, feiner weißer mittellanger Schaum. Süss zu Beginn mit leichter Säure und Alk, wenig Caramell. Mittelvoll, mittel Co2. Abgang alkig, herb, kein bitter. Etwas trocken. Nicht mein Bier.
Deep orange color, white permanent head with a little sour smell. Medium bitter taste. Almond ending with a lot of complexity. Packaging is terrible, could be better for such a good beer.

Nice aroma of citrus and hops. Golden and hazy in appearance wiith minimal white foam. Medium sweetness, lightly bitter, a bit salty. medium body, Medium body, oily feel, average carbonation, long finish. Quite a nice beer, easy to drink.
Light, golden pour. Citrus tones, yeasty but not to heavy. Delicious triple!

Pours hazy golden with a lot of off-White head. Aroma of fruit, cloves an alcohol. A very dry finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Espuma que se disipa paulatinamente, aromas frutales en nariz, sabor potente con regusto permanente, los 10º tampoco se aprecian en exceso lo que hace disfrutar muy bien la cerveza.

De couleur parfaitement cuivrée, cette bière est un délice autant pour les yeux que pour le palais! Sous son épaisse mousse à larchitecture typiquement belge, le liquide est parfaitement translucide et affiche de séduisants reflets dorés. Même plusieurs minutes après le transfert de la bouteille au verre, une grande quantité de bulles émergent énergiquement du fond du verre vers la surface. Il faut toutefois attendre un peu que la mousse sestompe pour dégager pleinement les arômes de cette bière qui rappellent le miel, le foin mouillé, le chocolat blanc et les fruits confits. Quelque chose comme le nougat finalement avec de lalcool en prime! En bouche, on a affaire à une bière très charpentée. Léquilibre entre toutes les saveurs est parfait mais fragile, tant chaque parfum est affirmé. On est tantôt dans le miel, tantôt dans lalcool mais demeure toujours cette constante de raisin et de figue qui sétire longuement en bouche - tout comme leffervescence qui poursuit son travail même une fois dans lestomac. En somme, cette bière complexe vaut la peine dêtre dégustée et partagée. Je ne la suggère pas comme un accompagnement potentiel à un repas car son effervescence est davantage propice à la digestion qui suit le repas.
Staat er als triple. Lekkere afdronk. Mooi bier in de reeks van maredsous.
Floral aroma, minimal head, light sweetness, lightly sour, lightly bitter, good
Ljusbrun med litet skum. Aromen fruktig, lite Champis. Smaken tämligen tunn med lite syra. Eftersmaken lång & söt. Lite plommon?

Das 3 Maredsous, a minha predileta. Âmbar intenso, ótima formação e estabilidade de espuma. Aroma de laranja azeda por conta da levedura, mel, damasco, álcool bem presente tanto no aroma quanto na boca. Levemente amargo pelo álcool. Corpo médio-alto. Boa carbonatação. Final doce e alcoólico.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka do 10-2016. Piana ladna, przy delikatnym nalewaniu na dwa palce, jednak szybko sie redukujacado cienkiej warstewki, ladne firanki na szkle. Mocna opalizacja - przy czym tu dziwna sprawa - w butelce nie pozostal osad drozdzowy, w pokalu tez go nie widac... czyli co, tripel ktory nie refermentuje? Pechowa butelka? czy po prostu bylo niewiele i nawet przy ostoznym nalewaniu sie dokladnie wymieszal? Aromat jest dosc typowy triplowy, przy czym ciut ubozszy niz mozna by sie spodziewac. sa slody, drozdze, jest owocowosc glownie brzoskwiniowa, bananow raczej malo. Jest tez alkohol - taki likierowo-rozpuszczalnikowy, mimo, ze piwo pite raczej za zimne niz za cieple. Po ogrzaniu sie alkoholu w aromacie nie przybylo na szczescie, za to pojawila sie wyczuwalna przyprawowosc - bialy pieprz glownie. Sa tez w zapachu biszkopty czy jakies ciastowe aromaty. Smak jest dosc analogiczny do tego, co w zapachu, tylko chyba przyjemniej zbalansowany. Alkohol czuc tym razem juz bez rozpuszczalnika, grzeje w gardlo, ale tez w smaku i posmaku. Bardzo wytrawne jak na tripla (czyli umiarkowanie wytrawne) - trudno to postrzegac jako zalete. Powiedzialbym, ze z "oryginalnych" tripli (przynajmniej jesli idzie o kraj) jest najpodobniejszy do polskiej, skadinad calkiem udanej wersji sulimarowej - czyli Triple Blond - moze Sulimar wlasnie na nim sie wzorowal :) wysycenie srednio-wysokie. Calkiem niezle piwo, choc zarazem nijak nie kwalifikuje sie do czolowki, raczej do peletonu.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
How: Bottle Appearance: Amber, minimal off-white head Aroma: bread, caramel, dried fruits, sugar. Palate: Full body, smooth carbonation,some bitterness in the aftertaste.
Brown color, small white head. Aromas of carmel and bread. Medium body and carbonation.

Aroma: caramel malts, light sour, typical Tripel, yeast, intense malts, grain and bread. Appearance: clear, light brown, medium, frothy, white head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: lively carbonation, intense malts, sweets initially, bread and caramel, followed by light bitters, yeast, typical Tripel flavours. Overall: decent Abbey Tripel, maybe slightly weak in the aroma, decent palate. Bottle from Beers of Europe, Kings Lynn.
Average tripel sweet taste with notes of butter nuits sweetly bitterness nice orange red color.

Old rating rerated 31.12.2014, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet fruity, light malts, honey, flowers, dried fruits, caramel, yeast, alcohol, almond cake. Taste is slightly harsh fruity, yeast, light malts, honey, almond essence, grain, alcohol, grass, weeds, dried fruits. Medium bitterness, slightly harsh soapy mouthfeel. Fair enough.

0,33l bottle. Amber, off-white head. Cloudy. Sweet yeasty aroma. Perfect level of carbonation. Wonderful on the palate. Mild taste, yeasty, sweet, slightly salty. Hides its high ABV very well. Surprisingly fresh and light for a tripel. I love the combination of the aroma and the taste. Very good balance of tastes, as well. Slightly anonymous and mild, but still, a very good brew.

Murky amber body, tiny head. Rich aroma: peach, apple, apricot, a bit of citrus. Really boozy, on par with Gulden 9000 in that regard. A lot of sweetness in the palate coming from this exquisite fruity mixture. Alcoholic finish.

Yeasty boozy, bready, minerals, grass, straw.
Hazy golden colour, medium white head, lacing.
Soft bite, mid-sweet, bready, minerals, mild.
Medium body, average carbonation, sweetish finish.
Ok.

Enjoying a bottle of this as a stand alone dessert beer, this lighter blondish tripel is quite a delectable authentic abbey ale! Pours a slightly hazy burnished golden color with lots of lacing and a long lasting creamy head, very appetizing. Notes of candied apple and fruity yeast on the nose, aroma is on the lighter side. Taste is very sweet, fig and/or apricot accents, some sugary caramel malty base, very fresh. Sour yeast and some boozy tartness in the finish, puts a damper on the sweetness, but is to be expected for the style. Almost reminiscent of a light sweet porto wine. Those Benedictines give the Trappists a worthy brewing challenge, recommended!

Bottle. Hazy amber pour with small frothy offwhite head. Aroma is kinda sweet with some orange peel and apricot. Taste is fresh and well balanced. Nice bitterness and not too sweet. Ends with a bit of sour notes
Smooth creamy and you MUST drink it in the ceramic cup, amazing beer!!!!
330ml bottle from BePLUS, Xiamen. Pours hazy amber with a dissipating white head. Aroma of bread, spice, malt and Belgian yeast. Sweet finish with a hint of bitterness. Dangerously drinkable.
330cc bottle. Pours amber with soapy head. Nice dry and spicy. Also citric and hoppy. One of those I always have at home. Very nice abdij beer overall.

Orangée, grosse carbo, petit collet persistant. 
Arome de poire liquoreuse et de levure belge.
Vive, fruité, longueur moyenne.

Pours a dark golden color with a white head. Yeast, fruit, spice and malt aroma. Yeast, pear, apple, clove, spice, sugar and malt flavors. Medium light body and high carbonation. Fruit and spice finish.
UPDATED: FEB 18, 2015 Simple beer without big interest. Fruits on the palate, thats all.. Smell quiet not good
It poured an amber color with a white head. The aroma was fruity with pear, citrus and some bubblegum. The taste was of orange zest, pear, bubblegum, grass and several spices. Nice.
Abbey beer with a sweet honey taste initially with a slightly bitter after taste. A good frothy head. A great tasting beer but due to being 10% ABV not one you can drink too much of.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2014 Triple belge à la robe bien ambrée, colorée.Col de mousse blanche qui colle au verre.Senteurs dépices : girofles, cannelle, levures.Bouche épaisse et liquoreuse.Peu damertume.Peu de complexité.Pas exceptionnelle mais une triple dabbaye gourmande et épicée.

Backlog rating. Keg at FOB, Rimini. It pours a clean golden color with a large soapy white head. Foam sticks around for ages. Aroma is yeasty, dry and spicy, with notes of citrus peel, bread, banana esters, black pepper. Taste is dry and grassy with notes of grains and grapefruit skin. Some alcohol burn. Finishes quite dry and spicy. Full bodied with lively carbonation. Overall, a nice traditional tripel

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2016 C est une triple belge de couleur or, à l'éclat festif, avec un corps crémeux et un faux col succulent. Sa douceur élégante contraste avec sa forte teneur en alcool qui en fait la boisson favorite des connaisseurs. Elle possède une touche finale équilibrée, longue et réconfortante.

Les bières de l'Abbaye de Maredsous se distinguent par leur arôme floral et fruité raffiné et leur perlant délicat. Il s'agit ici de bières de refermentation naturelle en bouteille, qui gagnent encore en maturité en bouteille.

330 mL bottle from Total Wine, Chesapeake, VA. Dark orange pour with a frothy off-white head. Aroma of citrus peel and Belgian yeast. Taste is mildly bitter but certainly not unpleasant. Lightly sweet and finishes with orange and lemon zest. An excellent tripel.
75cl bottle shared. Pours cloudy amber with white head. Aroma is sweet, spicy and malty. Taste is malty, bit sweet, spicy and light bitterness. Full mouthfeel.

APPEARANCE - Clear orange with a 2-finger, uneven, malty head, that dissipates slowly. Lacing is foamy

AROMA/SCENT - Sweet, mild, slightly herbaceous.

TASTE - Well balanced between a sweet Belgian and a bitter Pale Ale. Not cloying liks some sweeter Belgians. ABV well-hidden.


MOUTHFEEL/PALATE/TEXTURE - Soft, not gooey. Surprisingly decent carbonation.

VALUE - $12 for a bottle -- on the high end.

OVERALL/DRINKABILITY - Very smooth drink. Chuggable.

Coloração âmbar. Creme bege, fino e duradouro. Aroma frutado marcante e levemente cítrico. Corpo médio. Carbonatação e álcool bem inseridos e percebidos. Paladar com malte bem evidente, pimenta, gengibre e acidez. Não se recebe lúpulo. Retrogosto cítrico persistente. Cerveja potente, com carbonatação e acidez marcantes, talvez um pouco em demasia, sem comprometer a drinkabilidade.

A very mildly hazy orange body with a white head that settles down to a thin, uneven layer. Nose has aromas of yeast, spices and caramel. Taste is quite sweet with a long, fairly strong bitter finish. Carbonation feels smooth and the mouthfeel is quite rich. Nice beer with very pleasant, although mild aroma and well hidden alcohol. The harshness in the taste is a little annoying.
Bottle. Hazy golden color with medium white head. Aroma - Caramel, citrus, malts. Spicy taste with fruits.
Amber pour, high head. Strong alcohol sweet smell. Strong bitter start. Barley middle and finish.

Review based on the BJCP2008 guidelines (style 18C). Bottle 33 cl - Batch L4072 2357. AROMA: strong alcohol presence with a soft and spicy aroma. vinous like aroma. no hop notes. very faint citric esters. APPEARANCE: dark gold color, almost orange. a bit hazy. average ivory head with medium-low retention. some lacing. TASTE: some spicy and sweet background profile. full alcohol presence with a vinous aspect. medium-low bitterness with a semi-dry finish. no hop flavours. faint esters reminiscent of oranges. PALATE: medium-light body. medium carbonation. no solventy character. OVERALL: a tripel that lacks a bit of aroma and flavour complexity. a bit strong on the alcohol aromas.

33cl flesje via AH, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 10%
Uitgeschonken in Leffe glas

Uiterlijk: goudoranje kleurig met snel wegtrekkende kraag

Aroma en smaak: Belgisch gist, banaan, romig, warm, zoet

Conclusie: overbekende en niet voor niets

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2015 750ml bottle served in a tulip glassl.
A: Pours a hazy dark orange color forming a big white and foamy head. Good retention and many thin lacings left in the glass. 
S: Sweet, fruity and spice. Honey, caramel malts and belgian yeasts. Strong alcohol notes in the end. 
T: Caramel malts and Belgian yeasts are a must. Quite fruity too. Some honey. Balanced sweet-bitterness. Bubblegum. Once again, quite boozy finish. 
M: Heavy, creamy and a bit molasses body. Medium carbonation. Honey and sweet pale malts in the aftertaste. 
O: Good drinkability. Very decent Triple from a respectable brewery. 
[ BA Review @ 11/14/2011 ]
330ml bottle from Vanuxeem. Pours gold with good white head. Sweet aroma. Delicious tripel, fruity with vanilla and soft spice. Beautifully blended. Ace.

330 ml bottle on clearance at the LCBO. Drank six months past its BB date (04-2014). Pours cloudy with average white head. Smells of bread, raisins, pears and caramel. Taste is fruity, grape, white wine, pear, Slightly warm finish. Balanced and easy drinking for its weight.

---- personal review, no claim to be representative or neutral ---- repost undesired ---

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
"very solid tripel. bready, balanced aroma. a little citrus, fruity malt and yeast. solid feel, not overdone on the carbonation. almost soft, but full. one of the better tripels out there."
33 cl porterhouse Dublin. Fantastisk god belgare. Lite stark dock så det går bara att dricka en.
lichte geur beetje caramel, weinig co2, beetje vlakke smaak, alcohol iets meer dan normale tripels. beetje een grondsmaak, niet heel uitgesproken. lichte smaak rustige nasmaak.

Bottle from Julios. Poured into a snifter. A clear deep honey color with a frothy off-white head that settles to a thick lace. Aroma of honey, spice with some alcohol. Complex flavor. sweet apricot, honey, spice. Dry bitterness. Good yeast profile. Very dinkable. Nice stuff.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2015 Abbey beer since 1988, with a thick, sticky, cream white, dense head, relatively stable in relation to the ABV; colour warm orange blond, clear with hardly any visible fizz, hazy with deposit. Sweet fruity aroma of orange liqueur, pineapple, gin, overripe peaches, honey, cloves, rose petals, wodka, toasted bread. Sweet onset, candied orange, banana, mango, smooth and supple palate with medium carbo, minerals, fresh sourish touch, soft caramelly and bready malts, finish with a grassy hop bitterness but especially a strong, warming, gin-like alcohol effect which even becomes a bit wry. Would have been a lot better with better hidden alcohol and more hops, now the sweetness cloys a bit too much and the end is too alcoholic for my taste. Still a lot more honest than its Leffe or Grimbergen counterparts.
A malty and soothing aroma, with a nice colour and foam top. tinteling on the tongue, with a lovely bit of sweetness and alcohol.
Aroma is sweet. You feel the alcohol in a really god way. Its herbal, floral and balanced throughout and bitter in the end. A quality beer, without a doubt.

330 ml bottle, rated 2014-09-09 @ Strasbourg
Orange clear beer with big white head. Aroma has Belgian yeast, apricot, honey, clove and ripe banana. Flavor is yeasty, fruity and sweet. Palate is quite full and foamy in the mouth. Finish has mild bitterness with aftertastes of alcohol, yeast, spices, fruits and port wine. Quite decent tripel with too much alcohol, nothing special.
Botella de 33 cl, adquirida en El Corte Ingles. Color ambar. Sabor a malta, levadura, dulce, ligeramente a alcohol.

Bottle from Carrefour, Nice. Hazy amber-brown with some bubbles for an extremely small head, and a small carbonation. Fairly strong tasting, which subdues some of the potential flavour. Theres a small sweetness in the nose and taste.
This is one of the best beers available on the market on just about every level. I prefer the No. 8 offering called Brune/Bruin due to my taste for darker beers, but this is my favorite triple.

Pours a clear orange with a white lasting creamy white head that easily is recreated when swirled. Aroma of orange and banana with a little perfume like roses and nutty and alcohol. Taste is slightly sweet. Palate is medium body,creamy texture, with a long finish. This is an excellent beer, I think my favorite triple.

La bière est livrée dans Une bouteille à la forme quelque originale.
De couleur dorée et légèrement trouble, cette bière présente une mousse plutôt légère qui disparaît assez rapidement.
Le fort degré alcoolique (10%) procure un goût puissant en bouche avec une note fraîche et acidulée d'agrume.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cor caramelo, com espuma creme pouco persistente.

Aroma frutado e de lúpulo, adocicado.

Sabor cítrico, ácido, especiarias, álcool perceptível, encorpada, seca, com retrogosto suave. Muito boa.
BlablablablaBlablablablaBlablablabla BlablablablaBlablablablaBlablablablaBlablablablaBl
Pours amber with a thick white head. Start off with a carbonated, slightly fruity tone and has a sweet alcoholic aftertaste. Very enjoyable!
Amber with small white cap. Well balanced from carbonation sourness on the tongue tip to bitterness with yeasty notes on the root, some sweet touch in the middle.
Classic belgium beer. Nice cream, ambar. Smells like yeast, malts and flowers. Taste: caramel, herbs and really good malt. Aftertaste: sweet and little bit alcoholic, despite 10%. Great. Try!

Pours a slightly hazy copper amber with a fat finger of frothy white head, great retention and heavy lacing. Nose is mild, dark fruit and Belgian yeast, some citrus, and faint bubblegum. Taste is similar, with some toffee malt and spice. Medium to thick body, with a somewhat fluffy texture and a sticky, warming alcohol finish.

Sweet and tending towards the heavy, this is a big beer. Although I prefer dry and floral tripels over malty ones, this is pretty decent.
Tiene buen sabor ,buen aroma,sentia que me ardia la boca,y es fuerte por un momento sabia a sidra

Excelente Cerveja. Diferente do meu compatriota brasileiro, achei a cerveja muito boa e bem equilibrada. Teor de álcool alto porém sem agredir. Levemente adocicada sem interferir no bom paladar. Cor muito bonita e espuma duradoura. Recomendo
Copper color white head. Aroma of fermented fruits. Dry slightly bitter, some hops lots of fruity malty flavors and noticeably boozey. Nice triple.

Belle couleur dorée, tête légère couleur crème. Arôme puissant d'orge et de fruit, on retrouve en bouche ce côté fruité et surtout sa puissance en alcool, 10% quand même. Une petite pointe d'agrume en plus. C'est riche !

--- Dirty Google traduction :-€

Beautiful golden color, color creamy head lightly. Powerful barley and fruit aroma, on the palate the fruit and especially its power alcohol hand, 10% anyway. A touch of citrus and more. This is rich !

33cl bottle from Biermarkt, Don Mills. 10 % alc. / vol. Pours a hazy dark gold colour with one finger of white head. Flowery aroma with notes of Belgian malt and yeast. Smooth citrus finish. Medium carbonation. Barely can taste the high alcohol content.

Dark orange, initially with a frothy white head but this soon goes.
 Medium body. Initial nose is pear and apple - these persist in the taste, but a bit too much alcohol. More fruity than spicy.
Mikon luona. Really thick, sweet, malty and mouthfilling. Maybe a bit too sweet and bready for me.
Voor een tripel heeft dit bier net te weinig smaak vind ik. Dan is de blonde een pak beter

Bottle from backlog. 
Amber with a white head leaving lacing. 
Aroma: fruity with pear and citrus, bubblegum. 
Taste: orange zest, pear, bubblegum, dried grass, spices.
Quite a moussy mouthfeel.
Very nice.
Não sei se eu sou cabaço demais pra esse tipo de cerveja. O chêro é bom, ela é lindona. Mas o gosto... Forte pacas, e muito doce pra mim. Falta aquele amarguinho bão.

This is one of those beers I scrolled past numerous times because I thought I had had it back in 2006 or 2007 - or maybe I did and I just didnt remember to add a rating for it here (the shock and horror!).

Anyway, I got a bottle of this at St. Arnolds Mussel Bar in Dupont, DC. Poured a slightly hazy orange color with a medium sized, lasting fluffy white head. Aroma was nice light citrus notes, some earthy notes - and a nice light toffee, sweet note to it. Pleasant yeast component in this one, produces a light spice note on the finish. Alcohol is there, but hidden quite well in my opinion. I think Ive just become a fan.

Bottle, 330ml. An amber beer with a medium size creamy head. It has a somewhat fruity aroma with malt, caramel, alcohol and maybe a hint of bananas. Taste is bitter and well-balanced. Carbonation and astringency are faint. Slightly alcoholic finish, but not very strong, especially considering the high ABV this beer has.

Bottle, 33cl. Clear orange/amber with a low but creamy head with beautiful lacing. Sweet, spicy aroma, with hints of sweet malts, clove, straw, sour apples and bready yeasts. Medium bodied, with moderate to high carbonation. Not as sweet as most tripels, with a subtle bitterness, and an earthy alcohol finish. Very pleasant.

UPDATED: DEC 8, 2014 Bottle 330. Pours clear dark golden to orange with a short foamy head that lasts a couple of minutes. Aroma of strong sweet malt, grains and pleasant yeasty smells. Mouth feel is nicely tangy and very thick but not too creamy, strong pleasant foaming sensation in mouth. Tastes of sweet malt, honey. Slightly fruity and orange flavors. Feelable alcohol taste. Warm spices, with some anise notes. No sourness and very mild neutral hops bitterness. More wine-brandy notes from alcohol. Some woody tones. Strong and sweet, yet not very heavy. After taste is weak, slightly sticky and sweet. Very nice complex and pleasant beer, only complaint is the the sometimes too strong alcoholic flavor.

Pours a hazy amber body with a thick head. Aroma of fruit and candy. Creamy caramel taste. A lovely beer :)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

orange and yellow bottle with squares and triangles from the late nineties
1 orange citrus aroma with some toffee, no hops 2 golden to orange with a lacey white head that lingers 3 caramel sweetness with some spicy phenols followed by a tinny aftertaste 4 medium body and well carbonated, no astringency 5 Held up nicely and very enjoyable aged example of a tripel
Sabor marcante. Cor laranja para vermelho com espuma leve. Amargor residual. Bem encorpada. Acompanha um Cohiba a altura.

Bottle 750ml. Cloudy orange with low off-white head. Aroma of apricots, sweet toffee, pitches, a bit of alcohol. Heavy sweetish and alcoholic flavor, big apricots, marmalade, blue Curaçao liqueur. Sweet alcoholic aftertaste. Medium to full body.

Bottle 33cl. Lovely bouquet. Beautiful orange golden colour with white top that fades away. Taste is different every sip. Bitterness, sweetness, its all in there. Not your standard beer, but I like it.

Bona cervesa, bastant equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, bastante equilibrada y sabrosa.
Gylden brun litt tåkete med offwhite skum. Karamell, malt og nøttelukt. Alkohol, syrlige smaker, gress og noe fruktsødme.
On tap at Biercab. Golden colour with white head. Honey, malt aroma. Sweet, honey, malt, caramel taste, some yeast too. Medium body.

Bottle at home. 2 years old. The colour is golden amber with a medium, creamy, off-white head. Sweet and fruity aroma with Belgian yeast, oak, tequila and some spices. Belgian yeast also in the flavour with more leather, sweet malt, wood, some caramel and a good dose of alcohol. Strange bitter taste in the end. Has a slick mouth feel, and a medium bitterness. A bit weird taste on this and feels unbalanced. The alcohol dominated too much. Maybe the beer is over its peak after a couple of years.
Orange golden beer, white head. Aroma of malt, light hops and fruity yeast. Malty sweet flavour.
Sinceramente ho assaggiato tripel migliori. Non mi ha lasciato gran che... Forse perché lho presa in un supermercato, dalla grande distribuzione, e forse la bottiglia ne ha risentito...

Narancsos színű testére méltóságteljesen telepszik rá sűrű habja. Élénk, pezsgő jellegű főzet, mely legfőképpen savanykás ízjegyeket hordoz magában egy jó adag élesztősséggel karöltve, az alkohol pedig olyannyira a háttérben marad, hogy szinte észre sem vesszük, mennyire erős főzettel van dolgunk.

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2014 33cl bottle served in a Struise glass. Pours a bright orange colour with a bubbly white head which dissipates quickly. Aroma is strong booze, sweetness and flowery notes which are largely overpowered. Taste is more of the same. A truly unique tripel and one I will look forward to trying again. Certainly a sipper and not what I was expecting from the style. Not as well balanced as other spicier tripels and unfortunately, doesnt hide its ABV very well.

33cl bottle. Pours orange/amber with a 2 finger head that subsides quite quickly, but laces nicely. Pick up the alcohol in the aroma, and sweet mature fruit... somewhat raisiny. Long flavour trip, almost a marzipan richness. Smooth, medium body in the mouth, pleasant alcohol warming. A satisfying beer.
Bottle. Aroma fruity, spicy, lightly soury. Clear golden to orange colour. Stable head. Taste is soury, spicy, apples, lemony. Not much good.
UPDATED: JUN 9, 2014 Bottle. Dark amber colored beer with small off-white head. Sweet malty aroma with syrup and some spices. Sweet malty taste with apples, lots of sugar.

Bottle 0.33L.
Clear amber body with huge, creamy, off-white head, fully lasting with very good lacing.
Moderate malty (bread) and light-to-moderate hoppy (citrus) aroma, with notes of sugar, spices (cloves) and alcohol.
Moderate-to-heavy sweet and moderate bitter flavour with a light acidic character; bitter/acidic aftertaste. 
Medium body with oily texture; soft carbonation.

Amber color with hazy moderate white head. Sweet and fruity aroma, which emphasizes orange and cilantro, with clear alcohol presence. malt is present on the taste, together with citrus (orange), apricot and spices.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2015 Bière orangée, très légèrement voilée, très effervescente, et surmontée dun très large col blanc cassé, mousseux, dense, et qui se réduit tout doucement en laissant une riche dentelle sur les parois du verre. Arômes de pain frais, grain, léger sucré (sucre dorge et/ou miel), raisin vert et fruits du verger (pêche, pomme, poire), avec une pointe dalcool, un léger boisé et quelques effluves herbacés (herbes aromatiques et/ou houblon). Nez moyennement agréable, moyennement complexe, et absolument trop timide, ça manque dintensité de façon flagrante. En bouche, bière très pétillante sur la langue, onctuosité plutôt faible au palais, légèrement éthylique. Au goût, entrée en bouche légèrement sucré, pain frais, grain et malt mielleux, avec un fruité plutôt acide (raisin vert, pomme verte), sur trame de fond herbacée, et beaucoup dalcool. La finale est sèche et présente un houblon plutôt floral, en route vers une amertume moyennement élevée. Pour une tripel de tradition belge, il me semble que cette bière est trop amère et trop mince en bouche, on dirait quelle est insuffisamment maltée. Aussi, lintégration des différentes saveurs est un peu difficile, en particulier pour lalcool et le houblon/amertume. Bière heureusement bien plus intense en bouche quau nez, complexité moyenne. Bonne bière, sans plus

From bottle at "a capella" Ghent.
APPEARANCE: clear darker blond beer. Small stable off white head.
NOSE: fruity, alcohol, port, maybe this is aged? Didnt get the bottle with my beer.
TASTE: alcohol, yeasty, little dry, fruity mostly, again the same port hints in here.
Less than in my memory, but oké beer.

Bottle 33 cl.
Hazy amber with large off-white head. Malty caramel, spices, and a touch of alcohol on the nose. Full bodied, medium sweet, long and warming. Just as a Abbey Tripel should be.

Bottle. Pours a hazy amber color with a moderate off-white head on it. Nose has some caramel in there as well as just a bit of floral elements. Taste is slightly sweet, with just a bit of caramel and toast coming through.
Pours a deep amber. Medium, thick sweet palate. Yeasty aroma. Banana malty flavours and sticky fruit caramels.

Squat little 33cl bottle pours with a clear copper body that has gold edges and supports a full off white head of foam. The aroma offers up big banana, bubble gum and pear and apricot and fig sweet fruitiness where deeper in the pull it picks up sweet date notes and a bit of black pepper. The taste is bruising with rich sweet concentrated pear and apricot and fig like fruitiness. It then gets into sugary sweetness and booziness that has a thin somewhat grating edge of black pepper. Full force tripel here where maybe a few years of age will round it out some.
Bottle. Pours a dark golden with medium head. Yeasty aroma. Caramel, raisins, toffee flavour. Nice full bodied palate.
Pours a beautiful pale rust color with two inches of head. Slight spice to the malt which is not overpowering. Well worth it.

Muito boa tripel... Para mim, está entre as 5 melhores. Perde da Karmeliet e westmalle apenas. Espuma de boa formação e duração, aroma complexo e no sabor também... Predomina o malte, caramelo, notas florais
Pours a copper colour with a fluffy, persistant head. Discreet fragrance of malty hops. Pleasant bitterness on the tongue and after taste. An enjoyable experience.

0,33L bottle, BB 08.2015. Pours clear copper with white head. The head stays. Aroma is fresh fruits, apples, slight oranges, and yeast. Taste is caramel, fruity, alcohol, raisins, and some bitterness. Finish is bitter and fruity. Overall: nice brew, well balanced.

Golden amber color, creamy white head. Ripe fruit and spicy nose, yeast, caramel. Sweet fruity, yeasty taste, banana, cloves, pepper, metallic notes, hint of alcohol. Lively carbonation, medium body, warming finish.
Pours a slightly cloudy golden hue. Citrus on the nose mainly. Sweet and citrus on the palate, with just a slight hint of hop bitterness on the finish.
Find beer......Enjoying with family.......Good on the palate and refreshing......Always a favorite!
Nice abbey tripel drank at the buitenlust, Oirschot. Taste some spices, malts, lightly yeast, lightly sweetish. Nice body

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2014 330ml brown bottle poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is clear amber with a medium sized frothy beige head, that when reduced left some lacing. Aroma is faint of apples, pears and herbs. Flavours of caramel, spices, pears, honey and some alcohol, the typical Belgian yeast flavours are surprisingly subdued. Taste is light-medium sweet and medium bitter. Palate is medium bodied, smooth texture and average carbonation. Overall a good Abbey Tripel, but a little too sweet and the aroma is faint, also alcohol is sligtly detectable in the flavour.
750 ml bottle pours a pale yellowy brown color with some haziness. Good maltiness and mild sweetness.

Kveldens tredje fra Maredsous og Strag, på Cardinaltreff april-14: her overgår ølene hverandre. Rett etter flere Maredsous og Duvel (med Duvel Triple Hop 2014 som en stjerne) kommer denne! En slank og lettdrikkelig tripel hvor bitterheten sørger for at sødmen ikke får sitte i førersetet. Klar, gylden, med fint skum etc. Suverene saker.

Incredible beer. This is in my opinion the best of the trappist beers out there. It is bready and citrusy and just perfect. This is not for the average miller light drinker. This folks is a beast of a beer. Ready to punch you in face with so much complexity you werent even ready for. the taste is smoky and sweet and just amazing. Meredsous is it. Try their Brune too you wont go wrong.
Bottle, amber pour with a off white head, taste starts sweet and then slightly bitter, with a hint of alcohol but is very smooth. Delicious beer.
tap. hazy orange with small head. sweet and fruity with some bubblegum. very nice tripel. mild alcohol warmth.
Bottle from supermarket. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, hops, caramel, grass and earthy notes. Bitter finish with citrus, caramel and hops. Very nice tripel.
On tap at Martins West in Redwood City, CA. A musty piece of spiced bubblegum unearthed from an ancient Topps wax pack. In my book that equates to: Very Drinkable.
Lys gul, medium skum. Aroma av belgisk gjær og gress. Smaken er gjær, gress og alkohol. Frisk. Tørr på tunga. Mild bitterhet i ettersmaken.

From the archives: Had a gift pack from Brussels + variety on the side. All beers in the series are well balanced and complex. This one is my favourite. From time to time, Mardesous beers are available in Tallinn, Stockmann .
La meilleure de la série pour moi même si elle fait bien mal au crâne le lendemain quand on en abuse ;) Riche et corpulente.
Mørk orange, uklar med tynt hvitt skum. Aroma av gjær og alkohol, litt åker? Smaker omtrent som den lukter. Medium kullsyre. Ganske tam ettersmak.
Uklar brun farge med lys beige skum. Aromaen er preget av gjær og alkohol. Smaker gjær, noe vinøs og sødme. Frisk og kort etersmak.
Solid Belgian tripel. Body of yeast and malt, with lots of fruits and herbs.
Bottle 330 ml. Pours hazy dark orange with white creamy head. Malty caramel aroma. Sweet and fruity flavor. Full body.

The appearance has a nice looking hazy sort of brown almost orange colored body with a decent half fingered white foamy head that dissipates within about a minute. The lacing is sparse but light and speckles here and there.
The smell is absolutely awesome - that typical "iced apples" smell I always get from a Tripel with some pears coming in nice and sweet and yet theres a nice spicy tone that kicks in to just give it the right balance.
The taste has a nice spicy yet sweet "iced apple" flavoring that just makes me feel really good. "Iced apple" aftertaste leaves with a quick and somewhat dry light apple-ish sort of finish
On the palate, its about a light to medium sort of body that has a decent sessionable aspect to it. The carbonation is not too harsh and not too smooth, just an overall goodness for a Tripel.
Overall, in my opinion, this is a very good Tripel. Seek this and you will find a stellar Tripel!

Très bonne bière belge, pas mal de corps, légèrement huileuse, pas très amer, légèrement sucrée. Des notes de céréales, dorange, de caramel ou de sucre candy. Une belle couleur ambrée. Bref, un ensemble qui se tient très bien.

Bottle. Pours orangey, plenty of bubbles rising, hazy, a small white head which very slowly disappears. Aroma- malt, spice, yeasty, orange hints. Taste- lots of carbonation, full and creamy mouthfeel, tangerine, malts, plenty of caramel coming through, a long and bitter finish. Very good, not quite at the Duvel level though.

Thick clear beige head with strong cereals taste. Light and clear copper body. In mouth there is thickness from hops and alcohol. Quite warm but lacks some length.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
33 cl bottle. Dark orange colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of spice, fruit, alcohol, yeast, caramel and herbal notes.

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle corked and capped poured into a Trappist glass. Pours copper with small off-white head. Aroma is light candy sugar, medium body, medium carbonation, and thick big bubble lacing. Taste is light candy sugar, woody, and bitter finish.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein orangebraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig süß, alkoholisch, Nüsse, Früchte.
Geschmack sehr süß malzig, dunkle Früchte, hefig, leicht alkoholisch.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2017 Flasche (33 cl), 9 Monate im heimischen Keller gelagert. - Schönes Orangebraun, kaum Schaum. - Im Antrunk intensiv herbe Bittersüße: Kandiszucker, Bitterorange, überreifes Obst, Mango, Harz. Für ein Triple sehr schlank, beinahe trocken, mineralisch hart, aber mit wärmender alkoholischer Schwere. Prononciert bitterer, trockener Abgang mit rauchigen Noten, eingerahmt von zart-fruchtiger Säure. - Nicht süß-schmeichelnd wie manches andere Tripel, sondern von einer herben Härte und Bittere. Großartig! Entfaltet erst beim Wärmerwerden seine ganze Aromenfülle; zu kühl getrunken schmeckt es etwas dünn. - Erstbewertung: 4,3. Neuverkostung: Flasche (75 cl), 2 Jahre überlagert. - Wuchtiges, aromatisch herbes Tripel, mehr bitter als süß (Ingwer?), mit seltener mineralischer Härte statt der so anzutreffenden parfümierten Süße. Ausgezeichnet.

33cl bottle, at home @10°C
Dark orange, hazy colour (hazy only if you pour in the yeast at the bottom). Fine and creamy head. Sweet fruity flavour (orange?). Pleasant woody and slight alcoholic aftertaste. There are surely better Tripel out there but many, many worse. Recommend

Bottle 0,33L. Cloudy orange colour with thin off-white head. Aroma is fruity, caramel and vinous. Taste is very good, moderate bitter, earthy, cask wood, rich, full of flavour like nutts, caramel and figs. Reminds me on barley wine beers. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation and moderate alcoholic finish.
Flaska från Bishops arms Sundbyberg. Onykter recension... Godare än den jag druckit innan... Inte jästig men smygsöt och maltig. God

Flaska på Bishops, Sumpan
Brungul grumlig. 
Klassisk belgisk jäst och lite vanilj tycker jag. 
Syrlig smak med trevlig gomkänsla.
Krachtige tripel met kruidige smaak, hoppig bitter, chocolade en zuur fruit. Mooie donker gele / licht rode kleur, blijft lang hangen.
Sublime couleur oranger, belle mousse mais qui s estompe rapidement.. arôme de citron , zeste d orange et à priori d épice... Très forte en goût, elle attaque bien en bouche.

Clear orange pour, with small but foamy white head. Very prominent, but subtle, malt aroma, with quite boring pilsner-characteristics for some reason. Taste is strong, herb-like, and spicy, with understated yeasty qualities in the finish. Some resin, hay and floral, as the beer breathes. A mild fruityness after a while.

Amber-golden color with a nice, white, fluffy head. High carbonation. Wood and fruit aroma. Sweet and light sour taste. Sweet, herbal, alcohol aftertaste. A good tripel but far away from a great tripel.

This ale never fails. A real triple with a huge character of a strong independent solitaire. Blond appearance is fulfilled by gentle bitterness with a touch of sweet malt. It survives even when drink is colder than recommended. Not surprising after yesterday party - this stuff never fails.
