Deep golden amber pour. Ripe citrus and spicy/herbal hops. Flavor is lemon-orange citrus meat with some bitter rind and candied malt. Finishes clean and attenuated with wheat malt. Creamy carbonation and mouthfeel.
Een houtachtige geur en smaak. Kleine schuimkraag. Goede tripel, die doet denken aan La Trappe Tripel. Lekker, maar niet de beste tripel.

Bu à la pression en 25cl,couleur brune et une mousse très disparate; en bouche grosse explosion sur la noisette et sur lacidité et fin de bouche très sucrée et caramélisée, une bière qui rend fou quand tu en bois un litre.
bouteille de 750 ml dambrée trouble. arome de céréales et dagrume. très onctueuse en bouche acidité assez élevé et amertume moyenne.
Tap. Nice floral and malty aroma. Quite complex flavor profile with notes of fruit, oak, bananas, and floral elements. Medium mouthfeel with a smooth, slightly sweet finish.

Bottle, bbe 12/2015. Orange coppery. Herbal, malty eyasty-spicy nose. Some coriander seeds, Full bodied, a bit sweety-cloying, oily, body. Long finish. Sort of ok. Like the other maredsouses Ive had, its ok, drinkable, even likable. But when the reference (trappists, st bernardus etc) are so much clearer in flavour and better balanced, its hard to get too excited about this.
Hazy amber pour, ample head. Sweet alcohol aroma. Strong but smooth. Excellent!
Dark golden color and one finger of head. Sour, vinegar, apple, fruits are predominant in the aroma. Slight sour, malt and fruit taste. Crisp flavor and you would not expect an ABV of 10. Good beer
UPDATED: APR 24, 2015 Pours a light, clear brown. Smells like champagne and fruit. Sweetness of fruits and almost a cotton candy sweetness. Finishes dry with a little hint of alcohol.
From bottle. Full bouquet of buffalo grass and yeast. Hazy copper in color. Nice warm taste that finishes sweet. Viscous.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2014 Hazy amber in colour with minimal head. Aroma of berries, citrus, cloves, spice and yeast. Taste is relatively sweet to begin before settling into a nice bitterness from the yeast and hops. Alcohol volume is apparent and there is a nice warming quality to this. Lively carbonation and long lingering finish.
Slightly dark blonde color. Yeast, banana-vanilla smell. Taste is at the begining slightly hoppy then turns to fruity. Palete full and smooth. You can feel the alcohol gently warming your throat.

Amber ale with a great white top. Smell of orange and a presence of alcohol. A well balanced trippel. Some similarities to a wheat beer in taste. Fresh and fruity, tho a bit "heavy" due to the high amount of alcohol.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden to brown colour. Fresh white foam. Smell of banana. Good, medium sweetness. Also medium bitterness. Strong, with 10% alc. A bit to powerful for my taste, but pretty tasty.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home. Mid brown, quite dark for a triple. Clear, zesty, fruity aroma mixed with the alcohol. Full favoured, ripe berry fruits mixed with a little background hoppiness plus an unusual floral presence. A benchmark triple.
amber with nice soft head. Aroma yeast, fruit. Taste sweet and very dry with yeast, fruit flavors. Medium body. Finish dry.
Bottle. Clear golden with fluffy white head. Aroma is caramel, dried fruits, yeast, grass. Sweet malty taste with fruits and slight bitterness.
Pours hazy golden with a lasting white head and lots of foamy lacing. Aroma has notes fruits. Taste is tart, yeasty with notes of citrus and pine. Finish is bitter. Great beer.

Very nice appearance. The foam lasts long as it should and the colour's not too dark. It's easy to drink, smells great and tastes even better.

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10
Deep blond colour. Harmonious, full taste of sour, sweet and bitter. warm aftertaste.

Dark golden look with a profuse white head. Sweet aroma with notes of caramel. Sweet taste with hints of caramel, toffee and dates. Medium sweet after taste, far sourness, low carbonation. Definitely good, but way too sweet.
UPDATED: JUL 20, 2015 Excellente Triple!!!  Une de mes préférée!!!Alcoolisée mais avec tout plein de gout :)
Nice head. Spicy & fruity aroma. Great fresh taste, like white wine. Very good beer!!!

Shared at St Louis Brews meeting, from 12oz brown bottles into sampler glasses. It poured a hazy amber colour, darker than expected, with thin off-white foam and lace. Nice bottle-conditioned traits. Very low aroma, hints of husky grain and noble hops, more Belgian yeast spice than anything else. Flavour was a bit sweet for style but nice, slightly grainy and caramelly, with definite pepper and clove notes. None of the fruitiness I associate with classic Belgian Tripels. Medium body, high carbonation, well-rounded but slightly sticky mouthfeel. Well-concealed alcohol. Reasonably tasty but not a great example of style.

Aroma is quite fruity, floral, hints of cloves and banana. Hazy brown colour with a lively white foamy head, looks fantastic. Big on the palate, hints of caramel, banana, cloves, some liquorice there do. The 10% ABV is very well masked. Great beer!

Very good beer. Not so strong but with a very good taste.
In my opinion, the best beer made by Maredsous

330 ml bottle. 
Appearance: Orange amber with a medium size head. 
Aroma of fruits(peaches,bananas), spices, yeast, grassy hops, a hint of alcohol.
Taste:Sweet brown sugar and dried fruit with a bit of sournes then a little bit of spice before it finishes with a light resin like bitterness with a bit of alcohol. For the 10% ABV alcohol its quite decent hidden.

Medium body, sticky, medium carbonation.
330 ml bottle. Pours an orange amber with light head. Aromas of peaches, bananas and light spice. Flavors of resin, brown sugar, dried fruit, and alcohol. Acrid.

33cL. Bottle. Home. Unclear orange brown beer with a white head not very persistant. Aroma of spices, alcohol, caramel with banana and pear. Sweet bitterness. Nice body. Bitter warm finish. Nice balance between malts, hops and yeast. Dont drink this beer too cold. Let the magic happens !
Oranje goud bier, licht troebel met stevige kraag. Aroma is fruitig, mango, licht hoppig. Smaak is zuurig met een bittertje.

33cl bottle @ home. Clear golden color (cloudy bottom), excellent long lasting white head. Sweetish smell, citrus, bread. Taste light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light umami, light salty. A little bit of everything which makes it very intersting. Medium body, sticky, lively carbon, light sweetish bitter finish, alochol is well hidden. Not really my style, but its an interesting beer.

Schöne dunkelblonde Farbe mit schön hellbeigem Schaum. Der Geruch ist hell nach gelben Früchten. 
Im Antrunk ist das Bier merkwürdig sauer, kurz darauf entfaltet sich eine milde, aber deutlich Herbe Note zum Hauptteil hin. Dazu kommen ganz leichte Aromen gelber Früchte, sowie eine ganz leicht scharf-alkoholische Note, die für 10% aber sehr mild ausgeprägt ist. Im Nachgeschmack ist das Bier wärmend-herb mit ganz leicht süßlich-fruchtigen Zügen. 
--> Ganz nett, aber die Aromentiefe und -vielfalt könnte ausgeprägter sein!


Test vom 9.12.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 12,9,9,7,12,7 - 8,35

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2014 Pours a hazy golden with a huge white head. Aroma of fruits, spices, yeast, grassy hops, a hint of alcohol. Medium sweetness, dry finish with light bitterness in the aftertaste. Good Tripel.

Muito boa! Bom balanço no amargor x sabor x aroma. Nem muito fraca nem muito forte. Recomendado.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(Flasche) Es hat eine dunkelorangene Farbe, ist leicht trüb mit einer fast weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist getreidig, karamellig, leicht erdig, minimaler Säure und Mandeln im Hintergrund. Der Geschmack ist samtig, etwas schwer, leicht alkoholisch und sonst wie das Aroma. Der Abgang ist samtig und leicht alkoholisch.

Kaatuu tulppaaniin kullankeltaisena ja kirkkaana, parin sormen paksuisella vaahdolla, joka jättää melko vahvaa pitsiä. Hajussa on makeamman puoleista sitrusta, belgihiivaista mausteisuutta ja yrttisyyttäkin, mutta myös melko pistävää alkoholimaisuutta, joka saa tämän tuntumaan melko haastavalta. Maku on niin ikään todella vaikea, sitrusmaista viljaisuutta siitä ainakin löytyy, myös yrttisyyttä ja siemenistä sintumaa, aivan kuin korianteria. Jälleen on tuntuvaa alkoholisuutta, lämmittävää ja lähes pistävää sellaista. Suutuntuma on melko täyteläinen, lämmittävä ja hieman pistävä. Todella haastava tripel, jossa on kyllä tuttuja vivahteita, mutta aivan kuin olisi heitetty hieman kossua joukkoon.
Die van arjans Sint. Ruikt lekker. Minder schuim en frisser dan die andere trippel. Die andere was zoeter en iets lekkerder.
In fles.Mooie oranje kleur. Goede afstemming tussen zuurtje en bittertje. Mooie knisper op de tong.

Mooi honing kleurig bier. Geur honing zoet. Smaak honing zoet met een klein zuurtje, mout duidelijk aanwezig.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a beautiful amber, with a decent, bubbly head. Aroma of malt, banana, alcohol, bread, strawberries, maybe a bit of pine. Taste is bitter before sweet, maybe even a bit salty. Soft, fine carbonation, with a good body. Short, syrup character finish. Im generally not a fan of high fermentation beers, but this ones a better one. Could be good with dried fruit and nutty cheeses.
330ml bottle. pours a slightly hazy brown with big head. aroma is of caramel, plums, yeast and toffee. nice mouth feel. very sticky. sweet, alcoholic, yeasty. really good.

Pored from a bomber. Pours a rich, cloudy goden color. Slightly off white head. Taste starts sour and big. Moves to slightly bitter on the back end. Very mild aftertaste. Mout feel is very pleasant. Small sting on the tounge and very smooth. Good as far as the abbey brews go. Definately not mass produced but misses a bit from the "higher end" abby beers. Would definately drink again.
UPDATED: MAY 17, 2014 33cl fles. Lichtgeel van kleur. Witte schuimkraag. Eerste smaakimpressie: mandarijn, bitter. Goede afdronk.
A little too bitter for my likening but a very nice beer anyway. Floral and tastey. A little strong

Interesting triple. Not so mainstream as is the case with other abbey beers like for example Leffe or Grimbergen. Slightly more bitter than the average triple, fresh and crisp carbonation makes it refreshing. Enjoyed it quite much.

Colour: bright gold with a neat white head
Nose: hay, toast, mandarin, wheat crackers
Flavours: sweet yeasts, raisin, orange peel, banana vanilla
Finish: long, round. More alcoholic at the end.
Verdict: for a commercial abbey tripel this is rather good. No real indication of alc. strength, the sweetness and roundness covers it properly.
The gods themselves then hath also said to thee they and them, then, that though shall bask in the Tripel.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2014 Bevuta questa sera nel formato da 75 cl, con la testa che ancora gira però soddisfatto, posso dire che è una birra fantastica.Aroma delizioso, con il naso assolutamente rapito da un lieve sentore di frutta secca, lievemente disperso l?odore erbaceo, ed un sentore denso di arancio. L?apparenza è splendida, con una birra sull?arancio opalescente ed una schiuma bianco sporco, persistente e densa, bella corposa. Tre dita abbondanti di schiuma che hanno accompagnato entrambi i bicchieri di birra. Il primo sorso fa sentire indistintamente la frutta secca e soprattutto l?arancio, con una dolcezza appena accentuata ed una media amarezza. Acidulo, il richiamo. Al palato la birra presenta un corpo pieno, consistenza corposa, e finale acidulo e lungo. Una ottima birra, per me buona anche per meditare, ma l?ho provata con un po? di speck affumicato e l?accoppiamento non mi è spiaciuto. That?s a great beer.

Aroma: Frutado
Aparencia: caramelo escuro
Sabor: Frutado, caramelo e Excelente amargor
Overall: Uma bela cerveja com Espuma resistente e boa carbonatacao!

André Araujo de Oliveira

Bought a bottle at the liqor store in Leerdam. The beer has a hazy yellow/copper color and a nice white head, CO2 level is perfect. The aroma reminds me of pinnapples on syrup, and then the oranges come forward and there are also hints of nuts. The taste is pretty complex but the beer is very well balanced with on one side the bitterness and on the other side the fruitness this beer has to offer. Also the taste is soft and the high alcohol is not noticable. The finish has the same style as the taste and has a hint of grapefruits. A really nice tripel, please give me another one.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2014 orange colour, huge white head, which collapses within some minutes leaving back correct lacing; aroma of yeast, dried fruits (mostly raisin), honey, bread, and floral hops; taste of hoppy bitterness and yeast again, not too much malty sweetness, some fruity notes and spicy alcohol; really good tripel
Wonderful beer, easy on the tongue. Golden color, and great smell. A nice finish and crisp taste
0,33l bottle. Amber color with some lacing. Aroma is fruits and raisins. Taste is sweet with spices, fruits, raisins, burnt sugar and yeast. Alcohol is well hidden. Nice and tasty beer.

Bottle. Pours slightly hazy dark golden with a medium white head. Aroma is quite fruity and flowery with some yeast and alcohol as well. Taste is sweet, spicy, matls and some alcohol. Medium body and carbo. Quite an ok tripel.
Bottle. Pours cloudy yellow with nice white head. Aroma is malt, wheat, alcohol, hay, overripe fruits. Flavor is malt, wheat, alcohol, overripe fruits

Bottle. Pours clear golden with airy but stable off-white head. Clear aroma of malt and fruit with flowery notes. Sweet, malty flavour, with fruity, floral and boozy notes. Lingering bitter aftertaste. A really nice and well-balanced tripel.
Bottle. Deep golden color with a medium thin off-white head. Strong yeasty aroma with wheat and berries. Sour and bitter taste. Warming alcohol in finish.-- via beerbasher/winphone
Bottle - Deep amber pour with good head. Sour yeast aroma, a bit floral. Taste is like aroma with notes of dark caramel. Good carbonation, slight bit syrupy.

Bottle at Trollekelder, Gent as on Beer Of The Month special offer. Aroma: caramel, bread. Pours: golden, clear, with small white foamy head. Tastes: medium sweetness, lightly bitter. Palate: medium body, thin feel, lively carbonation, peppery finish.

330ml bottle from my big brothers hols. Pours clear golden yellow with a thin white head, good lacing. Aromas are reminiscent of Duvel, with more nuts, almonds, marzipan, and orange. Some apple on the taste. Hides the booze well. Great clean, crisp finish.
22 ounce bottle from Total Wine Sacramento, fruity aroma, grape?, sugary taste good.

Cerveja de cor marrom. Espuma abundante e amarela. Aroma alcoólico. Sabor adocicado. Corpo médio.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

February 2008, opened in October 2013. Mercy hazy brown with a white, lacy, lasting thick, lasting head. Smells of nut, grape, malt, yeast, raisins, and apple juice. Full smooth creamy body. Bitter nutty flavour, malt, with notes of wheat, and brown sugar. Toasted malt and grape dry finish. Nutty. Thanks to deanso for the beer.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2013 33cl bottle into tulip

Lille. 

Also 25cl en pression 

Appearance: cloudy golden orange. Excellent head with impressive retention. Nice lacing on glass. 

Aroma: yeast, sweet malt, alcohol. 

Taste: sweet but with a good balance of bitterness. Alcohol in the finish. 

Palate: full body, carbonation gives frothy texture, long finish. 

Overall: there is a lot to like about this beer, the appearance is about as good as you can ask for. The palate is well done also. Aroma is fairly typical for the style, though the alcohol is more present than most. When I first tried this, it may have been a bit too cold, so I let it warm a bit and tried again. Much better at cellar temps than straight out of the fridge.
Handsome beer. Accessibly tasty despite 10% AV. I dont normally drink beers above 8.5%, but this one is quite palatable even for a tenderfoot such as myself.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2013 Aroma is floral with hints of plum and raisins. Pours like a commercial, and carbonation keeps streaming from pour to finish. Flavor is more mild than most Trappists and the burn is much lighter. I love it.

Cloudy dark orange brownish amber. Small fizzy off white head. Small Wispy lasting with ring around glass. Aroma is sweet, a little brownish sour/barnyard, yeast, little fruity. Medium body. Yeast, spicy. A little alcohol. good amount of complexity.
Sweet, malty, yeasty, roasty, a little dark fruit. Very smooth and creamy. Very good beer

Amber body, big head, diminishes quickly. Aroma is cookies, caramel, sugar, coriander. Oily mouthfeel, nicely alcoholic. Finish is dry, bitter. Taste is amazingly balanced, fruit, caramel, sugar; nicely alcoholic.

Pours amber with lasting off- white head. Aroma is apple, fruity malty and yeasty. Taste is fruity, vinious, malty, perfumy and spicy. Dry warming finish.
Wow.. excellent! A must re-rate.
UPDATED: SEP 26, 2013 Pours a clear copper colour with a lace head. Aroma of melon, lemon and flowers. Taste as well. Slight biterness on the aftertaste. Medium carbonation.

Bottle at the ommegang cafe. Pours a golden tan cot with a bready, sweet and boozy tase. Very distinct and well made. Yeasty and delicious. Great with a sharp cheese 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark orange with a thick frothy head. Lemon pepper aroma. Taste s same with additions of banana, vanilla, and other mild spices. Bitter finish and very active carbonation. Oily mouthfeel and ABV nicely hidden with some gut warmth.

0,33 l bottle BB 12/2015 
caramel, chocolate, cereal, herbs, earthy, vanilla, woody, red, hazy, frothy, tan foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, thick feel, oily feel, average carbonation, long finish,

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2014 Nice deep cobber red with excellent off-white foam. Aroma is spicy Belgian yeast and some green apples. Nice medium wine palate. Aftertaste is dry with some alcohol. Overall: excellent! minus for Aftertaste.
-22.08.2014- The beer that i drunk most of when i got into craft beer. Nice to see you again old friend! Additional notes: The aftertaste is quite unique. Still excellent.

Un très bon classique, équilibré et plaisant.
Je ne suis pas sûr que la qualification de Triple soit réaliste, elle manque de sécheresse pour cela.
Cela reste une bière blonde puissante et dense.

Bottle @ Gregs dump picked up at Wilburs Foco. Pours a hazy dark orange appearance with a big cream colored head. Somewhat spicy, banana, lemon, chewy spicy yeasty aroma. High boost, tangy lemon, chewy malty, light apple, spicy yeasty flavor. Bottle may be a bit dated but this isnt bad.
bottle courtesy of stupid adnielsen, thanks jerk. pours a dark orange color with a white head. aroma is lemony and spicy. taste is coriander and pretty good

Pours hazy golden with a lasting white head and lots of foamy lacing. Aroma has notes of strawberries, melon, citrus and flowers. Taste is tart, yeasty with notes of citrus and pine. Finish is bitter.
de couleur ambre on sens des aromes de raisins sec et caramelise en bouche on snes une certaine profondeur mais je m attendais a plus le petit gout caramelise (rate 130)

2013/08/28 - Pours a translucent brown/amber colour with a thick and frothy off white head. Aroma is Belgian yeast, toasted malts, spices, banana and raisins. Taste is similar to nose; bitter and spiced up front with a sweet malt aftertaste. Mouthfeel is medium to thick, strong carbonation and a warming finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours amber. Lots of bubbles in beer, and a big, almost marshmallow like, white head. Yeast, alcohol, banana and spicy nose. Pepper? Sweet. Warming mouth feel. Frizzy carbonation. Pepper, alcohol, yeast, banana aroma. Too much alcohol in my opinion. Decent.
Clear golden pour. Fruit and yeast aroma. A bit malty also with some clove and banana. Smooth drinking.

Nice golden colour, large white head, sweet golden honey taste that covers up the higher ABV. Smooth drink with nice sweet finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Reddish pour medium head. Aroma of yeast, clove and banana. Taste like malty banana bread with wheat and cloves. Banana in the start, clove hoppy middle and a bit of alcohol at end. Decent smooth beer.

Pours a golden amber color with medium white head leaving heavy lacing. Aromas of grape and light malt with notes of citrus. Flavor has an immediate bitterness that fades quickly to notes of malt, grape, and a little spiciness a very pleasantly complex beer. A very smooth beer for a tripel, not a lot of the hefeweizen notes you tend to get with more of a wheat flavor than other similar beers. Very nice
Clear Golden body, white head. Nice fruity and yeasty aromas. Noble hops, floury malt and alcohol. Flavour is bit harsh but gets Belgian notes when warms. Pretty Nice tripel after all.
Raisins taste with some bitterness in the background. Sour palate with cinamon nutes. White and medium thick head, stays on top for circa two minutes. Light-amber colour, hazy.

Poured reddish amber with a frothy white head. Aroma of spiced dark fruit and caramel malt. Medium, lively body, flavour quite vinous with some berries and a bit of citrus with a short, sharp sweet end.
Aroma of grass and hops. Alcohol is obvious in the taste. Too unbalanced. I had better triples..

Une bière un peu trop forte comparé à l arôme qu' elle développe et trop douce à mon goût 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a golden orange with large, stylish, off-white head. Aroma is apple, apricot, peach. Some caramel, strong marzipan, light yeast. Taste is a lot of apple, dried apricot, yeast, light marzipan, some peach and pepperiness. The alcohol comes through rather strong. A lot of perfumey ethanol and apple on the finish and aftertaste. Some floweriness as well. Palate is full and with a lot of carbonation. Good otherwise, but really needs to tone down with the alcohol.

33 cl bottle, served in original glass @ Hotel Rembrandt lobby bar in bangkok. After 2+ weeks in pale lager hell, this beer is a godsend. Light brownish color, little lacing. Fruity sweet taste with malt and lots of alcohol + heat. Bitter aftertaste. A decent triple.

Orange-amber colour, and thick head, slightly yellowish, average carbonation. Smell is herbal, and malty too. Taste is yeasty, not really fruity, and bitter.
A typical tripel, sure an ok beer, but not really between the best tripels in my opinion, it lacks of complexity, too little notes.
Thuis uit fles, oranje bruine kleur, niet helder, beige/witte schuimkraag, ruikt een beetje muf, fruitig, alcohol, smaakt zoet, alcohol, fruitig, lekker

Botella de 33 cl probada en casa. Al principio el aroma tiene un toque a naranja. En boca se nota una alta graduacion y un toque medio de gas. El color es anaranjado lo que, junto con una espuma aceptable, hace que tenga una buena apariencia.
Precioso ámbar oscuro, poca espuma y muy persistente. Aroma dulce, a azúcar tostada, ron, un toque de café torrefacto, alcohol. Sabor a malta, dulce, el alcohol no se esconde.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2013 033l fles biergilde hoorn. amberkleurig bier bezinksel en met fijn wit schuim dat goed blijft staan. In de geur mout en kruiden daarnaast ook alcohol. In smaak een mooie balans tussen zoet zuur en bitter, rozenbottel komt ook naar voren. Medium body met een redelijke afdronk. Tikkje alkalisch mondgevoel

Bottle 33 cl, BBE 10/2015. Pours clear golden in color with a small whitish head. Bready malty notes, 

some grapes and light vinegar notes in aroma. Fruity sweetness in taste at first with light notes of 

grassy bitterness as well. Some spicyness in flavor, a bit too sweet on the whole to be enjoyable.

Wieder mal ein belgisches aus unserem schier unendlich zugekauften Vorrat aus Wavreile und Umgebung. Und wie so oft ist dieses hier nicht seine Punkte wert. Getreidig, dumpf, säuerlich, unaufgeregt unterdurchschnittlich. Vielleicht sollte ich es im Winter nochmal damit proboeren.

Pours out of the bottle in a cloudy deep dark brown colour, medium-smooth body and low creamy head. Looks nice, but the Belgian beers sometimes hide bad surprises. It has got a nose of rum roisins and Belgian yeast. Taste of prunes, spruce, leaves, Belgian yeast, light malt and toffee. Not as nice as hoped, more a little bit dull and boring with being quaffable. Average.
Draft at Eulogy. Hazy orange amber pour with a large foamy off-white head. Spicy caramel. Vanilla bourbon. Paprika. Raw sugar cane. Agave. Pepper. Hint of dark fruits underneath. Not bad.

block sized head near strong carbonation deep amber pour aromas nice yeast grape vinous touch spice fruit sugar candy the flavours sweetness malt grain brown sugar yeast citrus rich spice grapes woody note swet type cinnamon clove caramel the finish sweetness is the winner in this tripel alround it is superb backed up by some good flavours it makes strong tasting tripel

Ambrée claire, forte effervescence, col fin beige clair. Le caramel et le rôti dominent mais pas trop, présence de fruits noirs et de sucre candi, bon équilibre. Agréable chaleur de lalcool sur la fin.

33 cl flaske, 10 %, gave fra Søs, tak - 19. juli 2013. 
Gyldenbrun øl med 1 cm hvidt skum. Aroma af fersken. Ret kraftig alkoholsmag og et bittert smagsindtryk. Moderat kulsyre indhold. Ikke helt den samme friskhed som øvrige triple'r, som måske også skyldes den ønskede alkoholstyrke. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The color is a hazy orangeish amber color with a large white head, and the aroma isnt what I was expecting due to the skunky scent that overpowered the combination of sour fruit, basement aromas, and dough yeast. The taste is not that pleasant due to the heavy sourness and a touch of sweetness, and the palate combines a lively carbonation, medium body, slick texture, and a malty finish. There is one good thing about this beer: it hides the booze it contains well.

330ml bottle from a German supermarket. Big, fluffy off-white head. Clear, dark golden body. Malty aroma dominated by dark fruits and a sweet floral aroma from the hops I also sense some caramel and burned wood. Very well balanced. Light and sweet when tasted, with a bitter finish. The alcohol is barely noticeable, even at 10% vol. Excellent palate. All in all a very good beer.

Dark amber pour with a white head. A bit darker than your average tripel. Aromas of yeast, coriander, dried fruit, and malt. Big malt presence on the palate with the dark fruits coming through in the finish. One of the best tripels Ive ever had. Great beer.
In stenenkelk. Ruikt hop en zoetig. Smaakt apart. Kruiden, caramel. Doorsnee bier.

Copper coloured beer with an one finger offwhite head which disappears quickly. Aroma of coriander, ash and alcohol. Tastes of coriander, alcohol, banana, caramel and slitghtly roasted malts. Oily structure with less bitterness. Finish is loong... With coriander and bananas. Medium carbo.
0.33 bottle. Light amber color, average head, spicy, wine and citrus aroma, same full bodied taste with dry, lighly hop finish, good balance.
33cl bottle @ home, from Maes Dendermonde; golden colour, big fluffy lasting head; medium carbo; caramel, slightly bitter, oily, alcoholic aftertaste, slightly metallic; OK beer.
amber, hazy, tan foam, bread, hay, cereal, full body, oily feel, average carbonation, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness,
orange, cloudy, white foam, caramel, roasty, floral, earthy, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter,
This is one of my favorites, nice brown coloring, goes down smooth and tastes fantastic.

2010 bottle. Iced tea colored pour with plenty of off white head. Nose is fairly yeast heavy with dark fruit. Taste has a candied sweetness to it but is also yeast heavy. Fairly heavy on the carbonation. Not terrible but many many better options for the style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
quite dark, amber colored for a tripel, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, caramel,
Flavour: slight warming alcohol, slightly fruity. Medium sweetness. Medium body, lively carbonation. Good, but not exceptional.

Aroma: Toffee, white chocolate, horsey, clove, spicy, floral, hops
Appearance: Clear copper, very thin, long lasting head with a small amount of lacing.
Taste: Medium bitterness, very dry finish. Light malt sweetness. Alcohol warming. Spicy.
Palate: Highly carbonated, slick mouth-feel, Medium thin bodied.
Overall: A good tripel, although I am not a big fan of the heavies. The appearance is quite disappointing.


330 ml bottle, poured.
Poured from a chilled bottle into a glass. Light brown color, nice full head. Sweet caramel smell. Not much of an initial taste, sweet after taste.
Golden/amber colour, medium carbonation. Rather sweet tripel, Fruity aroma with notes of honey. Some bitterness in the end.
Clear orange brown appearance with minimal head. Taste like oranges carmel. Does have a slight alcohol taste but not overwhelming.
Sterke smaak, gedronken bij mosselen en t smaakte. Een zeer eigen smaak, zal er nog drinken :-)

10 oz. goblet at Hulmeville Inn.
Aroma was like fruit cake, very pungent. Taste was berries, banana, clove, raisin, plum ... very smooth for 10% A bit heavy. I was hesitant to try because of the "sweet after-taste" described but it was not at all cloying. A very lovely beer.
33cl bottle at home. A bit hazy orange with a nice white head. Medium sweetness and a bit sour. Hints of honey and caramel. Medium carbonation. Overall a very decent tripel.

caramel, bread, grass, citrus, amber, orange, clear, minimal head, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, soft carbonation, astringent,
Amber orange pour with short lasting white foam. Some lacing. Aroma mostly caramel with citrus/grass.  Caramel sweetness with light bitterness. A soapy/oily mouthfeel and a dry finish. A bit of alcohol heat with slight astringency.  Kind of a pricy beer - expected a bit more somehow for this specialty 10% ABV Belgian.
Cloudy orange with a smallwhite head. Fruity aroma with yeasty notes and some spice. Sweet fruity flavour with yeasty notes and hot, offensive alcohol
Nice malty aroma, with a large bubbles of carbonation in the head. Nice clean taste a big finish of hops with a unique combination of citrus and spice.
Aroma frutado com leve toque de banana, extende-se as mesmas características ao sabor, com adição de leve amargor. Cor dourada forte com bela formação de espumas e belo corpo.
Bottle. Pours a dark orange colour with a medium size head, malty and sweet aroma, the taste is sweet, with a dry finish.

Ppurs an average frothy off-white head that mostly diminishes. Bosy is clear yellow orange. Aroma contains light bread, hay, grass, citrus fruits, dough, soap, banana, honey, vanilla and spices. No notes  were made on flavor. Body is light to medium, with creamy texture and soft carbonation. A tyical tripel, not very complex but still good.
Pours deep gold, white head. Nose is orange, spice, pepper. Flavour is very sharp dark fruit, banana, a hint of alcohol. Very clean, sharp beer. Alcohol works here.

Orange brown with large and mostly persistent frothy white head.  Aroma yeast and grass.  Medium body with some carbonation and little alcohol.  Flavor is off dry, quite malty, somewhat fruity, some esters, some herbs and spice.  Pretty good, if not memorable.

colore bellissimo,rosso/ambrato carico con schiuma molto persistente.
al naso il fruttato del lievito ti aggredisce ma risulta molto piacevole.lalcool è piuttosto presente nellaroma.
corpo intenso,gusto molto deciso,lalcool è forse un pò troppo pronunciato,anche nel finale dolce lalcool si sente molto,luppolo poco presente,carbonazione ottimale.
birra sicuramente buona ma la pecca dellalcool mi spinge a dare un voto non troppo elevato.resta sicuramente una ottima birra,ma la preferirei leggermente meno alcolica..sembra quasi aggiunto a crudo!

pours amber-golden, the slim white head is gone quickly, very, light sweet and sour, medium bitter taste, nice texture in the mouth, average carbonation and long finish
this beer really has got character, highly recommended!

3ccl. Hazy radk orange, with a average longlasting, creamy white head. Great sweet, fruity, malty with notes of alchool and caramel. Flavour is also fruity, very aromatic and very drinkable despite the 10%. Great beer.
Nearly clear copper with a short lived off white head. Aroma is floral and hay. Taste is caramel sweet with a hint of some sour. Enjoyable but not noteworthy.
On-tap. Pours a cloud copper color. Nice fruity (orange, peach) and yeasty aroma. Taste - sweet,light alcoholic with nice spicy notes. Medium body with light-medium carbonation. Enjoyable beer.

A horrible example of an abbey triple.
airy, creamy, nothing-ish.
Cheap hoppy aroma.
Raw alcoholic taste.. no palate.
Horrible stuff.

Brown body with rising bubbles an form tan head. Pretty clear. Peppery, sweet malts, alcohol. Warming body, nee, alcoholic body. Little bitterness or otherwise flavours can come through. Everything that?s bad about Belgian brewing. We don?t want big abv boring spice but bombs, we want flavour, richness and quality ingredients. C?mon! (33cl bottle from Bierparadijs)

Un exemple du style à sa racine, cette sèche tripel présente un beau liquide doré qui se voile légèrement, et une belle mousse blanche penchant vers le crème. Les saveurs sont fruitées, complexes, voluptueuses, mais pas trop sucrées ni mal équilibrées. On dénote de labricot, des pêches, avec une petite finale houblonnée. Excellente triple, qui en plus cache bien son imposant taux dalcool.

330 ml bottle. L4015/2315. BB 08/2015. From bierzwerg.de.
Cloudy amber colour with a small creamy off-white head. 
Rather mild yeasty, malty and mildly hoppy aroma. 
The flavour is Belgian style yeast, mild hops and alcohol. Some woody notes too. Hmm... not very tasty for a Tripel. But definitely not bad...

A - Pours a burnt amber with a massive 2 finger cream head. It takes a long time for the sudsy head to sink into a thick 1/2 inch cap that stays throughout the entire beer.

S - Fruity yeast, apple skins, tart pear, peach, a hint of bubblegum, very bready.

T - Strawberry, pear, white grape skin, sugary booze, sweet spice cake. Solid bread malts, some herbal spice, candied lemon zest, grassy hops. Alcohol comes out more and more as it warms. Finishes dry with some peppery spice.

M - Creamy, full bodied, moderate carbonation.

This a nice Tripel with great characteristics. One of the best, if not the best retaining heads Ive ever seen on a beer.

Serving type: bottle

05-14-2011
March 2012. Bottle. Citrus and caramel aromas. Hazy orange with a white head. Spice, malt, yeast and sugary flavors. Good balance.

out of the firdge cold - and poured in to a glass, great head & lacing , the nose came out as it warmed up ,  caramel, toasty, light cheese, alcohol, amber, orange, hazy, lot of yeast in the bottle, just like my home brew,rocky head, white foam, 2 fingers tall,medium sweetness, the foamy head is lightly bitter, light body to medium body, creamy, lively co2,

11.2oz bottle, from Party Source. Best before 05 / 2015. Clear orange color. Good bigger one-finger white head, good retention. Decent lace. Bigger body. Moderate carbonation, soft texture. Somewhat dry in the finish. Belgian yeast. Light citrus fruit. Some candy sugar. Moderate spice. More sweet taste. Just a very light lightly sweet, lightly spicy bite in the finish. Solid tripel.

Good beer. The color is really dark for a tripel. Nice big white head that quickly fades away. The alcohol is hardly noticeable. A sweet sugary and rich flavor is accentuated with a distinct yeast flavor. A complex beer that is worth drinking.

Glass from a 75 cl bottle @ Zytho, Kontich
Foodpairing: plate of Belgian cheeses.
Cheesy aroma, burned, bread.
Amber blond, lacing head.
Gingerbread, bitter, herbal.
Long spicy finish.
Big fluffy white head. Biscuit nose. Tastes like raisin bread. Some alcohol taste on the palate. Solid
Great body with a never ending head.deep fruit taste excellent finish. Heart aftertaste.

Head: off-white, medium size, frothy. The colour is amber and hazy.

Aroma: dry winy wit some fruty notes, some yeast and a touch of alcohol. The taste has the same viny/dry character, some bitterness and warming alcohol.

33cl Bottle. Hazy honey gold. Thick white pillowy head. Nose is lush banana, figs, candy sugars, wheats. Taste is lighter than I was expecting with such an ABV% Pulling out a warm alcohol, banana, warm bread, syrup, a little spice, orange, fig. Sweet finish. Id be interested to see how this ages, as it doesnt shout "tripel" at me like others Ive had.

Thick light-tan or off-white head. A bit of lacing. Darker gold, slightly orange color. Pours clear. Effervescent. Dark fruit aromas - cherries? prunes? Medium bitter. Medium body. Malty, dark fruit flavors. A bit of warming alcohol at the finish.

This beer is so damn good. 

From research; brewed by Duvel, whom licensed the Maredsous name from the monks in 1963.

33cl bottle. Pours Light amber with medium white frothy head. Beautiful. Aroma is candy sugar, wheat and fruits. Strong taste: mostly caramel and licorice, with hints of orange and spice. Alcohol presence as well. Medium body, good carbonation. Overall its a weird blend, not the classical tripel at all.
330 ml bottle. Aroma of alcohol, caramel and fruits. Lots of yeast in the nose and some minty notes. Taste is rather harsh, caramel, yeast and alcohol. Should age well.

Pours a nice golden/orange beer with a rocky white head. The smell was difficult to find. It smelled a bit metal. The taste is meh.  Little bitter and sweet. Not much more. 
The palate is good. Average carbo, medium body and dry sticky texture. 

- Arjan
Smell is between light floral and dried hay. Color golden yellow and light cloudy. Taste slightly sweet and beautiful in balance. Nice beer.

Grapes, spices, bubblegum, vanilla, cinnamon, sugar and oranges is what i get in the aroma. Candisugar, spices, cardemom, cloves and flowers in the taste, with some bread and nutty flavors. Nice, smooth mouthfeel, perfectly carbonated.

On tap. Pours a great orange/amber color with a white head and lacing. It has a strong aroma of dark fruit along with some bread and yeast. The flavor is largely dark fruit, especially apricot and apple, along with a sweet and slightly sour aftertaste over a medium body.

33 cl. bottle procured @ ALBO. Darker somewhat hazy amber orange with a somewhat collapsing white head. Smell is esters, alcohol, some spices & alcoholic fruits. Taste is that of lots of barley malts, oranges, peel, sweet and bitter spices, BE yeast, somewhat fruity and light herbs,.. A bit too clean but fine still like the others. Medium, lightly full body  touch more lively carb.

bottle @ à la Becasse, Bruxelles. Profumo banale, caratteristico di una tripel, ma poco intenso, poco definito. Solo qualche nota di frutti gialli, ma il profumo dei malti è inesistente.
Alla vista è gialla intensa, quasi ambrata. Estremamanete limpida, anche troppo per essere quel tipo di birra. Schiuma compatta, ma poco persistente. In bocca ha poco corpo, le manca la dolcezza che il buon livello alcolico dovrebbe conferirle, e i luppoli sono poco caratteristici. Finale secco. In generale piuttosto deludente.

The strength of this beer does not make up for the shortcomings that are in it. .
There are not enough sweet notes and an underlying sour makes this all a bit confusing and disappointing.
Very satisfying Tripel. High alcohol is well masked, noticeable sweetness. No sedimentation.
750ml Belgian bottle, poured into 3oz snifter.  Relatively muted but pleasant honey aroma with a hint of funk.  Medium sweetness, slightly sour. Lively carbonation masks some of the flavor.

Excelente Tripel belga, com cor amarelo-cobre e media forma ao de espuma. Aroma frutado, alcoólico, desce com bom corpo, gosto de frutas amarelas, malte, lembrando pao, banana. A carbonataçao traz o picante da breja. Final médio, com algo picante. Ótima!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Initial lovely notes of honey. Surprisingly full body for a Belgian beer of such a bright colour...
Draft pour clear yellow nose with bubble gum and fruit ester.  Taste fruit, candy, and peppery spice.   Nice bitter finish
Amber coloured with a big rocky head. Smell: honey, sweet, alcohol, spicy, peaches. Taste: alcohol, wine, a bit malty. Full creamys body, fizzy, pleasent bitterness at the end.
drank a long time ago , when i was driving by a very small local pub. i remember it being very unique. but to much caramel for me . not that much, actualy, but i just HATE caramel.

On tap at Csakajósör, Budapest. Clear, amber color with medium, creamy, beige head. Dried plum and alcohol odor. Fruity, alcoholly, dried fruity aroma. Its a bit like a fruity dry wine. Really stong one. Later raisin and caramel also appears. Light bitter taste. Creamy texture, medium body, lively carbonation. Dry, fruity finish. Really strong beer with serious dried fruit flavour. Its delicious.
It pours with an amber brownish cloudy colour, apparent low carbonation and a pale white head. Some citrus and bitter notes. A good beer that only shows its alcohol when you have to stand.

Bottle. Pours golden with little head. Nose is fruity and yeasty. Taste is heavy on honey, almost overly sweet. Has the traditional Belgian yeasty trappings. Palate is incredibly soft and delicate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a deep copper color.  Head is light but lingering.  Aromas fruity, apricots and barley.  Sweet on palate, def a closer. Great job!

Bouteille 330ml. De couleur dorée et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (agrumes, notes dabricots) et léger-moyen épicées (coriandre, poivre), de grains de malt sucrés avec des notes de caramel, de houblon herbeux et dalcool doux. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement assez fort et une texture légèrement crémeuse. Goût de levures fruitées (agrumes, léger dabricots, notes de pommes, faibles traces de bananes) et moyennement épicées (coriandre, léger de poivre, notes de clou de girofle) lors de lentrée en bouche suivi dun goût de malt sucré (notes de caramel doux) avec des notes de pain  puis en finale lon retrouve un léger goût amer dalcool moyen (notes réchauffantes), de houblon floral sec aux notes herbeuses. Post-goût long et un peu sec, légèrement amer dalcool doux, de houblon floral avec des notes de levures fruitées (zeste dagrumes).

33 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20100722.
Pours golden color with a medium sized head. Aroma of yeast, fruits, spices and pale malts. Flavor of yeast, fruits, caramel, malts and hay.

Poured into a Chimay chalice. Copper like colour with one finger of head at first, becoming just half a finger at the end and staying in that height for quite long. A fountain of bubbles is rising to the top from the center of the glasss bottom.
Aroma of grapes and dark fruits. Something else too,pleasant, but I cant put my nose on it.Mango as someone else wrote? I cant tell and the aroma is quite faint, so it doesnt really help me.
Taste follows the aroma, it tastes very good, and it reminded me of roze wines, except that is of course carbonated.
Medium thickness on the body, the alcohol well conceiled, becomes though more obvious after the first sips and as the beer warms up.
A great beer, cant wait to try the Maredsous 6 and 8.
Complex aroma, appealing appearance and a wonderful taste! [short review due to it coming from my backlog]

33 cl bottle as Maredsous Triple @ Utsjoki. Rated on 03.08.2009
Aroma is somewhat fruity with apricot, some citrus and floral notes. Flavour has alcohol, apricot, citrusy notes, some caramel, distant floral notes and hints of spices. A bit too boozy and stinging.

Magnum aged for a year, pours gold with small white head. Nose of crackers, grass, and pears. The pears transfer to the mouth, body is strong but less burly than a few. Booze is perfect while multi-tasking rocking a baby and sitting fireside.

Pours dark golden, if not amber. Aroma is spicy with no fruitiness but almost soapy smell. Head is white but not that long lasting. Taste is Christmas spicy with a warm, Scotch feel. Aftertaste leaves a slight warm glow.

Belle blonde dorée avec un collet consistant et tenace. Demblée, on voit les fines bulles qui montent vers le col. Belle bière que lon aura intérêt à servir dans son verre tulipe. Les arôme sont dabord subtils. Rien de très parfumeux ou dévident sinon quelques fruits séchés et le parfum du malt. En bouche, cette bière est équilibrée, pas trop sucrée ni trop amère. Les 10% dalcool sont bien cachés. Bon goût de malt, de pain frais, quelques traces subtiles de petits fruits. On ne se trompe pas avec une Maredsous, dont la brune fut lune des premières bonnes bières auxquelles jai goûté. Dailleurs, la triple 10 est disponible au Québec depuis une couple dannées, alors quavant nous navions que la brune 8. Bon choix de nous ajouter cette option! Bonne dégustation. Cheers!
Honey & orange zest aroma & taste with a strong alcohol finish. Medium body, smooth mouthfeel with a lasting head. Very nice
Mid gold pour with a fluffy white head. Aroma is fruity, alcohol, herbs. Big malty taste, alcohol is obvious, sharp, acidic, finishes dry and very warm from the high alcohol
Bottle at mondo vino, hua hin, thailand. Pleasant aroma, plum and licorice, sweetness. Nice taste of malts, plum, licorice, hops at the end.

Bottle at the Brussels Beer Cafe, Petaling Jaya, Malaysia. Poured a cloudy medium brown with a thick, but short-lived white head and lots of broken lace. The aroma is not unexpectedly of Belgian yeast and alcohol. The flavour is a little more difficult. Its medium to strong bitter with most of the bitterness coming from the alcohol which hits the palate pretty quickly. There is also another strange aniseed like element to the flavour too. Id be tempted to say this beer tastes like a Maredsous 10, but that would not be much use so I wont !  It has many characteristics that are similar to a regular Tripel and many that are not. Im no Tripel fan, but I enjoyed it nevertheless. It certainly got the attention of the bar staff here in Malaysia when I ordered one over a Stella!
Bottle.  Orange pour.  Big white head.  Aroma of banana, cherry, and strong alcohol esters.  Flavor is banana with a slight dryness and a strong alcohol finish.  Heavy body.  Medium carbonation.

pours orange with a white head.aroma is malt,orange zest and spice.flavor is malty,light citrus and some pepper and coriander.medium body,high carbonation and fizzy mouthfeel.finish is crisp,slightly astringent.not to boozy for ten percent.everything about this triple is average.its not bad but in my opinion not too good either.
Triple sin mucho aroma pero fácil de degustar, se nota el alcohol y deja pocos matices en boca.

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2013 330ml bottle at BXL East. Pours a hazy yellow/orange color with beautiful frothy head. Aromas if yeast and sweet fruit. Taste of ripe fruit, yeast, citrus, spice and a light hop component.

330ml bottle. fresh hoppy aromas, along with some spicy ones. Pours hazy golden, with huge white head, persistent, good lacework. Medium body, crispy, high carbonation. Taste is a bit citrus, crispy, malty, with some spicy flavour. Enjoyable.
Good triple....great aroma. Nice dark red color with a strong finish. Good strong 10% beer.

A very good Maredsous. Pours an awesome red golden color with a white head. Smells of red apples, licorice and thyme. Taste is very much the same, with a heavy malty finish. Had in the bottle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Or foncé avec une mousse moyenne. Arome de fruits sec. Le goût est sucré, comme des fruits sec. Il y a un peu de chaleur dalcool.

Licht amberkleurig, wazig met een afnemende witte schuimkraag die een mooi laagje overlaat. 
Geur: zoet en alcohol. Smaak: start zoet met kandijsuiker en wat kruidig. Gemiddeld zoet en bitter, koolzuur eveneens gemiddeld aamwezig. Gemakkelijk te drinken, geen uitschieter.



Aldus Huubs.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a golden brown with a head that reduces to a lacing quickly. Aroma of plums, damsons, syrupy malt, a bit of lemon zest, and warming from the alcohol. Its maybe a bit too sweet for me at the start, but it is balanced quite well with bitterness at the finish, its not crisp, but it makes it easy to drink. I enjoyed this more as it went on. Nice

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2013 Bottle dated best by Nov. 2013 served in a Corsendonk chalice. 
Superb appearance, with clear orange-amber liquid under a generous and dense tan head that has a slight reddish tint.  The head has excellent feel and duration. 
Aroma: Sweet and complex with spicy yeast, alcohol and alcohol esters, and some pale malts. 
T:  Nicely fruity with a bit of spiciness. Some hops seem apparent in the spiciness and in the excellent bitter/sweet balance. Medium-light body. Good aftertaste suggestive of a spicy/yeasty lambic. Hints of banana, clove, pear, apple and raspberry.

O: I more often than not prefer dubbels over tripels -- including Rochefort & Westmalle. Such is the case with the Maredsous line. In this tripel, the high ABV is a bit too obvious in both the nose and the feel.  Still, unquestionably excellent, with the whole experience exceeding the impression imparted by individual sensory characteristics. Better than the Victory Golden Monkey that followed it in virtually every respect.
Lett lyst øl med lite skum. Lettdrukket øl son kan passe godt en sommernatt. Skal dette være klodteøl?

No idea why I never got to reviewing this after years, bottles and tap pours. Never being overly excited may have done it. Well, Ive unearthed a bottle with an old label from deep in the spider infested corners of The Beerium - bbf 03 2011 - No idea when I got this. Poured out a thick carpet of smooth froth that will not leave, filthy old burnt orange brown beer after the toxic spooning in of goop. damn... almost forgot about the review... nice aroma of pears, sweet plums, cherry based mild spice on long sniffs, light clove and a bit of burnt sugar. Smells pretty good, ja. Tasty. Initial watery thoughts get forgotten due to a stronger spice contingency after considerable warming. Light alcohol burn, some smoothness. Fuck. my consecutive bean based meal is catching up to me. Plumy, clove, alc, mild initial bitterness, some nose bitterness. Not a lot of flavour complexity here. Molasses, citrus, ya. On the Funyun scale - which has no defining "out of" scale - it has been decided by a group of American experts that I have gathered after years of study and research - that this beer is 8 Funyuns. This is totally based on the pure enjoyment level and cultural value of Funyuns by others as I myself have not only never enjoyed one, Ive never even seen a bag for sale as they are not shipped to Canada. I also have consistently spelled it incorrectly. But the scale - undefined in its terms of conventional scales - not based "out of" 10 is not only legit and logical - it is legally binding in 162 countries (not including Bahrain - sorry). Thanks Shag. The RB numbers in no way represent this beers legit Funyun rating. This is an 8 Funyun beer.
On tap at de saloon Amsterdam - pours a translucent copper with a tiny thin head, aroma is Caramel, with some citrus notes, Taste is yeasty, slightly bitter some undertones of oak oddly. Nice beer

Thanks to Kristīne.
Pours hazy, light amber with white middle lasting top. Sweet flavor of malt with yeast in vanguard, far away tones of plums and candies, abrupt mouthfeel, lively carbonated, mild dry finish. No hops, bitter nor in aroma nor in taste. Alcohol is presented in not hidden manner but not as intruder also. Above medium body.
Nothing to remember so I will try some more tripel examples and then re-rate this.
From a 75 cl bottle shared at home.  Pours a clear amber with a thick off white head.  Yeast malt aroma.  Sweet and round mouthfeel.  Orange peel notes.  Bitter finish.

Bottle bought at the Norwegian wine monopoly. Not my favorite trappiste style of beer. Lacking in sparkle and complexity. A bit too yeasty for my taste and not fruity enough for the style. Will not buy this again.

Bottle at ÖÖWF cons 2012-11-17 Örebro
Must have had this before???
AR: fudgy butter, liqueur, white grapes
AP: clear copper, wee transparent head
F: fudgy, buttery, warming - wee alcoholic, grainy, white grapes, sugary feeling, dry in my palate
From bottle. Aroma made me a little worried, but it tastes wonderful, with great honey and sweet fruit flavors. A great tripel.

Nov. 23, 2012. On tap at Brewery Ommegang, Cooperstown, NY - followed up by a bottle tasting the next day. Sampled alongside a bowl of vegetarian chili at the cafe on site. Lemon-floral, well-balanced, dry finish. The 10% alcohol is well-hidden. Bottom line: A great tripel!
Smells nice when you open the bottle. Aromas of alcohol and sweet fruits Tickle the nostrils. It tastes a little sweet with a little bitter aftertaste.

Pours deep golden, almost amber, with a tight, creamy, pure white head and a persistent lacing.  The nose is a solid mix of spices, but theres a hint of perfumed soap here - this recedes with time.  Theres the quintessential buttery element that introduces a subtle savoury profile of herbs and gently sautéed onions.  This is all propped up by a generous yeast character which ties everything into a honeyed whole.  The taste is much the same: spicey, herbal, perfumed; with good dryness.  The finish is a slow regression to that first note of perfumed spices and then a little alcohol sting.  Though it never really rises above the competition, it is enjoyable and I imagine itd only get better with a year or two in bottle.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2012 Vroeger was het etiket zwart/rood welke ik persoonlijk veel mooier vond dan het huidige etiket. echter het gaat om de inhoud,

Aroma: iets van bloemen/kruiden
Smaak milde appelazijn, fruitige aromas, redelijke alcoholisch niveau,  droge kruiden en milde bitterheid. 

Over het algemeen een stevige smaak die pittig en bitter is

nasmaak : vrij lange bittere nasmaak

jammer het etiket van vroeger en de indruk ervan was beter dan de inhoud.
Flaske kjøpt på polet i vika. Klar, rav farge. Skarp sødme, humle,gjær og alkoholsmak. En definitivt smakt mer smakfull triple enn dette

I thought this was a unique Tripel. It had some Dubbel characteristics. Nice malt and yeast aroma. Nice dark, cloudy amber color with a creamy head. Nice thick lacing too. Heavy palate without being too filling. Alcohol was well hidden. Nice balanced bready flavor with spice.

Gold with a tint of brown, quite murky. Beautiful big, fluffy, creamy off-white head. Crazy tiny bubbles rampant in the glass. Nose is brown sugar and spice, a little vinegary sour yeast. Not much complexity of taste, sweetness, hints of molasses and a mellow maltiness. Smooth mouthfeel, very lively carbonation. Slight sourness in the finish. Have had better tripels, enjoyable enough.

Sourish tasting tripel, darker than most in this style. slight aroma of vinegar, but taste is smooth and acerbic at the same time. Some wood, caramel and grass come through in the flavor. A little different, but excellent.
Fruity sweet aroma.  Orange amber with white head.  Hint of tangerine sweetness.  Very slight bitterness.  Just a little alcohol warmth.

330ml bottle. Big, foamy, white head. Clearish copper colour. Aroma is light fruit and bread yeast. Tastes like sparkling wine with some musty yeast and earthy bitterness. Hint of spice. Body is fizzy and fry, kind of like a champagne. Overall, I like my Belgian beer sweeter and this was to my tastes. Quite easy drinking for a 10% beer.

Aroma: caramel, alcohol
Appearance: golden, cloudy, frothy head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness
Palate: full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish
Overall: great bear!

A little dull this one. Not much taste, despite the beautiful look of it in the glass. I will wait a long time before I taste this one again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Amber, slightly cloudy, rapidly diminishing white head; yeasty aroma, a touch of orange; spicy, smooth, lemony, fairly sweet with some light bitterness; lingering dry finish; alcohol barely noticeable; its good, but I was left with the feeling that I could have got a lot more pleasure from a lot less alcohol.

Poured from 330 ml bottle into Chalice glass (Affligem)

A:  brown/orange copper color with a foam very persistent and almost white  ---------  spicy, fruit and a bit of alcohol. Not strong smell.-------  obvious presence of alcohol and brown sugar but good balance with malt ,and  in my opinion short of bitter-------  medium carbonation, and medium to full bodied, Nice in mouth. ---------  good belgian strong ale that you must drink slowly. Surely not my first choice  but enjoyable beer.

Discreta Tripel dallottima reperibilità anche nella GDO, naso tipico dello stile, non molto intenso (fruttato, miele, spezie...).
In bocca è quasi dolce, calda, di corpo.....con un finale dolce/amaro abbastanza equilibrato.....

Real solid tripel, though by no means outstanding.

Had a dominant boozey apple cider character followed by dark, slightly toasted fruit malt notes.  Beautiful hazy ruby blond with a creamy white tight bubble head that clung to the glass intensely.  Very drinkable and smooth.
Pours a almost clear copper. Very carbonated. Aroma is dark fruit and alcohol. Taste is same nice beer.
Me encanta su color... casi ambar, de aroma no muy intenso pero sabor alcoholico rico y con un final que me recuerda a chicle de frutas.

Bottle. Light amber, hazy, average and diminishing head. Moderate, malty and sugary sweetish aroma, caramel and light spiciness (coriander, pepper), some alcohol. Body is medium, malty and sugary sweetish flavor, some caramel and light spiciness, alcohol. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish, some sharp peppery spiciness and lots of alcohol. Reminds me of those Baltic 10% booze lagers.

Poured from 330 ml bottle after aging 18 months. 

Clear, golden amber with huge billows of off-white head that leaves excellent lacing. 

Aroma of lemon, banana, yeast, caramel, orange and cloves. 

Taste of lemon, banana, yeast, caramel, pepper and cloves with a slightly sour finish.  Quite complex. 

Medium body and light/medium carbonation. 

This beer was aged too long.  The alcohol has mellowed beyond its prime and the beer has taken on a slightly sour finish that was not there when young. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Light amber body and tan head. Light aroma of honey with hints of coriander, spicy with citrus. Alcoholic, light sour and yeasty. Very drinkable and pleasant beer. A Good beer

I am not a huge Belgian beer fan, but this one is really nice. Maybe if I drink more of this quality, I will become a Belgian beer fan. Enjoyed it Friday evening at the shop, while munching on spicy peanuts. What an awesome combo!
Golden brown colour medoum head, sweet honey smell, sweet taste sharp bittet medium carbonation, a little wine like sour aftertaste
330ml bottle. Clear orange color. Medium size creamy head appears. Sour, yeasty, fruity, alcohol, malty aroma. Hops, alcohol, mild bitter, malty flavor. Hoppy aftertaste.
Heavy alcohol, sweet beer. The alcohol overwhelms the fruit but the drink is enjoying and interesting. Very unique.

750 ml bottle. Pours a clear yellowish amber with a thick white head. Smells like lemon and mint. Tastes very sweet, peppermint, spices, pepper, lemon, mint. Good lemon and pepper finish. Light bodied, creamy mouthfeel. Excellent tripel.

Hazy Orange with a 1 finger head.  Flavors are Bubblegum, Hefe-Cloves, Caramel, Malts, Yeasts, and Cracked Peppers. Works out well, except for a small but noticeable alcoholic taste. Thick bodied with fairly strong carbonation which helps add some flavor to the mix. All things considered, its a bit overpriced but at least it tastes good and worth any Tripel fans attention

Servie en bouteille de 750ml. Dun blond presquambré, elle a une belle mousse blanche tenant bien et collant au verre. Arôme subtil et délicat de levure belge, de miel et de vanille. Très ronde en bouche, elle est liquoreuse et nattaque pas le palais. Légèrement sucrée et très peu amère. Quelques touches de levures et dalcool. Très agréable en bouche, elle glisse bien et ne laisse quun léger goût piquant sur le bout de la langue.
Earthy aroma from the Belgian yeast.  Strong hints of pepper in this bad boy.  Head retention is flawless but clarity could be improved upon.  Nice drink on a chill Sunday afternoon.

Maredsous 10 Tripel has a thick, pillowy, off-white head, with a slight orange tinge to it, an initially clear, golden-orange appearance (a big slab of yeast slime is below the cap after swishing the bottle), with streams of tiny bubbles and a tremendous amount of thick lacing left about, which I had to lick off of the sides of the glass. The aroma is of spicy, yeasty, citrusy, sweet malt and the taste is of citrusy, sweet, bready, rich, alcohilic barley malt, spicy yeast, and almost no hop bitterness. The mouthfeel is light to medium, and Maredsous 10 Tripel finishes smooth, mostly dry, and very easy drinking. Overall, this is excellent. RJT

Big, fruity aroma, with a lot of apple, some caramel, and spice.  Taste starts sweet, with caramel, toffee, and fruit.  A little bitterness a little bit of drying alcohol in the finish, and a nice creamy mouthfeel. Really good.

Not the best triple Ive ever tried but with a strange but pleasant flavor. Its flavor is like an aged beer wich has been kept in barrells for some months. This beer has a very beautiful cloudy copper color.

#1117
 Leicht trüber Apfelsaft trifft es wohl am ehesten von der Optik her. Im Aroma auch etwas fruchtig-hefig. Im Antrunk dann schnell dumpf-alkoholisch und stark bitter im Abgang. Sämtliche Geschmacksnuancen werden durch die Alkohol-Keule im Keim erstickt. Ich kann das Glas nicht austrinken, denn sonst müsste ich mich übergeben. Mieser Stoff!
	
Test vom 10.6.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 8,8,1,1,7,1 - 3,05

Deep hazy golden amber pour frothy thick off white head and a thick band of lacing .... aroma of fruity yeast, oranges mostly and spices .... taste is of spicy floral hops, fruity yeast (oranges), lightly citrusy, little sugary with a light bitter hop bite that lingers into the dry and spicy finish .... mouthfeel is smooth and creamy and the abv is hidden well with just a slight bit sneaking into the finish .... sessionable tripel

Red brown colour with a thick off-white head. Sweet floral and a slight yeast-y aroma. Taste is of medium sweetness, with an ever so slightly bitter finish. The alcohol can definitely be tasted (and felt!) A full-bodied Belgian Tripel, one that I would recommend. Just not on an empty stomach!

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2013 Dikke schuimkraag zorgt voor goede film. Mooie koperen kleur. Lichtzoet en lichtzuur van smaak, maakt snel plaats voor een hoppige en erg bittere nasmaak. Aroma van kruiden, gist, en citrus. Prima tripel.
Pours copper with a white head. Strong yeast and alcohol, some sweet malts. Some hoppy finish.
Deep copper with a foamy off white head. Very full, but sweet and floral with a good strength (though not as strong as the alcohol content would insinuate).
Pours clear golden with a high head. Aroma is sweet malts, yeast and alcohol. Flavor is sweet malts, yeast, alcohol and a slightly hoppy finish.

Bottle enjoyed at home
Copper hazy, big tanned head. Smells of grassy hops, belgian yeast, pepper, caramel and yeast. Medium sweet, spicy, fruity of yeast, some caramel. Heavy bitter, quite grassy, also some green herbs. Medium body, moderate carbonation, oily texture. Very nice triple, fantastic mouthfeel, thick liquid filled with carbonation bubles. Nice hops and malt body, its just a very nice tripel

Bottle c/o Jeff. Thanks man!

A: Autumn orange hues with steady effervescence emanating from the bottom of the chalice. Atop the beer rests a thin layer of white head that leaves a fair amount of lacing on the glass.

S: Subtle aromas of citrus, spices, alcohol.

T: Spicy flavor with notes of bitter citrus. Tropical fruits with an alcohol finish.

M: Good feel. Slightly sweet with a warming finish.

D: A very good tripel. Not among the elite, but very enjoyable nonetheless.

Coriander, Orange peels and yeast come through on the nose. Bright gold color with a large foam top. Moderately complex flavors bringing up mostly sweet orange, coriander, caramel and bread flavors topped off with a formidable carbonation. Overall, this is a decently done Belgian brew on the sweet side. Id give this a B+ rating.
Light brown color with creamy head. Smells sweet flowers. Taste follows the smell with some extra bitterness. Decent carbonation together with high alcohol blew everything from my head for a while.

Head: cream colored foam. Color: gold. Aroma: vague yeast, some grain. Taste: sour, bitter. Palate: lasting. Overall: very strong.
330 ml bottle . A really nice Belgian triple. Well balanced . I strongly recommend it.

A fantastic, copper colored beer. Complex, not hoppy, and bursting with fruity tones that compliment any equally sophisticated meal. I wouldnt consider it that balanced, but it has a fairly full palette, not too went and only hints at malt occasionally. Plenty of yeast and fruit on the tongue and finish. Slightly spicy and a hint of caramel.

0,33 l bottle at Cambrinus, Hvar. Sparkling deep golden with a large beige fluffy fingerthick head leaving excellent lacing. Boozy, caramel, malty, dried roses and spicy yeast nose. Full bodied. Alco warm. Syrupy. Sweet and spicy toasted maple syrup and caramel and a nicely balanced bitterness. Recommended.

Bottle poured into tulip.  A little more clear than most trips.  Usual giant fluffy white head, nice copper, slightly amber hue.  Nice nose with notes of banana, sweet spice, yeasty esters, and champagne.  Wonderful taste.  Fruity, spicy, yeasty all flanked by warming alcohol and a sticky, drying finish.  Another great Belgian tripel...
Yet another great Belgian beer.............................................. via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle @ Poggio Lucca. One finger foam. Banana basement notes. Very spicy full body. Quite dry bitter long finish. Allright.
Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is mainly caramel, nuts and hay, with some hints of banana. The aftertaste is very sweet and has notes of alcohol. A good beer, but Ive tried better abbeys.

Hazy amber colour with a voluminous white head made up primarily of coarse bubbles. Aromas (amongst those youd expect of a tripel) of definite alcohols and creme brulee. Its that vanilla custard element that I really wasnt expecting. Much, much more carbonation than what i was expecting along with sweet candi sugar, sweet seville oranges and sherbet. There is nothing in the flavour to suggest youre sipping on a ten percent monster. Devilishly enticing. The finish leans toward that citric acidity and sherbet but is of relative short endurance. A tasty drop and one worth recommending.

Pours a beautiful clear golden color with an off white head and luxurious lacing. The aroma is malt, dark dried fruit and yeast. The pallet is much like the aroma - sweet malt upfront with hints of rasin and a nice hop finish. This is not a sweet beer; it is a well balanced beer that is very drinkable. The mouthfeel is light to medium-light and crisp. Excellant!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours clear amber with a medium off-white head that laces well. Aroma is of yeast, raisins, malt, and caramel. Taste is medium sweet yeast, malt and a bit of spice. Light bitter finish. Alcohol is well masked. Body is full.

Bottle 750ml [Aged 2 years]
Pours clear amber with "ok" low beige head. Aroma is of sweetness, caramel, yeast, malt. Taste is of massive caramel, sweetness, alcohol, yeast, malt. Overall: full bodied, nice balance. No flaws from aging. Very good beer, nice mouthfeel.

Aroma: Hints of banana and spices--clove and cardamom?--with a rich malty undertone. 
Appearance:Clear, dark orange with a thick white head.
Taste: Light sourness balanced by a medium sweetness.
Palate: Full body, thick texture, average carbonation, long finish
Overall: This is good--very, very good, but Im not completely blown away. A bit too yeasty for my taste, but still really well developed and recommended for anyone who hasnt tried it yet.

2 years aged. Pours caramel brown with a creamy white head. Nice lacing. Aroma: belgian yeast, caramel, vanilla. Taste: strong yeasty intro, caramel, vanilla, alcohol. Maybe a little sweet. Some oxydation at the end. Full bodied beer.  Some warming alcohol. Texture is creamy-watery. Overall, it is a very good beer, but it is a little too sweet. Drinkability, therefore, is low.
I liked it! Creamy and enough character, aroma is just perfect. I would recommend it.!

Bottle at Cafe de la Gare.  Pours hazy amber with an off white head.  Aroma is fruity, yeasty.  Flavour of sharp fruit, yeast, alcohol and light malt. Moderate sweetness and light bitter.  Medium bodied with medium carbonation.
Bottle from el corte ingles, lisbon, portugal. Brown oragen color. Thin to medium carbonation. Medium sweetness. Alcohol, malt aroma.

Maredsous 10 abv ? 
Maredsous triple ?
Cette belle annonce nous fait découvrir une triple de couleur blond profond, à la 
limite de lambré, avec une mousse blanc cassé à beige qui nappe valablement
le liquide caché dessous.
Nous chercherons pourtant à latteindre et à savoir ce quil vaut !!!
Mon breuvage avait dailleurs largement dépassé lâge de la retraite (2 ans de plus),
ce qui constitue toujours un défi pour une blonde et donc pour une triple.
Mais quà cela ne tienne, il restait quelques fines bulles et des arômes qui sétaient
développés sur les fruits confits et le blé mûr.
Le volume est soyeux à souhait (une vraie tapisserie de velours).
Puis la 1ère bouche se révèle avec une très belle finesse et des accents de pelure 
dorange.
La 2ème a la densité des blés à la moisson.
La 3ème nous livre des prunes, des fruits dautomne et un léger piquant sur la langue.
La levure fait son travail sans rechigner.
La longueur est correcte.
La finale ressort en équilibre, et nous transmet toutes les nuances précédentes.
Donc on ne peut critiquer cette blonde (triple quand même, merci) sans lui concéder
dêtre de caractère, faite par un brasseur exceptionnel (Duvel), à léquilibre bien pensé
entre rondeur et piquant amer, sans aucun excès. Très belle arrière-bouche dès la seconde
moitié du verre.

Bottle. Pours with a smallish rocky foam, white with beautiful lacing atop a golden orange to amber body.  Very elegant and graceful with a steady bead of carbonation makes this a perfect substitute for a cheerful champagne.  The aroma is bright, with overripe banana, pineapple, citrus-orange, fluffy marshmallow, pear and an uncommon malt roastiness, sea-salty?  Taste is strong yet refreshing and sweet with pineapple, doughy malt character; warming alcohol tingles the tongue, yet lies gracefully amongst the citrussy, bright flavors.  Medium finish with a solid hop bitterness that mingles with a minty, drying aftertaste. Savory, umami.  Lively carbonation, full, thick flavor, fluffy and ambitious on the tongue.  Overall this is very good. But not as bright as some tripels.  The fruit flavors and smooth feel are nice, but it is lacking in the yeasty, estery feel of others of the style..

Smooth cherry wheat aroma. Cloudy amber with nice thick head.   Nice fruity malty taste. Figs cherrywood pear. Really nice 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Orange brown with dissipating white head. Fruity aroma, citrus, pear, dark. Pale malts, yeast, notes of alcohol. Body is largely smooth, some carb, flavor not very strong. Decent Belgian.

Bottle.  Pours an orange amber color with a foamy off white head.  The nose is sweet, fruit notes have pears and a hint of cherry, pale malt, yeast and some alcohol.  The flavor is more sweet malts, and fruity notes; the alcohol starts as just warming, but does play a role and dries the sweetness out a bit.  Worth trying but not my favorite.

330mL bottle into flute
Sweet and yeasty aroma with a touch of orange. Cloudy light copper colour, but it is a little dark in the bar. Classic strong tripel yeastiness with some fruit notes, a very smooth finish and lingering bitterness.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2013 On bottle.
Golden color, ok foam.
Full body and high complexity . Some malt in aromas and dried fruits, also some honey and citrus notes.
Nice yeast aromas. 
Balanced, some sweetness
Enjoyable

Copper brown colour with a white head. Aroma has yeast and some fruit. The taste is similar, it is dominated by the yeasty flavour but theres some apple in there. The aftertaste lasts for a while and it has some apple and hints about the the high ABV. Very drinkable triple in my opinion.

Tripel, con carácter pero no de la concentración alcohólica, sino de la mezcla de hierbas y lupulos. Aroma suave, color y textura propios, en los tonos ámbar. Olor a cobre en el vaso, pero gran cerveza en general.

Aroma is light and has hints of citrus. Golden in color. Malty flavor. Thin head and almost abrupt finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Una birra strana, non sa per niente di tripla. Intanto non è per nulla dolgia come ci si aspetterebbe da una tripla e poi è pure leggermente luppolata! Una birra strana ma molto beverina!
Reddish colour with off white head, quite carbonated.Nice malty fruity aroma. Not a crazy flavourful tripel, nor my favourite one, but it was decent.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2013 330ml bottle, poured into large tulip shaped wine glass. Pale amber colour, slight haze, small one finger medium head, reasonable head retention. Had an initial phenolic aroma with notes of yeast, later on I detected some sour fruits. Tasted of sour orange and berries, pronounced hop bitterness, booze only present at the end. Medium body, medium carbonation, fairly coarse feel to it. Overall decent, but I felt it would have been more complex if not for the boozy finish.
330 ml bottle a dark golden yellow colored beer with a white head aroma malts citrus spicy and some bitter hops flavor malts citrus spicy sweetness and bitter hops

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2013 Aroma is ananas,  snoepjes en metaal. Smaak is banaan, honing en iets kruidig, met een wat droge afdronk. Kraag blijft prima op stevige wervel van bubbels. #2 smaak en aroma wat minder uitgesproken, smaak wat alcoholisch, aroma minder snoepjes zoet. Licht verkouden, dus wellicht is dat de oorzaak, rating zelfde.
de geur  heeft frisse citrus tonen die met het grasachtige van de hop naar een zurig schuimende smaak met een aangename hopbitterheid leidt. Plezierig maar mist wat diepte.

33cl Brown stumpy bottle, best before March 2008, drank a little later.

Poured into a Westmalle Triple Chalice glass, it was bound to look great, and it did. Slightly cloudy, dull terracotta with a lumpy thin white head.

What happened to the aroma? I couldnt detect one really, some hops and yeast but nothing much at all.

it appears almost fizzy as you approach for the first sip, but an incredible mix of beery flavours hit your tastebuds, a true triple. Yeast, hops and malts combine to produce a wonderfully balanced beer. A deep alcoholic feel adds to the enjoyment.

Lovely. lovely, lovely.

The last and the strongest Maredsous has a cloudy orange body with a big white head, the best retention in the series.
Aroma: yeast, some sourness, alcohol, old cheese, old hops, herbs. Taste: yeast, spices, grain, on the sweet side, late alcohol heat. Plenty of carbonation. All Maredsous beer has an interesting easiness of drinking, even at 10% ABV.
Good
Light amber color and decent head.  Plenty of carbonation and warm mouth feel.  Sweet honey flavor on the nose, with a dark flavor on the finish and strong full aftertaste.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy amber with small off white head leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is yeast and fruity malt. Medium mouthfeel with a dry fruit and alcohol burn. A decent tripel.

Poured into a St Bernardus glass, big bubbly white head that left nice lacing. Not much in the aroma, a little cherry and alcohol. Flavor was cherry, malt, alcohol, slight yeast and bread. Less hoppy than other tripels weve had.   A decent beer.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2015 Limpido color arancio/ramato con schiuma bianca e grossolana. Aroma di arancia e luppoli delicati con sentori di alcool e spezie. Gusto rotondo e più amaro di altre tripel belghe, alcuni tocchi luppolati ed erbacei aiutano a rendere il sapore pungente. Di facile beva nonostante labv, morbida al palato e con un finale deciso e asciutto.

Nice pour with medium sized head. Golden color with somewhat flat aroma. Smooth taste, somewhat hoppy but not as much as other Belgian tripels. Mild aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy copper with a substantial lasting white head. Tons of fine lacing.  Aroma is faint yeast and citrus. Taste is yeast, dates, bread, and some caramel.  Somewhat acidic and very active on the palate.  Very good.
UPDATED: JAN 1, 2014 Bottle. Clear gold pour with a white head. Nose and taste of light fruit and citrus. Some caramel character. Good beer.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2013 Bottle 750 ml [bottled in 2010]. Appearance: Clear golden amber with a thin white head. Some lacing. Aroma: Candy, malt, floral, hints of fruit and bubblegum. Complex. Taste: Sweet, slight acidity, floral/herbal. Slight sourness in the aftertaste.  Warming alcohol. Overall: Good tripel, didnt remember it was that good (maybe the two years of age?). 

Tasted a 2008 bottle and it was as good if not better than the 2010.
This is a smooth Belgium ale without the sweetness of such greats as the St. Bernarus. Great palate and nose. Floral initially with hints of fruit. Great beer!
UPDATED: OCT 10, 2012 330ml bottle from Bierzwerg. Orange amberish colour with medium head that lasts. Aroma is dark fruits, citrus. Flavour is semi sweet, hoppy fininsh, some alcohol, spices.

Aroma of floral hops, light caramel hops, and a bit of banana. Light amber hazy appearance with thick lacing. Flavor is awesome. Bracing yeasty bite with a light caramel presence. Really tasty. Finish a little too sweet.

Maredsous pours as a reddish-brown color with substantial head. The aroma has a strong banana essence, along with wheat. The aroma, in a way, resembles a wine as well. Upon sipping, I can also taste some caramel malt. The taste is slightly sweet. The palate is full, with a flavorful finish.This is a great, complex beer. Recommended, in particular for intermediate/advanced tripel drinkers.
High light head and aroma of citrus and light banana. Flavor to match with light hoppyness for balance. Heavy carbonation. Finishes dry and sweet.
Hazy amber, huge lasting off-white head. Taste is some caramel, fruitiness, banana. Good balance off sweetness and bitterness.

Poured from the tap to a clear copper with a fluffy two finger head. The foam left a little lacing. Aroma was of sweet carmel malts and pine.  Taste was herbal with hint of pine with strong alcohol bite. Smooth bitter finish long dry full body. Very enjoyable.

Unclear dark orange with creamy fruity head. Aroma is sweet and fruity. Flavor is intense, sweet and fruity with lot of apricot and orange. Finishes with finely balanced bitterness. Almost unbelievable that this beer contains 10% alcohol.
