33cl bottle. Dark golen colour with a good formation of a creamy and an off white head. Aroma is sweet, dense, with plumbcake notes and fruity. Flavour is also fruity, moderate sweet, with a slightly bitterness that gives to the beer an excellent balance. Dense on palate, the final has bready notes with a moderate duration. Carbonation is medium. Body is medium to high. Texture is oily.
Oranje/ amber kleur. Ruikt wat zurig, niet aangenaam.. Medium body. Smaakt  moutig en citroenig.  Ik zal m niet meer kopen.

Bottle. Clear orange colour with a white head that dissipates quite quickly. Aroma of dried fruits, bread and alcohol. Flavour is heavy alcoholic with a carbonated mouthfeel. Letting it warm up gives more fruity flavours of blackberries, apricot and such. Really big alcoholic beer in my opinion, bit out of balance, but still quite good.

Bottle into signature glass. Presents deep amber with a finely bubbled just off white head that laces nicely. Aroma is yeasty (earthy, leafy) and malty (toasty subdued honey) with fruity hops (oranges mainly), Belgian candy sugar and alcohol. The palate is smooth and creamy with a fullish body and a perfect balance of bittersweet malt and fruit. Finishes long and dry with an alcoholic warmth. Delicious mouthfeel. One of the best Belgian Abbey Tripels.
Darker gold yellow color, amber even. Good foan head alsoe slightly colored, Sweet malt aroma, but later on nice bitter hop taste. Dry in the mouth and long lasting after taste, bitter. Good

Tap @ Berthom. Pours beautiful clear golden copper amber with a bubbly beige head leaving lace over the whole chalise. Aroma is very nice; malty sweet, fruity, spicy and a bit yeasty. Flavor is malty sweet and slightly acidy in front, fruity spicyness builds up in the middle finishing with a dryish longlived bitterness with still plenty of fruits.
On tap at the Trappe door, poured a dark amber, overall a nice beer that was on tap, had some spiciness to it, some herbs and flowers in the flavor, honey finish.
Slightly orange, medium white head that is quite thick.  Sweet malt with loads of spice (anise, coriander, red licorice?).  Very balanced for the strength, but assertive finish.
Draught in Jaffa. Pours clear dark amber with a steady white head. Smells thick, grainy and sweet, tastes sweet and alcoholic. Its fizzy with a long finish and a surprisingly light body.

33cl bottle. Color is dark orange with white head. Aroma is sweet, fruity. Taste has fruits, sugar, yeast and spices in it. Pretty complex beer, that has this warm feel in the end, but alcohol is well hidden in the taste.  Medium carbonation. Really nice tripel.

Cerveza de Abadía, realizada por la misma cerveceria que elabora la famosa "Duvel".
Carente de un aroma que refleje lo que ésta cerveza contiene en cuanto a calidad y grado alcohólico. Aromas ligeros a cereales.
Apariencia color dorado, rubi, con espuma blanca brillosa, aun que se diluye rápidamente.
Al primer sorbo es fresca y afrutada, sin embargo al resbalar el liquido por la garganta, se siente el alcohól (10 grados) el cual lentamente calienta la garganta, dejando un delicioso sabor. Sin embargo el sabor no es desagradable, dejando un muy buen sabor de boca.

pours a clear light orange brew with a two finger white head with regular retention, aroma is spicy and citrusy, also some candy sugar, medium to robust body; the flavor has notes of clove, alcohol, sugar and citrus fruit, good balance, bitersweet long finish.

Not much aroma to speak of. Tastes sweet and caramely with a touch of bitterness on the aftertaste. Very enjoyable, although one per sitting is probably enough. One of the nicer trippels that I have tried.

Bottle @ Cardinal, Stavanger. Golden in color with a nice white head. Aromas of sweet malts, yeast and fruits. Flavors of yeast, dried fruits, grains.
High in carbonation, gives a nice mouthfeel. with its 10% abv, its well masked. A little alco wamth. Will have this tripel again!

Bottle at Mogwai. Helsingborg, December 2011. 

Pours pale and hazy yellow with a creamy head. Aromas of Belgian esters, apple and pears. Quite sourish with some yeast notes as well. Rich taste with some fruit notes and Belgian yeast. Slightly flowery. Overall enjoyable!

Clear, amber-copper color. Peachy, bready aroma. Sweet taste, some bitternessn on the finish, but not overwhelming. Decent amount of head and well-carbonated. Nice Brussels lace up the side of the glass. A creamy mouth feel. Overall, I quite enjoyed it.

Pours  orangeish-gold with a huge, frothy off-white head. Aroma is primarily fruity: apple, pear, banana. Also hints of mild yeast and a little spiciness. Taste is initially sweet but gives way to a surprising (but enjoyable) bitterness. Finish is similar, with the alcohol taste coming through at the end. Mouthfeel is medium with more carbonation than Im used to in a tripel. Lots of lacing on the glass. Overall good, but not my fave triple.
11.2 oz bottle pours amber with a off white head.  Aroma is banana, citrus and malt.  Taste is malt with a sweet fruit finish.

11.2 ounce stubby bottle into chalice, best by 05/2014.  Pours hazy golden orange color with a nice 1-2 finger dense off white head with great retention that reduces to a thin cap that lasts.  Some nice lacing clinging on the glass, with plenty of carbonation streaming up.  Aromas of apricot, lemon, pear, biscuit, tart grains, pepper, clove, candi sugar, and yeast spices.  Decent aromas but they are pretty faint for a tripel.  Taste of apricot, lemon, banana, orange, clove, bread, candi sugar, pear, grape, tart grain, and yeast spices.  Lingering notes of citrus, clove, pear, biscuit, candi sugar, and yeast spices on the finish for a while.  Nice balance of flavors with decent complexity.  Definitely more of a fruity tripel, but is not cloying.  Medium carbonation and fairly full bodied; with a very creamy and slick mouthfeel that drinks quite smoothly.  Alcohol is well hidden for 10% with a slight warming after the finish.  Overall this is a very nice and enjoyable Tripel.  Good complexity and balance; with nice smoothness.
citrus, woody, amber, hazy, frothy, very bitter, medium sweetness, lightly sour, medium body, sticky, thin feel, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish,
Very nice hazy reddish colour with a generous head. Spices galore. There are better beer out there, but this one is still worth the buy.

Im not that impressied by this beer. There is some nice spiciness to the beer, but the overwhelming bitterness is just a little too much. The alcohol is nice and warming but I am not over the moon about this beer. Bottle bought at the local C1000 in Wilnis.

Hazy deep redish amber pour with a good 1.4 inch head.  Lots of flowers and spice in the nose.  Spicy warm and boozy mouth.  Something is a bit off in the balance.  I expected amazing things from this.  Now its still a great beer, but its just not quite right.  Very clean finish though with very little after-taste.  Belgian Tripples are pretty much my favourite type of beer.  This may be one of the worst of the style Ive had but I would still put this above ever IPA Ive ever tried.

11.2oz bottle - pours honey orange with off-white head and modest lacing.  Nose is yeast (basement aromas and champagne).  Flavor is candy, caramel, herbal hops and toffee.  Taste is mainly sweet but ends on light bitter taste.  Finishes dry and burns a little (10% ABV!!). Medium body and sticky texture.  Not a bog fan of the aftertaste: too yeasty. burpy.  Better than the Maredsous 8 in my opinion.

33 ml bottle. Pours a white creamy head which sticks to the glass. High carbonation. Taste of banana, plum and yeast. Did not match me well this evening, I know its better though.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

La birra si presenta con un bel colore ramato, saturo e gradevole. La schiuma si condensa in uno strato sottile e persistente.
La prima annusata sboccia in accordi di fiori e frutta matura. A un secondo respiro emerge il lievito. Bisogna dire che laroma non è particolarmente intenso.
Limpatto in bocca è importante, sia per linaspettata potenza del perlage, sia per il sapore deciso e ruvido. Comincia con un amaro repentino che apre la strada ancora al lievito e che infine sboccia in un ventaglio di accenti fruttati  e freschi.
Al ritorno in bocca rimane molto asciutta ma con una decisa ombra di frutta che lascia un piacevolissimo ricordo.
Una consiglio: da provare in assoluto silenzio. Sigillando velocemente la bocca appena dopo la sorsata é possibile sentire fin dentro alle orecchie un sonoro applauso: il rumore del perlage che esplode come solo i migliori champagne sanno fare!

Amber orange color with an off white head. Malty nose with some citrus and banana. Apples and pears on the palate with a heavy malt flavor. Effervescence adds complexity to the mouthfeel while keeping this refreshing.
33 cl. bottle @ home. Yellow to orange colour with a big white head. Fruity yeasty aroma. Spicy taste with some alcohol burn. Solid tripel

Look was clear copper with 2 finger head with little lacing and lasting foam. Aroma clean sweet carmely malts with no hints of yeast, you can smell the alcohol. Taste was herbal with hint of pine with strong alcohol bite. Smooth fizzy strong bitter finish long dry full body.Strong beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
leather, chocolate, rotten eggs, orange, cloudy, frothy, rocky head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, heavily sour, umami, full body, creamy, lively, bitter, long finish,
A delicious belgium beer, good flavour, not too bitter. Tasted @ maredsous abbaye
Aroma strong spice, yeast, and alcohol.An amber-colored beer with some cloudiness and a nice white.  Pleasant but not top notch. Bitter and strong.

Look was clear copper with 2finger head with little lacing and lasting foam. Aroma clean sweet carmely malts with no hints of yeast, you can smell the alcohol. Taste was herbal with hint of pine with strong alcohol bite. Smooth fizzy  strong bitter finish long dry full body.Strong beer...

flowery and slightly perfumed aroma. Fruity, spicy and yeasty. Lively mouthfeel. Not as much flavour comes through. Slight hops, some caramel, spicy and some bread. Ok but there are a lot of other triples out there that are way better.
Bottle.  Clear orange pour, frothy white head and a sweet fruity pear aroma.  Flavor is also light sweet herbal pears, slightly warming white sugar and nice and malty on the aftertaste.

AROMA: spices, alcohol, floral, yeast
APPEARANCE: amber, clear
TASTE: light sweetness, medium bitterness
PALATE: full body, slick feel, lively, bittersweet aftertaste
OVERALL: strong beer, interesting notes, but too strong and too much carbonation. Prefer the 8.

An amber-colored beer with some cloudiness and a bone-colored, almost white, head, which grows quite a bit and stays surprisingly long for a 10% beer. The aroma is mainly of spices, orange peel, yeast, and a bit of alcohol. Nothing too outstanding in my opinion but pleasant nonetheless. The taste follows these notes, being a bit bitter and a bit sour as well. The immediate aftertaste is dry, but after a while your palate gets coated with a sweet, fresh, fruity sensation that I find extremely pleasant. Its a heavy, exhausting beer, though.
Rich head, maintains well.  Sweet malt is not overdone, with really nice herbals from the hops.  Thick mouthfeel, alcohol is not prominent.  Very good beer.
yellow fizzy colour...frothy head with nice lacing....prominent alcohol taste and oily texture, taste of spice and belgium candy...lasting sweet slightly bitter aftertaste

Bottled, 330ml aged 7.5yrs. Gold with white head. Quite a spiced aroma on opening, the pour was nice and steady but still with conditioning. Bright spicy flavour which had amalgamated into a herby, flowery note. Big alcohol notes, still burning on the palate and cheek warming. Floral, honeyed finish. Not bad and a good one for ageing.

From backlog 
Head: white, small 
Colour: deep amber 
Smell: skunky malts, yeasty , some hops , overall sweet 
Taste: sweet malty start , some barrel aged like sourness ( a bit ) , dry yeasty end
not sure who brought this, but thanks. overall was decent. had a lot of mediocre belgian ales this night, and this was just another one.
Een lekker diepblond bier. Met een hartverwarmende afdronk en fijne aromas. Kan de wedijveren met de Trappistenbieren.

Tried at Brussels sprouts bar singapore 20 dec .  Served at correct temp in proper glass. Cloudy appearance ( pourer?). Thin head. Can taste the alcohol 10%  big time. Moderate carbonation. Odd slightly sour and bitter taste.  Touch of dry sherry about smell and taste. 6/10 at best. Wouldnt buy it again  - maybe I had a bad bottle  - my impression does not match most go  the reviews on Rate Beer
Une bonne bière tripple, brune mais pas trop présente en bouche. Lalcool est un peu présent.

Pours a cloudy orange-brown, very frothy, fine, white head that lingers despite the high alcohol content. Aroma: Strongly of banana, slight notes of bubblegum. Hints of cereal, dough, citrus. Palate: Smooth, bubbly, slightly dryer finish. Taste: Very sweet. Alcohol is noticeable but that doesnt detract from it at all.  Complex flavour. Goes back and forth between a nice bubbly ale, and a sweet, citrus-y banana beer. Love it.

Oranssinen ja kirkas olut valkoisella vaahdolla koristeltuna. Tuoksussa on karamellista makeutta, pippurista mausteisuutta ja hedelmäisyyttä. Maussa on lisää karamellista makeutta, rusinaa, hitunen pippuria, hedelmäisyyttä ja nyt humalointikin tuntuu. Aavistuksen verran liian makea omaan makuuni, mutta silti maistuva olut.

Poured a dark honey color.  Velvety full head.  Yum this Belgium yeast smells good.   Also candy sugars and raisin.   Med light sweetness with a light bitterness at end.  Drier finish.  Med bodied.  Complex Belgium yeast flavors in taste.  Alcohol is well hidden.  Man I like this stuff.

Pours a light orange color with a big fluffy white head that leaves good lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is wet malt and dried fruit with some mild tobacco and a good dose of honey.

The flavor is spicy with some toasty maltiness, fairly fruity with a bit of copper flavor and some light earthy hoppiness. 
A really different take on Tripel.

pours cloudy amber/apricot with a frothy white head. aroma is sweet and yeasty, with honey like qualities. taste is quite sweet, citrus, fruity and carbonated. there is good bitterness, and lots of alcohol. pretty good tripel, but overly carbonated in my opinion.
clear copper poor. very alcoholic, long aftertaste. bit sweet. some citrus. tastes very belgian to me.  too bad its high alcohol bashes through everything...

33 cL bottle from ABS Drinks in Winksele into a Karmeliet Tripel glass.  Copper/red beer with good head.  Fruity, acidic hoppy head.  Rich, dark fruit taste, nice with a bitter sweetness.  A drier version of Adnams Broadside.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2016 Bouteille de 33cl. Couleur dorée, un peu ambrée, très léger trouble, mousse abondante de belle tenue. Arômes de fruits, de grains, de miel, très bel équilibre. Les 10% sont vraiment bien cachés. Trouvée à Vanuxeem - Ploegstaert

Clear golden body with a thin white head. Aroma of roses, orange peel, and a bit peppery. Taste is lemon peel mostly with some sweet malts. Not much on balance. Good lacing. Enjoyable but not mind blowing.

Clear, amber-copper color.  Peachy, bready aroma.  Sweet taste, some bitternessn on the finish, but not overwhelming.  Decent amount of head and well-carbonated. Nice Brussels lace up the side of the glass. A creamy mouth feel.  Overall, I quite enjoyed it.

Ar: Peach, a touch of orange - very slight amount of pepper.
Ap: Orange and clear - medium off-white head with medium retention - nice lacing.
T: Citrusy, mostly orange up front - a hit of alcohol, though clean - peach and white grapes - some spicy and floral alcohol and hop notes - medium, though firm, bitterness - as it warms, some nice subtle stone fruit flavors emerge - quite clean, overall.
T: Medium-light body with high carbonation gives a fuller, though not thicker, mouthfeel - very dry and prickly on the finish.
O: Solid, tasty, and complex tripel - nice orange flavor and carbonation, especially - stone fruit character is wonderful, too - alcohol heat is a bit prominent initially, but seems to subside as it warms.

Hazy coppery orange, big white head.  Nose has toffe, fruity notes and some spice. Taste is caramel with spice, malt, alcohol and a pleasantly hoppy finish to balance the sweetness. Medium to thick mouthfeel. Good stuff.

A slightly orange yellow beer with a medium and white head. Aroma is slightly aromatic, fruitfull, bananas and candy like sweetness, interesting alcohol strongesss that isnt smell alcohol. Taste is strongly fruitfull, spicyness, even some peppers, quite sweet to tripel. Medium bodied, nice carbonation and slightly sticky. Fruitfull, quite simple, strong tripel, I would hope more complexicity, now alcohol is too dominant, even it isnt taste.
UPDATED: MAR 7, 2012 Bottle. Amber colour with a white head. Citric and fruity nose. Medium sweet and a fresh hoppy flavour.

From 750ml bottle.  Pours a deep golden hue with a prominent, dimpled bright white head; recedes to yield some solid lacing around the glass.  Aroma is slightly sweet and almost grassy, amid a boozy backdrop.  Theres a lot going on flavor-wise, herbal, spicy, citrus notes interplay; getting some raisin character towards the finish.  Booziness wins out and compliments a subtle alcoholic heat after each sip.  Nice body, lifted up by the soft carbonation. This is a difficult beer to pin down, all the while not presenting itself as too intense to be sessionable.  Alcohol content is well masked, dangerously drinkable.  A fine example of the style indeed.
Slightly sweet, pleasant aroma. Smooth, complex flavors.  High alcohol content is not apparent. Quite delicious.
a different taste from a lot of triples.  faint hint of marmalade, citrus peel and some kind of dried fruit with the high alcohol.

buena cerveza,color medio ambar,olor a malta un poco frutado,al paladar muy intensa,se siente mucho el alchool,no disimula los 10 grados es bastante refrescante y se sienten tonos frutales. No esta en la lista de mis cervezas favoritas,no me gusta la fuerte sensacion de alchool en el paladar pero es buena.
user_location: SANTIAGO DE LOS CABALLEROS, DOMINICAN REPUBLIC

text:
Fles 33cl
Kleur: Mooi goudkleurig met een brede creme schuimkraag. Helder.
Geur: Fruitig en bloemig.
Smaak: Fris, zoetig, bitter. Van alles.
Warme nasmaak (alcoholisch) die enige tijd blijft hangen.

Let me start off saying I Love this beer..Nice Dark golden Hazy amber color, with a Good amount of lacing..Has the Smell of Raisins and bread with a nice smell of alcohol. The Taste is Bold and Sweet, With a dry taste. Has a nice after taste.

1 pt Corked Bottle- Served in Glass

(bottled) Triples are often unrefined , boozy, raw  and inyaface with their spicy personalties but theyre almost always interesting :  A yeasty , bready , fruity nose ... it resembles Westmalle Ttriple in apperance, slightly in texture i guess .. spicy , boozed fruit , sweet malt and lots of dryness. A  spicy/sweet punch on the tounge.

UPDATED: NOV 8, 2013 33cl bottle. Pours an orange copper with a bubbly, white head.
NOSE : Pear, licorice and alcohol. Banana and some cherry. Yeast esters reveals strong fruity aromas.
SIP : Creamy texture with decent carbonaton. Medium body. Sweet with cooked cherry tart flavors. Gets a bit sour. Clove hits the surface making it more and more dry. Some delicate acid citrus notes like orange peel in the background. Fermentation flavors are strong in this beer and the finish is comparable to an old, spoiled cherry on a vanilla cake.
OVERALL : the beer is well balanced but funky. The alcohol is hidden well but it hits you more and more after couple of sips. Still ...few beers can do it better then this one. Its quite unique in its style.

Bottle. Cloudy deep gold. Abundant soft carbonation. Nice big head. Aroma of yeast, apples, spice and alcohol. Nice smooth taste, alcohol is perceptible but not cloying. Spicy and fruity. Good tripel.
Deep golden with a big fluffy white head. First sip confirms the high alcohol content. To much taste of alcohol, not well integrated in my opinion. Otherwise a decent tripple...

Amber pour with large fluffy white head. Aroma is malty with bread and yeast as well. Taste is slightly malty . doughy, a little sweet with a touch of green grape. Alcohol is very present, driving down the score, not hidden at all. overall not a bad trippel.

UPDATED: OCT 22, 2011 A full fresh malt aroma and flavor with caramel just thinly and smoothly gritty for some body. my brew sat for several minutes due to my work and to my surprise a wonderful fresh sweet green apple in the caramel and malt. soon a bit of ripe sweet green grape still clinging to its full nutty grape seed finishing with a fleeting sweet lemon soda taste right at the end. remarkable and elegant. a nearly perfect representation of the style.
A solid tripel.  Pours dark amber, but all of the malti-bready tastes in the world wont disguise the high alcohol in this one.

11.2fl.oz. btl. Pours a darker shade of amber with a long lasting frothy head. Aroma is malty and strong. palate is very lively and full. Taste is more carbonation than flavor; but still flavorful to say the least. alcohol content is high, but hidden behind the finish. Solid for Triple Abby

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2012 pours amber gold, beautiful and bountiful CO2 (champagne-like streams), ultra foamy head, foamy lacing. Nothing much on the nose. First sip the palate is hit with a torrent of aggressive alcohol, dissipating into very sweet (9/10) mix of pomegranate, tamarind, sour bitter orange, ending in a partially dry woody finish. Medium complexity, high depth, good transitions, great carry, okay drinkability. The alcohol is somewhat overpowering.

Pours slightly murky yellow with a bit of a brown tinge.   Fairly large head for a triple with tiny foamy bubbles.  Mouth feel is a bit thin, but there is a nice amount of carbonation.  Flavor is delicious with all of the typical triple flavors blended perfectly.  I really really liked this one.

This brew poured up a dark orange colored body topped with a frothy white head with good retention and moderate lacing effects. Aromas of oranges, pineapples, peaches, roasted nuts. Flavors are subtly sweet along with a nice bitter balance and a flavor of fresh baked bread. You can definitely tell there is alcohol in this hearty brew! Medium-bodied, well carbonated, with a dry sweet finish just begging to be paired up with a hearty grilled rib-eye!!
Bärnstensfärgad öl med vitt skum. Örtig doft med inslag av hö och jäst. Moderat beska och en värmande alkoholsötma.

Hazy orange/deep golden brew with a frothy, easy structured white head that leaves a thin film behind.
Sweet, fruity smell and aroma with cereals and herbs underpainted by alcoholy and sugarly sweetness.
It finishes dry, warming and sweet-spicy escorted by herbals and alcohol.
Overall a nice tripel, but for me not so impressive as before expected.
Clear orange with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity, yeasty and spicy. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish with warming alcohol. 110911

Bottle.  Pours hazy orange with a medium, fizzy white head, medium retention with light lacing.  Aroma is biscuit and cookie malt, Belgian yeast notes, Candi sugar, fruity esters, cellar notes, and spicy alcohol.  Flavor is fruity esters, Belgian yeast, biscuit malt, Candi sugar, and a dry finish.  Full body, medium warmth and carbonation.
Bottle at Cafe Buitenlust, Oirschot. Pretty standard yellow / golden tripel color, white head. Ok smell, nice taste of malts, fruits and some bitterness. Average carbo and medium body. Decent tripel.
Tasted at Seaport Beer festival. Phenomenal.big brew. very dark for a tripel. sweet caramel note, very malted. creamy palate, high octane brew. wicked good.

33cl, brown bottle. Thin white head with cloudy russet to amber colour from top to bottom. Lovely smell of fruits, faint whiff of sherry. Great taste of berries and what I can only describe as "Christmas" and all the festive hints of pine and warmth that entails. Brief alcoholic aftertaste. An ideal beer to cheer you up on a cold evening.
Cloudy pinkish-amber, large head. Red berries, spice, malt aroma. Taste is a little sharp/tart. Decent, but not great.

22 oz. bottle pours orange/brown color with a thin head, but what an aroma!  My first whiff made me expect that this would be delightful, malty, and fruiter/candier than the actual taste.  Finish is quite dry and the 10% ABV is noticeable.  Not bad at all, but Ive tried better Abbey Tripels before.
Pours orange/golden, smells a bit bready, has a bit of sour finish. 1/16 of head. Not great not bad. I have had much better triples but not bad.

Pours a clear coppery brown with a fluffy off-white head. Rich, nose-filling aroma is malty and spicy with hints of caramel and horehound. Lip-smacking malty flavor has caramel, spicy and honey tones. Lively, fizzy, firm-bodied texture leaves a fairly strong and persistent tingle. Look for this one!

33cl. bottle from a local beer retailer. It pours a hazy deep amber liquid with a high quite creamy and consistent white head that lasts throughout the beer and leaves some good lacing. The aroma is quite nice, with fruity touches (orange, ripe peach), dried fruits, spices and a malty base with hints of caramel and toffee. Fresh, with a little yeasty character. It tastes likewise, very intense, the 10ABV of alcohol doing its work without being too noticeable. It also has some notes of wood. It is high in sweetness, with a slight touch of sourness and low-medium bitterness. In the mouth it feels mild but quite lively carbonated, with a medium-full body and a long dry finish, with an aftertaste of spices, herbs, dried fruits and wood. It pricles the mouth slightly. Presentation is nice and very abbey-like for a nice strong and warming malty tripel.
Pour orange beige head. Aroma floral, spice, noble hops, spicy yeast. Taste spicy, floral, sweet, grains, quite abrasive. MF medium body fizzy carb. Not a pleasing taste.
Wonderful golden color with a nice white head. Fruity-sweet taste, apricot perhaps , this makes it different from Triples that I have had.

Pours a nice dark golden colour with a creamy white head. Aroma is sweet malt and fruity. Taste is also sweet malt with some orange and spices which leads to a decent dry bitter finish. Soft mouth feel. Quite a nice Tripel.
A delicately balanced dark belgian style ale under the Benedictine tradition. Great solid malty flavor with controlled hops and orange overtone

Bottle from Csakajósör. Poured with a copper color and a lacing tan head. Vinous aroma of apples, cinnamon, grapes, reminds me of a sour ale. Dense, oily, with plenty of carbonation. Sweet taste and finish, which hides the high alcohol content well. Nice warming effect. All is well with this one.

Tripel mit goldener Farbe. Im Geruch malzig mit hintergründiger Fruchtnote. Geschmacklich malzig mit nussigen Momenten, Schokoladenanklänge. 
Bitterer Abgang. 
Alkoholisch dominiertes Tripel. Antrunk und Mittelteil sind noch ok. Der Abgang paßt aber nicht ins Gesamtbild. Dutzendware.Test vom 25.2.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche

330ml bottle.  Pours gold with a large, frothy head.  Aroma is bready, yeast and spicy grass.  Taste is yeasty and spicy to start.  Peppery finish.  Bready aftertaste.  Warming alcohol.  Coats the mouth.

330ml bottle. Cloudy orange pour with off white head. Spicy trpoical fruit on the nose with a fair bready note. The tropical fruit really plays heavily on the palate with some yeasty notes and a good spicy finish. Fantastic.

The beer pours a hazy brownish-gold color with a nice-sized white head. The aroma is full of orange and lemon notes with some Belgian candy sugar and Belgian yeast notes. I also get some coriander notes the aroma. The flavor is just as great. I get a lot of toffee and dark fruit notes, as well as some lemon and orange citrus. The pepper and coriander are also present in the flavor, as is a decent amount of alcohol. The beer is very drinkable. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation. One of the worlds great tripels. A must try for any beer lover.

750mL corked bottle poured hazy golden with big long lasting white head.  Aromas of yeast and fruit.  Slightly sweet and yeasty flavours dominate, very little bitterness.  Great carbonation and tingly on the tongue with a little alcohol.
[On tap] Clear golden hue, decent head formation. Sweet fruity malt and minty aroma. Well spiced yeasty flavor, orange, mint and pepper. A decent refreshing big beer.
Clear amber with big off white head.  Lots of fruit/yeast esters in the aroma.  The flavor is malty with spice and a hint of alcohol.

330 ml bottle. BBE 01/2013.
Pours a hazy, dark orange colour with a small, thick, lacy head. Aroma of caramel malts, nuts and some sweet fruits. Flavour of sweet fruits, caramel malts, some nuts and very mild hops. Very smooth mouthfeel, soft carbonation and a lovely fruity, slightly bitter, warming finish. Well crafted and smooth.

Nose is full of sugar, sweet malt, orange zest, and some yeast. The flavor is similar, but more brown sugar, some spice notes (nutmeg?) and some peach and pear round the finish out on this beer. Real nice.
Very nice Triple. Its appearance is very caramel and a little bit nuts. Overall this bottle is a heavy sweet and very enjoyable. Its colour is nice brown with a fast dissolving foam.
Bottle from Paris, France. Originally rated on 12.7.2009. Okay tripel that is quite well balanced, but the aroma is quite yeasty and earthy.

330 mL bottle.  Pours a lightly clouded amber with a white head.  Red apple aroma with some yeasty clove and caramel, hint of butterscotch.  Clove and bubble gum yeasty flavors blend with red apple, biscuit, and a bitter bite.  Moves into more caramel/toffee and berry flavors.  Pretty good.

Bottle aged 9 months in a cool dark cellar.  Pours a ruby/amber with a head about as thick as my thumb.  Aroma of plumb, raisen, cherry, yeast.  Fruity taste - Dark fruits, raisin, alcohol, clove, bit of pear, belgian yeast.  A few months in the cellar took care of some of the alcohol burn and balanced it out - my complaint about the 10 was the alcohol burn and its certainly not as prevalent here..  Interested to see how it will taste with another few months of cellaring.

Bottle. Clear golden colour with huge creamy white mostly lasting head. Heavy malty and fruity aroma. Yeast and lots of other stuff.
Sweet spicy flavor. Yeast.
Bottle. Clear amber/deep golden with medium off-white head. Flavour is malt, fruit, yeast, hops, caramel, little bitter, little sweet and notes of alcohol.

Burnt orange pour with huge off white, slowly dissipating, head and lively carbonation. Orage peel and spices in the aroma. Some raisins and cristmas cake fruits. Surprisingly dry, medium bitter with medium body. Warm alcohol and lots of fruit flavones in the finish.
Deap hazy brown. The 10% is packed in well. Excellent triple gives lace on the glass.

Pours a hazy, robust burnt orange with a white head that collars and leaves nice lacing. Spice and fresh wet grass on the nose. Orange at the back of the aroma. Spicy and malty with crisp finish and bitter bite at end. Very chewy. Spice fills the mouth.

33cl bottle from 2009.
Creamy white head.  Hazy blond colour.  Nice aftertaste.  Very good triple

Bottle at World of Beer.  Pours a clear copper amber color with a thick white head.  Good lacing along the glass.  Sweet yeast and alcohol aroma.  Flavor is nicely spiced with a bit of hoppiness in the finish.  Light alcohol noticeable but not overpowering considering the 10 percent.

Heres an absolute beast of a beer that will certainly sneak up on you if youre not careful. You can smell the alcohol, but you can barely taste it. It pours a nice light brown with a thin, light head. Too many flavors to describe in this one. The finish is warming and very nice all the way to the end. Highly recommended this fine Belgian tripel to everyone.

Maredsous beers are very, very decent. This one is my favorite from them. Dont really get why people would want to drink Westvleteren when they can drink this. I prefer the triple style over the brown styles, so thats why this one is my favorite from Maredsous. Nothing really wrong with it.

Hazy amber colour with medium white head,some lacing. Aromas of bread, yeast, bananna. Creamy texture and heavy body. Sweet taste with fruity characteristics. Alcohol is sensable (10%). Low carbonation. Classic belgian abbey beer

Poured a nice deep hazy brown. Smelled mellow and spicy, with notes of pineapple, raisin, bread, and alcohol. The taste was excellent - full of fig, raisins, sweet malts and caramel. The warmth of the alcohol provided a most satisfying palate, with a pretty sweet aftertaste. This one tastes as good, if not better, than it looks.

After drinking a Duvel, I had this the other night.  I really dont see what all the hype is about.  All the classic flavors of a Belgain are there, but they really taste disjointed.  Smells of ripe fruit mostly banana, wonderful bready.  I would have to say the yeast seems to have been the best that its going for it.  Nice array of flavor on the palate, finishes odd.  If the flavors came together better, that would excite me enough to rate this higher.

Bottle poured into tulip. Aroma was spicy and sweet with loads of malts and fruity flavors. Pineapple, mango, raisin, and other dark fruits make up the aroma. With a solid copper body and a cloud-like white head, this beer is quite visually appealing. Taste is crisp and fruity with darker fruits and malts predominant in the taste with a little bit of a dry finish. Some alcohol notes as well. Good stuff

750ml bottle best before November 2012. Hazy light orange, white head. Plum, raisin, some booze, and hops. Nicely carbonated, sweet with a bit of bitterness, get the plum and raisin throughout, very good finish. Has aged very nicely - prefer it over fresh.

Pours a reddish amber with a moderate off white head.  The nose is prominent but not in your face.  Full of straw, mild cheese, soy sauce, some grapes along with prunes and figs.  It has a long some what chalky finish.  The palate is very lively and has a lot of alcohol to it.  Flavor is not that sweet but sweetness does dominate.
33cl bottle. A nice beer. Cloudy amber pour with a big white head. Lots of nice malty fruity flavor. A bit too carbonated for my taste but still a top notch drink
Bottle 33 cl. Light amber colour with a light tanned smallbubbly head that is creamy on top. A fruity and spicy aroma and taste. It has a dry and somwhat bitter finish. A really good tripel

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2013 pours dark golden, slight haze, with a tall white head. biscuity, toasted malt, tons of malts, very fruity, fairly present vinous feeling, like white port, white grape and white cranberry juice, tingling alcohol. medium hopping - fresh floral and grassy hops. medium to full body, belgian yeast carbonation. excellent!

Whole Foods Market, DC 4-pack ($13): Pours a copper color, dark for a tripel, with a largish white head that sticks around for quite some time. Aroma is of fruits and plenty of yeast (more of an ambiguous BSA than a tripel in my opinion). However, I like this plenty. It is the kind of BSA that I like the most. Pretty sweet in the taste, but tangy as well. I think it has an above average hop presence. Has a little bit of a bite that prevents you from drinking it too quickly. I like it.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2012 Bottle 330ml, bought in Durban. Pours a light clear amber with a beautiful white head that seems to last forever. Slightly spicy with mild hop aroma. Taste was fruity with noticeable alcohol and a light pepperiness, finished very dry. All in all an enjoyable beer.

Bottle.  Pours a light coppery color (darker than expected) with a big fluffy head and aromas that are sticky with light fruit (pears and apples) and honey.  Flavor is similarly fruity and sweet with a pretty good boozy warmth and a little bit of a cloves presence.  This is darker in color and on the palate than most Tripels I have had and I like the departure from "normal."
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Amber, really good head.  Aroma is creamy with spice and vanilla.  Taste has fruit mixed with spices and honey.  Finish is dry, slightly bitter, and then sweetness coming through.  You can just tell the alcohol is there.  Its a good beer - even in the summer given its high alcohol.

het is een lekker biertje de fles ziet er specail uit het is wel een zwaar biertje er zit 10% alcohol in hij smaakt lekker naar hop en malt hij proeft ook bitter als je hem proeft smaakt hij in het begin naar een bbq smaakje daarna word hij biter en smaakt hij naar hop

[330ml bottle, The Bottle, York] Hazy golden amber with a fluffy white head. Rich, yeasty aromas with plenty of fruit. Big marzipan sweetness on the palate, hefty alcohol finish. Fruity at the same time. Warming on the palate [23052008]

33cl bottle from Bierzwerg. BB 01/2013. POured hazy orange with a dense white head. Aroma is yeast, spices and some alcohol. Flavor is surprisingly sour, quite dull, not much going on. Some caramel and fruit, alcohol well hidden. Quite a disappointment.
bottle - hazy beer with a nice head. Aroma has some spicy notes. Flavour is quite complex with a detectable alcohol taste. Medium bitterness. Medium carbonation.

Süßer und wässrig malziger Antrunk, in dem der Alkohol ersichtlich wird. Die Wässrigkeit wird nach kurzer Zeit überbrückt, das schwache Malz wird scharf alkoholisch, ein wenig Hopfen kommt hinzu. Insgesamt ist das Bier erstaunlich aromenarm für den Alkoholgehalt, einzig der Alkohol selber ist überdeutlich vertreten. Im Abgang schokoladig und angenehm aromatisch. 10/8/8/9/9/9

Beer poured deep amber, hazy with a dense off-white head. Head is mostly lasting and leaves good lacing. Pretty appearance. Aroma is sweet malt , yeast, toffee, fruit and spices. Flavour is sweet malt, toffee, fruit (light raisins) and spice with late moderate bitterness. Medium body, nicely tongue coating. Finish is long fruity, becoming woody dry accentuated by alcohol and moderate grassy hop bitterness. A very good and easly drinkable abbey triple.

A: The beer pours a golden amber color with a big khaki head on top.

S: Starts off with a lot of yeastiness.  Plenty of bread and fruitiness, definitely some banana and perhaps pears.  A mild hop aroma, which was a bit surprising, and a moderate spiciness to the beer.

T: Bread and various sugar flavors give an dominant sweetness from the very start.  A hint of floral hops as well plenty of light colored fruits such as pears and apples, perhaps some banana, too.  Yeast, spice, and alcohol notes round out the flavor.

M: Medium in body with a medium level of carbonation.

O: A little too sweet for me, but good overall.  It didnt really leave a lasting impression, however.

11.2 ounce bottle - $3.29 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Appearance: Pours an effectively clear, amber-orange body with a foaming, off-white head. Thin smattering of lace.

Smell: Sweetish nose crumpled with rock candy crumbs, pear-flavored liqueur, half-cracked pepper, coriander, and with an aromatic backdrop of solventy fusel alcohol.

Taste: Sweet, candy-encrusted pale malts along with a fruity, spicy taste of lightly tart pear upside-down spice cake featuring Bartletts. Grows a bit more peppery, hinting at bitter herbs as some medicinal alcohol leeches in. Faintly cellar-like yeastiness. Moderate bitterness. Finishes with a firmly warming embrace of alcohol to cut the sweetness, as does the carbonation prickliness.

Mouthfeel: Medium-plus body. Medium-plus, energetic carbonation. 

Overall: Maredsous 10 may leave you Maredsoused! Pushes the limit for me with alcohol, but fairly good in spite of it.
Very fizzy, lively liquid with slight foam. Sweet taste and aroma. Strong beer with long finish.

Zavaros, borostyán színe van, fehér habja nagyon kemény és igen kitartó. Illata gyümölcsös, fűszeres és élesztős, ízébe már némi fűszeres, narancshéjas játékosság is vegyül, élesztővel és egész komoly gyümölcsös komlós keserűséggel. Eléggé száraz, pezsgősen szénsavas és testes, az alkoholtartalom rejtve van, szóval vigyázni kell vele. Kitűnő sör, pedig az elég gyenge 8-as kipróbálása után nem vártam sokat.

(750 ml, shared with my good friend Rog)  Deep hazy golden with a huge rocky head that last forever.  A marvelous belgian lace sticks on the glass.  Plenty of yeast and fruits (slight banana and delicate citrus) on the nose along with faint spices and fair amount of alcohol.  Taste is again a fruity thing with some honey sweetness and a touch of pepper.  Alcohol flavors seems more quiet, a soft and spicy kiss.  Mouthfeel is more than average : the medium body reveals a high carbonation and a creamy texture.  Finishes a bit warm with some vague bitterness and some sweetness.  Not bad, really not bad.// (750 ml, zdieľal so svojím dobrým priateľom Rog) Deep hmlisté zlatý s obrovským skalné hlavy, ktoré trvajú večne. Úasné belgickej čipky palice na sklo. Veľa drodie a ovocie (banán ľahké a jemné citrusové) na nose spolu so slabým korenia a férové mnostvo alkoholu. Chuť je opäť ovocná, čo sa trochu medu sladkosťou a nádychom čierneho korenia. Alkohol sa zdá príchute viac pokojné, mäkké a pikantné bozk. Mouthfeel je priemer: stredná telo odhaľuje vysoký karbonatácie a krémové textúry. Končí trochu teplej s niektorými vágny horkosťou a nejaká sladkosť. Nie je to zlé.
Bottle. Color amber with small head. Aroma caramel, wine, alcohol, pear. Taste sweet, caramel, pear, alcohol.

Floral, slightly yeasty aroma. Cloudy light brown in appearance. Thick, off white head. Taste is deep caramel. A little hoppy. It masks its ABV moderately well. No sweetness at all. Dry aftertaste. Very fizzy. A unique tripel overall.
UPDATED: MAY 1, 2011 Strong and fruity aromas make this one a winner. Aerial taste yet charged in alcohol. Very subtle blend. Love it.

11.2oz bottle in a Trappist glass.  Pours deep amber with a thick, lacy, lingering cream-colored head.  Aroma of caramel, light fruit, spicy yeast, and a little alcohol and light hops.  Flavor a nice complex blend of all of these, with more of a fruitiness than a lot of Tripels.  Average texture.  A pretty good beer.

on draft..first time for this beer. aside from the long lasting head and the great lacing it just clung to the glass forever. the taste was a puzzlement. not quite your basic triple this was a bit different no nose of banana but a taste of cherry and apple or possibly the tartness of an apple. overall a decent beer.

Pours with an opaque orange color, giving way to a towering and resilient head that releases the smells of yeast, clove and fruits. Overall, however, I found the aroma to be slightly weaker than I expected  far less than a similarly styled Westmalle or Chimay. The first couple of sips come with a strong and somewhat unpleasant alcohol note in the finish. But, I found it pretty easy going after 5 to 6 sips. Aside from the alcohol, the flavor profile features a wonderful and somewhat tart funkiness, with hints of fruits and spices. Very nice tripel, but Ive certainly tasted better ones.

Oh yes. This is why I drink beer. An amazing aroma of wine fills the room when the cap is removed, before the beer is even poured into a glass. In the glass the wine aroma is still present, but also lots of floral and herbal hoppy notes, alcohol and a even a whiff of honey. The body is clear, dark amber. The creamy, white head is rather small, but fully lasting and produces excellent lacing. Initially light sweet and light acidic taste (is that even possible?), then light bitter. Finally the magic touch: the high alcohol contents creates a long lasting, mouthfilling, warming and honey-sweet after taste (similar to that of the Chimay Triple). Smooth, medium, almost syrupy body, with average to soft carbonation. The alcohol is maybe a bit too pronounced, but as opposed to the kick-you-in-the-face attitude of the alcohol of the Westmalle Triple, the alcohol of the Maredsous is more gentle and caressing.  [33 cl bottle, from Vinmonopolet]
Cloudy dark orange body with a huge white head. Bitter and a bit sour aroma, notes of flowers. Full bodied. Really interesting flavour, on the sweet side, with fruits and spices, namely pepper.

Big pour into Maudite glass. Giant bubbles cause the head to break up as it settles. Smell is strong Belgian funk (expected), some honey, . Huge, rich mouthfeel. Alcohol dominates. Incredibly hot. Almost some burn like you sipped on liqour (tequila) without the flavor of it. This is just so heavy. Sipping beer at a minimum. Hard to get past the heaviness, probably a bit too much for me. If paired correctly, this could be interesting though--maybe a very sweet flan, custard, or bread pudding.

Slightly hazy amber with a nice, puffy, thick lacing head. Aroma of yeast, roast, caramel, flowers and some spice. Taste is caramel sweet and yeasty. Crisp and nicely balanced. Medium-full bodied and lively, but not overly, carabonated. Good tripel.

p;ours a pretty ambergris with a clean white head; minimum lacing.  Taste is very well balanced - roasted caramel and floral notes going in, grows nicely to a lightly bittered carbonated finish.  Well after the finish, an alcohol warnth blooms in the mouth.  Good stuff.

I am usually not much on Triples but this was alright.  I did note a slight metallic not on the aroma but it was not overly distracting.  There are notes of honey, flowers, caramel.  It is a pretty pour with a frothy head and orange body.

prior to accidentally pouring bottom of the bottle into the glass the beer was a gorgeous bright red/gold colour, clear w/ some bubbles (it got hazy b/c of yeast in the bottle)
nose is slightly vegetably w/ some spicy cinnamon. not great. and no alcohol on the nose
med body and moderately fizzy (maybe too much so)
taste is some sharp coriander, faint vegetable w/ unpleasant bitter finish
not impressed

Beautiful orangey-brown ember-like appearance (until the yeast was poured in). Good head retention. A nose of pears and a fizzy lemon thing. Good structure and mouthfeel and very sour on the end. Overall the beer improved as the bottle progressed.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2011 11.3 on bottle capped with metal (not cork).  Pours a big, fluffy, dirty white head that dissolves in four minutes leaving a thin, layer covering the top of the beautifully cleanly translucent, amber body.  
Aroma is of wet hay, cough drop, and alcohol.   
Taste is medium bitterness and salty with very light sweetness and a lightly sour note.
Body is medium and creamy with a fairly long bitter finish and carbonation tingle. 
It may be a little "pale" and playful for my taste.

Bottle.
Hazy brown color, some off white head.  Aromas of yeast, some clove, and some fruitiness.  Very complex and delicious - one of the first Tripels I ever had and still way up there on my list.
Bottle. Poured a hazy orange color with a decent white head. Aroma was fig, plum and other malts and fruits. Flavor was raisin, apples and figs. Sweet molasses. Longer finish. Very good.
An alright abbey tripel. Nice golden colour, the usual complexities in flavour that one can expect from a tripel.

330 ml bottle in Germany. Med amber brown hazy color witha very full creamy beige head. Beer looks great. Aroma is a sweet candied apple with some hopps and malts coming through. Taste is the same but with a lot more bitterness. Palate is light and mellow when compared to the taste.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2013 The aroma of this beer isnt too complex. Notes of prunes and alcoholic smelling fruitcake are prevelant. It pours a light amber colour, with a off-cream head, that lingers decently. The initial top note of the palate is a crisp citrus, that leads into a more rich plum and finishes with a pleasant sweetness of some sort of candied rasin. Surprisingly lively and crisp for such a high alcohol content, and refreshingly different. A great pint.

330ml Bottle.  Pours a clear orange color with medium head.  Aroma is sweet grape, floral, and some citrus.  The grape character comes out as well in the taste with is accompanied by citrus, some grassy hops and a mild but noticeable bitterness in the tail end.  Mouthfeel is smooth with a sweet aftertaste.  Good Tripel.

11.2 oz bottle. New label. best by 07/2012.

It pours into my Duvel tuplip with a foamy slightly off-white head that fills up to the brim, though it is slanted, probably because of my pour. The beer is a hazy brown/reddish/copper/peach and there are tiny bubbled racing form the etched duvel D.

It is fruity, clovey, with an exceptions bit of yeast. The malts are there though subdued by the yeasty zing.

It is zingy and twangy with yeast in the flavor. The malts come out more in the flavor with a huge hit of breadcrust. There is a slight hint of lemony fruitiness too. A great tasting Tripel.

This beer kicks ass.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-14-2010 21:45:08

Gout Unique et très caractéristique, mousse aérée, Douceur fruitée malgré la forte teneur en alcool, Bière non brassée au sein de lAbbaye mais dans le respect de la tradition bénédictine, maturation de 2 mois en bouteille.

33 cL bottle poured into Maredsous chalice. Drank 2/15/11. Best before: 02/2013. 
APPEARANCE:
Pours a very beautiful deep orange gold with a hint of burnt orange hue to it. 
Off-white cream colored head is about 2 fingers with some chunky foam rising above the rim. Head duration is medium length. Most of head eventually settles, though leaves nice amount of foam on surface  much more than simply a thin layer of film like some other Belgian ales. Plentiful Belgian lace. 
Champagne-like effervescence  with carbonation trails all throughout the beer, instead of just at center or around the edge of the glass like most ales.   
AROMA: Belgian yeast, some spice, and vinous aroma  much more vinous/sour grape scent than most Belgian triples. Faint hop scent hidden behind other aromas, though difficult to determine more specific hop characteristics. Extremely faint grape bubblegum. Some alcohol on nose as well. 
TASTE: Belgian yeast and spice on front of palate. Subtle citrus and floral notes on front of palate as well. 
Mid palate is some vegetable and subtle grainy caramel malt. 
Back of palate and finish is alcohol. 
MOUTH FEEL: Highly carbonated. Quite dry. Drinks like champagne. 
OVERALL: Alcohol dominates over body. Difficult to drink. Far from quaffable. Others may enjoy, though, personally doubt will buy this beer again. Too champagne-like.

Small bottle. Hazy orange body - slightly darker than other Tripels I have tasted. Has a medium head that stays on. Aroma is modest but I can smell lemon and brown sugar. Taste is fruity and bitter. This bitterness covers the 10% of alcohol well but in overall, it does not quite have the perfumey complexity of other top rated Tripels. Finish is warming.
Didnt get a ton of bouquet out of this one purchase from a local bottle shop. The palate was very smooth and a bit floral but didnt linger very longer which is amazing considering its 10% alcohol.

caramel, biscuit nose, with a slight fruitiness. Initial tastes are of the sugary caramel, later of bread and a slight warmth from the high ABV. Aftertastes of slight bitter hops and floral notes. This is a smashing tripel, somewhat darker than the norm, and somewhat more robust, but really good.

Reddish golden colour, clearewr than youd udually get with an abbye, lightly fruity aroma, with light flowery hop taste that melts into a sweet caramel with spicy hints about it. Drink on a sunny patio.

750 ml bottle, enjoyed during the Superbowl. Straw yellow pour with thick, white initial head. Malt upfront with good Belgian aromas. Taste is peachy fruits with clove and soft malts. Good spice on the finish.
A little disappointed in this one. Aroma and taste are much lighter than expected from a big player tripel.

0.33l bottle. Pours a really nice dark golden body with a red hue and a fingersize white creamy lasting head. Strong aromas of apple, spices and alcohol. Almost a ciderish nose and some citrus in there as well. Really fizzing carbonation. Fruity with some peppery-spices, slightly sweet caramelish with a nutty flavor, and finishes with a long lasting alcohol and yeasty finish. The alcohol is almost to present in this one, and Is sure some one finds that a bit disturbing. Still, quite a nice tripel if you ask me.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2012 33 cl bottle, pours dark golden with a big white head, aroma of fruit, yeast and alcohol, taste is fruit, malt, alcohol and yeast, bit sticky mouthfeel, somewhat abrupt finish, ok but not really my thing.

I am sorry I cant find a positive attribute for this beer. Dont waste your money on this. I tries it at different temperatures and it is too phenolic at any temp. It takes away any positive attributes. Garbage. Drain pour.
Beers like this are why I do not pursue more ratings. 10 dollars down the drain? I cant go on!

On tap at Burp Castle, during NYC Homebrewers Guild meeting.  I have been enjoying tripels quite a bit lately, but this was something of a disappointment.  The malt was clearly present, along with flavors of stone fruit, and a touch of spice.  The hops could have been a bit bolder, and there was also a slight whiff of moldy funk.  The beer compared unfavorably with many of the excellent homebrews that were being passed around.  It wasnt bad, but I would like to give it another try at some point.

four pack pick up at earls liquor.  poured clear orange with a slightly off white head.  aroma was orange, passion fruit, pear, and caramel.  flavor was orange, caramel, honey, and floral notes.  medium body with high carbonation.

Poured into a snifter.

3.0 A: Almost clear dark orange color. Two fingers white head with below average retention and lots of lacing. Particulates hanging out throughout beer.

3.5 S: Yeasty and some spices. Aroma is weaker than Id like though. Still pleasant enough.

4.0 T: Good and spicy. Some lemon, orange citrus. Earthy yeast tones. Maybe some other fruity esters.

4.0 M: Medium body. Nice and spritzy like I like. Smooth enough.

4.0 D: Great beer, just not the best tripel out there. Could drink a few of these if given the option.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-13-2009 00:09:05

Colore ambrato pieno con bella schiuma cremosa e persistente. Al naso tanto caramello e sentori fruttati. In bocca molto dolce e sinceramente finale non proprio indimenticabile,  nonostante lalta gradazione mi sembri manchi anche un pò di carattere.
bread, citrus, raisin, golden, hazy, white foam, lightly bitter, medium sweetness, medium sourness, medium body, oily feel, lively, long finish,

Bottle sample. Pours a copper colour, with a white head and lots of lace. Aroma is soft and a combination of caramel and butterscotch. Very complex, its bitter yet smooth, and of butterscotch and caramel. Very nice.
Hazy light orange colour wit a nice white head. Fruity aromas with a spicy touch. On palate nice bitternes along with orange, sweet caramel and bananas. A nice find!

Bottle:
Big airy white head on top of a very light cloudy orange beer.
Smell fruit, banana, lemon, candy sweet, malts, light citric and a hint of malts and grains.
A sweet mix of fruit, banana, peach, malts, alcohol and sugars. 
Aftertaste of malts and alcohol.
Mid body, mid carbo and tingling mouthfeel.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: 330ml brown bottle. Dark gold colour, fairly clear. Nice foamy white head, good retention and excellent lacing. Fruity aroma, some alcohol. Flavour has a fruity start with notes of apple and citrus. Some bready malt, honey, yeast spiciness and light alcohol. Nice dry, clean finish. Medium bodied. Tight beaded carbonation. A fine tripel.

Bottle.Bronze with a small head and strong presence of alcohol. Surpisingly medium body which was a shock considering its strength. Strong mouthfeel and left some lacing. Needed an effort to drink it.

330ml bottle at home. 
Pours clear light amber with white head. Smells of green apple with some sourness, grass and flora. Sour taste with some artifical fruit, sour apples and floral hops. A bit on the sour side.

Erg lekkere tripel. 
Veraderlijk mild van smaak.
Drinkt heel lekker weg voor een tripel.
Mooie amberkleur

Unclear ,amber orange beer with ok head.Smell sweet malt,banana,cloves,apple,caramel.Taste strong,sour,light bitter,bread,alcohol,spicy,fruits,apple,pepper.Lon lasting finish.A spicy powerful beer.Very nice with food.

draft @ Blue monk, Buffalo, NY. deep golden pour, fluffy white head. fruity aroma of green apple, juicy fruit bubblegum. fruit & light alcohol burn upfront, followed by very flavorful tripel. Boozyness seems to take out some of the excessive fruity sweetness I sometimes encounter in tripels. Very nice

A really nice beer. Not the best tripel I have tasted, but still a very nice and very drinkable beer. Pour is golden orange body with a slightly hazy complexion. There is a sizeable two or more finger head. The aroma is very sweet grassy malts and dark ripe fruits such as apricot, plum and a little banana. Quite a bit of alcohol on the nose with a moderate amount of yeast. The middle is probably the best part of this beer. Smooth and sweet with fruity esters and floral grassy hops. Finished quite bitter and a slightly unpleasant alcohol burn remains. An incredibly light and smooth body is atypical of the style and of most high alcohol beer.

330ml bottle. puts a   clouded honey-amber ale with a puffy 2 finger white cap in the chalice.

Rich aroma of spice, apricots, leafy hops, musty earhty tones and honey sweetness.

Prickly carbonation on the tongue, very light bodied for an abby triple. Nice malty, sweet-spicy fruity front side to this, some citrus peel and herbalness, little complexety in the middle... goes quickly to a clean lightly bitter dry finish. Hides the alcohol well. 

A very fruity spicey citrusy dry triple, easily approachable and devilishly well hidden alcohol.

Bottle. Gold with a thick rocky white head.Mellow for a tripel, has the usual flavours youd come to expect but not as heavy as some. Has some fruity notes, Belgian yeast, almost a lambic type peachy aroma. Less caramel and sugar than most too. All in all, nice and drinkable.

750ml bottle. Clear golden amber with a thick, foamy, off white head. Aroma of musty wood, spices, sugar and noble hops. Fruity flavor with some sweet candi sugar, light sour yeast and light hop bitterness. Medium body with average carbonation and a somewhat sweet finish. Not my favorite Tripel but still pretty good.
Bottle. Pours clear amber with a off-white head. Aroma is fruity with notes of caramel and yeast. Taste is lightly bitter, lightly sour and light sweetness.
Smaller bottle. Pours small head that retains. Very sweet. Overall very good triple, cooked vegetables.

Poured from a 330ml bottle a rich amber color with a large white head that disappears quickly but leaves a nice lacing aroung the glass. Also some sediment floating around. Aroma of malt, apple, yeast and apricot. Flavor is complex with a sweet start and a dry finish. A lot of alcohol present but not bad.
J ai gouter cette biere en belgique, je ne suis pas fan des bière forte et donc je nen achèterai plus.
Very nice triple, pours well and a little dark for a triple but it is amazingly good recommended

Bottled.Cloudy orange color with a thick white head.The foam fade out quickly just keeping a lace. Aroma is complex, fruity with notes of Orange, citrus, roasted malt, caramel, apricot and alcohol. Flavor is strong, some roasted malt, toffee, apricot and alcohol. Mouthfeel is quite toasted malt. The alcohol was perceptible could be better if imperceptible.

Amber golden with an obnoxious 3 inch dirty white head. Caramel, molasses and wood aroma. Syrupy body. Heavy caramel taste, laking the distinctive belgian yeast character ususally present for the style. Sharp and fizzy character. Tastes more like a meal for monks in search of food.

Pours clear amber with a thick white head. Looks just like the 6. Smells great! malty, slightly fruity with lots of spice. Flavour is great! Spicy and bready with great champagne like carbonation and a spicy dry finish. Mildly sweet. This is a pretty decent brew, but I must say I feel that the 8 is the best by far.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2016 Pours very nice amber colour with a creamy white head. Aromas are sweet malts, fruits (peach, plum), candi and spicy hints. Average carbonation, medium body. Great Abbey Belgian beer, but alcohol overwhelm flavors..

Pours a golden brown with a 2 finger, very fluffy, head with very nice lacing.  Not much of an impressive smell, spiciness and some fruits along with the alcohol.  Nice taste, but not spectacular. Im getting a sort of metal taste, cant really explain it, but also some fruits Ive come to expect from tripels.

175ml bottle.  Pours a pale golden yellow color with a thin puffy whitish head that  fades quickly leaving an small collar and spotted lace.  Aroma consists of a musty yeast smell along with fruit and spices.   Flavor is spicy with an alcoholic warmth, some dried fruits, medicinal herbs and brown candy sugar. Herbal aftertaste.  A complex beer that is well balanced.
UPDATED: JAN 2, 2015 light caramel pour with a thin white head.  strong carbonation.  floral and slight citrus aroma. slightly sweet tasting, maybe some berries, slightly sour.  not bad.

Pours a brown colour, with an off-white head.
On the nose some milk chocolate, dried fruit and hint of mineral? Interesting...
It feels alittle high on the alcohol, having a "stinging" feeling in the begining. A long aftertaste and a good body, ending with a "musli" taste. Not bad at all, but the alcohol in the begining is alittle so/so
30th December 2005  Early amateur rating warning! Strong tasting beer. But pretty drinkable.
Pours a slightly dirty orange with nice white lacing.  Light aroma of citrus, flowers, alcohol, and yeast.  Taste is delicate.  Alcohol, malts, and citrus followed by hops.  Nicely done.

Very pleasant-tasting beer. Nice looking, too, with its amber glow and sticky lace. Smooth and creamy on the tongue; and it becomes thicker as it warms. Lots of spices and herbs, but theyre low key and balanced. Malts are slightly toasted and subtly sweet. 10 percent ABV is hidden very well. Not hot. Has a slight sourness, with hints of light fruit, that gives it depth. Overall, this beer doesnt dance and prance with flavors or aromas, but it still has a solid act.

Pours a nice brown copper color along with a creamy white soapy looking head.  Strong alcohol aroma & some green apple notes.  Flavor consists of sweet alcohol plus a touch of spice/cinnamon playing a part in the background.  Overall, its good and smooth to drink.

Hazy golden amber with a bright white head and excellent lacing. Bright fruit aromas - banana, lemon, date, apricot - as well as bready malt. A slight mineral quality creeps in. Flavors are similar, and include peppers, a slight warming alcohol, and candy sugars. Light body, lively carbonation, and a slight hops bitterness in the floral finish.
Hungary 2010, bottle. Hazy orange with a white bubbly head and lots of lace. Smells of cherry pie. Taste is initially cherry then sharp bitter, light sweet finish and long alcohol finish.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2016 Bottle at Beer Palace, september 27th 2015. Cloudy orange body with a thick white head. Aroma of fruity yeast, grain, vanilla, herbs. Taste of oranges, banana, candy, mild spicy. Dry and robust yeasty aftertaste.
From the bottle, pours a hazy orange with frothy, medium head. Quite the bouquet, taste is luckily a little more subdued. Pretty good Tripel.

From a 75cl brown bottle in Rome date best before 07 2010. Pours a dense amber with very long lasting white head and lace. Big malty aromas with some complex esters. Medium body with full mouthfeel. Finished a bit dry due to alcohol, not distracting though. Nice malty flavor with even dry/sweet balance. LAte alcohol warning. Very nice.

330 ml bottle at The Royale on their special night of tripels.  Pours a cloudy amber color with orange tints and a massive, rocky off-white head that laces the glass completely and sticks to it like glue.  Aroma of alcohol, Belgian yeast, spices, grapefruit citrus, floral hops, and caramel malts.  Flavor of Belgian yeast, grapefruit, floral notes, sweet malts, spice, and grains.  Alcohol doesnt emerge as much in the flavor.  Medium-bodied, with average carbonation and a yeasty mouthfeel.  Good tripel, but back-to-back with the Karmeliet, this one didnt quite stand up to it.

Aroma is big flowers, yeast, sweet alcohol, barnyard, nuts and leather. Maybe some oranges or apricot. Taste is lovely with dry, vineous and spicy characteristics. Palate is like silk, wouldve given it 6 if possible.
330mL bottle, pours hazy amber with a big white head. Aroma of sweet citrus, yeast, tropical fruit and honey. Flavour of tropical fruit, honey, yeast and hoppy bitterness at the end. Excellent.

Bottle. Pours with a large dense foamy white head over a clear red-gold body. Excellent lacing. Subtle aroma-taste of spices, tropical fruit, bread, honey, with a subtle, but lasting, bitter finish. Medium to full bodied and highly carbonated.
UPDATED: MAR 7, 2015 A sweeter tripel with some kick.  The missus really likes this one. Serving: Bottle

Enoyed it.  Distinctly orange peel kind of aftertaste.  Highly carbonated with little to no alcohol taste despite the 10%.   Mildly sweet with a mild bitterness.  Not extremely interesting but also not offensive.   Reminds me of Orval but without the champagne floral notes.

Poured from 11.2 ounce bottle into tulip glass.  Formed thick white head that didnt die.  Orangish golden color.  Aroma is slightly citrus with earthy yeast odors.  Flavor is sweet with noticeable alcohol, earthy yeast and citrus.  The flavor strikes a nice balance between malt, hops and yeast and is subtle enough that it doesnt overwhelm the taste buds.

Golden colour and a bit unclear. Has a lasting head, white. Aroma is heavy. Heavy sweet and fatty aroma, notes of over-fermented fruit and malt. Sweet flavor, more of the heavy fruit, bitter finish. Alcohol. Syrupy texture and more warming alcohol.
caramel, fruit,orange color,clear, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, salty, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, nice fruit and soft beer.
One of the best Tripels I have ever tasted. It has a dark yellow shine and an apricot and hop smell. The taste is very rich.
Golden orange in color... Aroma is citrusy... Flavor is strongly alcohol, citrus and candi sugar notes... Alcohol kind of overpowers the flavor, definitely not as enjoyable as other tripels Ive had

750ml bottle. aged 2 years in cellar. drank out of La Fin du Monde tulip glass. pours an orange amber with a massive frothy white head that has a yellowish tint to it. bouquet of spices and belgian yeast. taste is citrus, mainly grapefruit with some pungent yeast. very little to no bitterness at all. sweet malts make their presence but arent overwhelming. mouthfeel is thick with medium carbonation. alcohol is very well hidden, goes down smooth as can be at 10%. an excellent, and complex brew.
Bottle, although the alcohol does not hide with the flavor as other beers with the same alcohol percentage do, it is used wisely and gives the beer a interesting touch.

Dark hazy orange body with a thick white head. Spicy with hints of lemon and fruits. Nice yeastiness, and I like the fact that it is not overly carbonated. Sweet and smooth. It is surpisingly easy to drink considering it is 10% vol.

The pour is a very hazy, orangey copper color with a full, off-white, fluffy head which settles to a rocky foam layer and leaves soapy lace.  The nose is fresh but sweet for a tripel; light candi sugar, fresh flowers, some white pepper alcohol spice, faint orange citrus, and maybe a light anise note.  The flavor is similar with more orange citrus, still some sweet candi sugar, floral hints, a basil hint, and light grains.  By the finish, the alcohol warmth brings a woody dryness, an anise note, and orange and white pepper lingering.  The palate is warm, oily, round, and nearly full.  Not the most complex tripel I have tried but it was well put together.  The 10% in this actually worked to the beers advantage adding some spicy depth and a woody dryness in the finish, however still keeping a very drinkable nature.  Nothing earth shattering but a pleasant tripel.
Golden and cloudy with a creamy head and good lacing. Complex fruitiness, yeast, malt, sweet finish.

Sweet, winey aroma.  Amber-tinged golden color with a pillowy, off-white sea foam head.  Sweet but more dry.  A bit of bitter orange peel through the middle and a subtle spiciness.    Possibly my favorite tripel.

Bottle from LCBO and aged in my cellar for at least 3 years. Starts out mostly spicy, with the very carbonated and expansive mouthfeel breaking up the sweetness, but when the spiciness and carbonation relax, the beer finishes on a moderately sweet note in flavor and on the palate; The aroma is lightly spicy; Dark golden colour and quite clear; White head is somewhat creamy and is fed by a steady supply of carbonation bubbles, so retention is good, and extensive lacing completely covers the inside of the glass. Its a good example of the style and worthy of a decent rating.

Wild fruity nose, clear amber with light cream head. Definite sour & wild notes. Very balanced to say-the-least, and reminds me a bit of the Allagash line, in the sense of very well crafted, well balanced beer. Tasted from the bottle @ 45°F.

Cool bottle.  Pours slightly hazy, deep coppery orange, with a small light tan head, and leaves attractive sheets of lacing.  Aromas of caramel, toffee, brown sugar, alcohol, sour cherry, and raisin.  Sweet; brown cane sugar, raisin, cherry, and plum flavors are pronounced.  Slight bitter grass and yeast, spices, and alcohol are also present.  Finish is mildly sour.  Nice tripel; dark, sweet, and nicely balanced.

750ml bottles and on tap.  Pours a hazy, honey-amber body with lots of creamy lasting head leaving nice lacing.  Aromas of dark fruits, ripe plums, yeast, bready/malty/candi sugars.  Flavors are very similar to the aromas adding some alcohol, a bit of spicyness and some wheat.  Finishs slightly dry and clean.  Soft, active carbonation and a medium to full mouthfeel.  Great stuff available just about anywhere.
Nice, toasted cracker nose, touch of herbal hops, very light fruit. Taste is lightly sweet, lightly bitter with fresh floral/herbal hops, cotton candy and honey malts, along with golden fruit. Nice.

750mL bottle.  Pours a ever so slightly hazy golden yellow with a thin white head.  Aroma has lots of fruity esters, yeast, juicy clementine, some herbal, minty hops and a touch of alcohol,.  Flavor has sweet fruit, especially cherries, with yeast, medium sweetness, a tinge of alcohol burn and a bit of grapefruit.  Finish has a bit of alcohol burn and some bitter lemon peel.

Tap at Rattle n Hum. Good but not great. Pours a cloudy amber-orange with a medium, white head. Strong alcohol nose with some ripe fruits and caramel. Flavor is sweet with a little caramel, honey and scotch. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Warming. Booze was too prevalent as it drowned out some of the more nuanced flavors. Still decent, though.

Oh man, I wish the bottle I had featured the sweet label on the picture here.  Alas.  Poured on the darker side, a hazy golden orange with a big white head.  Nose is sweet peaches, yeast, and grains.  Bit of citrus and honey.  The honey comes out more on the taste.  Lively palate.  Bit of alcohol burn.  Solid.

Alcohol burn and figs.  This tastes way > 10%.  Great fig taste but a bit of candi sugar residue.  Very simple upfront.  And it seems like thicker flavors lurk but cant get over the abv and dried figs.

11.2 oz. bottle. Wheaty, grainy, spicy, dry aroma. Lemon, peach, and apricot scents. Also candy sugar, apple, and cream. Complex and appetizing. I keep sensing different scents. Really pleasant, floral, perfumy aroma. Pours a dark gold / brass / tan with a tint of copper. Some haze, though less than I expected. The yeast combines with the natural color to create a beautiful orange glow. Highly effervescent. Moderate to large amount of thick, uneven, cream-colored head. Good, extensive lacing. Great, very Belgian look about it. Boozy, buttery taste with deep spices. Tastes like a darker beer than it is. Fennel. Vegetal: Brussels sprouts. Eventually proves itself sweet, but far from cloying. Dry, bitter finish and aftertaste. Fizzy and lively in the palate. Medium body. Unremarkable palate effects beyond a slightly excessive fizziness. Like many other Belgians, it looks and smells better than it tastes, but, overall, its pretty darn good!

Solid Tripel, a bit sweeter than average but still redolent of many sub-flavors including its 10% abv. Some staleness/dullness here but perhaps due to the fact that the bottle was best before 10/09; will re-rate at some point!

Pours a hazy dark orange with medium amount of bubbly manilla head.  Aroma is honey, bubblegum, dough, and lemon.  Surprisingly light mouthfeel, bubbly on the tongue, sweet doughy malt base, slight dryness, lemon, and yeasty spicey finish.  Overall, nice beer.

Vanilla creme aroma,  with subtle peach and apple notes. Some light chocolate is also present. Actually reminds me of Cowtail candy. Clear amber, thick lacing head. Very musty apple flavor. Prunes in the finish. Alcohol fairly evident.

Thanks to Jared and Serge for hooking me up. I had to wait for this to come from Belgium & took 4 months. Also got some Westvleteren 12, which ill review in the next week. 
Poured a slightly opaque amber color with a slightly off-white yellowish head. The head was full at first but reduced fairly quickly. Smells earthy - woody and kid of musky. lots of alcohol. Also getting some sweet fruity and malty aroma. 
There is a fair bit of carbonation as soon as it enters the mouth. The taste actually carried into my nose. Slightly smoky flavor, with notes of rasin - i think there is cherry and banana back there somewhere. Definitely a lot of alcohol burn. I love how it transitions from sweet and bold to slightly bitter. kind of like taking a shot of bourbon and chasing it with an IPA. My last sip was about 15 mins ago and im still tasting it. A little over-carbonated and alcohol rich for my liking, but a fantastic beer.

Une bière triple dabbaye spéciale, gout très fort en bouche,  très houblonné et une amertume prononcée, qui fini longuement en bouche. Belle couleur un peu trouble. A aimer par rapport au triple fruitées.

Had from 330ml bottle from BevMo.  Pours golden orange with slight white had.  Aroma is of citrus hops, spices, and lots of malts.  Taste is of alcohol, malts, sugar, spices, fruits with very slight hops in the finish.  Pours fizzy with an aftertaste of alcohol and the smallest amount of bitterness.  Had in succession with Piraat and this is clearly a superior beer with the same alcohol content.  A very good tripel, but not the best Ive had.
330 ml bottle available at Total Wine Pembroke Pines, FL for $3.29 Very good!

(750ml bottle).  Pours amber-apricot liquid, somewhat hazy, with off-white head.  Aroma of herbs/spices/ginger.  Taste is sweet with underlying sourness.  There is some hop bitterness in the finish, but it is mild and quite smooth.  Got some cherry also?!?  I feel some warmth in my chest because of the alcohol, but it is hidden very well.  This is a potent, but very well balanced tripel. Excellent!

(Bottle, 0.75 l, BBE 01/2011) This one has been sitting on the shelf for some time - probably I should have drank it earlier. Poured amber and clear. Head was medium sized, white and it lasted for a moment. Aroma contained raisin, plum, fruitiness and honey. Palate was medium bodied, warming and dry with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, raisin, plum, honey, grass, malts and bitterness, Aftertaste was raisiny, sweet and mildly bitter. Perhaps because the aging conditions have been anything but optimal the beer had developed some carboard to aroma and flavour.
Poured nice orange colour with a white head. Aroma of fruits, spices and yeast. Sweet taste of banana and yeast. Nice beer.
Bottle bought in Belgien.Dark orange colour with medium beige head.Taste of spices and caramel,fruity with some carbonation,hint of vanilla and yeast.

Poured at home in a tulip glass. 
Very nice orange colour, cloudy with a persistent dark white/cream head. 
Very pleasant fresh aroma of orange, alcool and fruit...candied fruit with a light bitter background. Not too intense
Spicy sweetness of fruit flavor evolve in a more complex liquorice(once warmed a little) taste and finish with sour and bitter note. Medium body with moderate carbonation ends with light dry note.
Good Tripel. I was realy impressed as Ive never tried it before and I bought it by chance at Brussels airport.
Sweet, happy aroma with slight touch of bitterness. Deep brew, deep and complex.
10.05.20 clear copper white head.  A: Pear, spicy, alcohol F:Med body a bit acidic nice spice bouquet. I would definitely buy that one again.  Well made

Sampled at Vineyards in Ottawa (in 2005). Best before date is 09\2007. Pours a hazy peach-like golden-amber colour with a big creamy head. Nice thick lace and great retention. The head is also fast lifting and white. The aroma is heavy with notes of light fruits. Pasty mouthfeel. The taste starts off nutty and fruity. Very smooth and finishes with some bitterness. Apples in the aftertaste. Chimays tripel is still my favorite tripel, but this one is not far behind.

Hazy amber/gold color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of yeast, subtle fruit, & spice; Flavor of slight sweet malt, yeast, caramel, fruit, hops, and spice; Some alcohol at the finish; Nicely balanced & complex; Overall, solid tripel.

Bottle. Pours a good looking orange beer with a big white head. Fruity aroma with hints of orange peels. Sweet taste with fruity aftertaste. Also something in the taste that I recognized in the Maredsous 8. Good Tripel.

Very nice. Nice floral aroma and the obvious Belgian yeast-cool.   The taste is rich and deep, finely blanced swet malt which finishes crisp slightly salty and sour. And very deep copper orange, darker than I you normally see in the trips.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2010 Orange liquid, big off-whire head, disappears a bit to quick for me. Sour-bread-spided smell. Sweet fruity taste, sweeter then expected, lightly bitter aftertaste, this is not bad!

Bottle (33cl) from Vinmonopolet, Oslo. BB Dec 2012. Inch-thick white head reducing fairly quickly to a thin film. Clear coppery golden colour, some yeast haziness towards the end of the bottle. Lovely aroma of sweet ripe fruits, banana, butterscotch, yeast. Medium-to-full-bodied, slick mouthfeel, soft carbonation, surprisingly easy to drink at this ABV. Excellent balance, sweet at first, finishing on a more sour and bitter note.
